name: Mary Carter
text: Tracy is absolutely the best groomer we have ever had! She personally grooms every dog, and they are taken care of when it is their appointment time....very important to us.....they don't sit in cages for hours and hours being traumatized like every place we've gone to before.  Tracy is extremely LOVING and KIND with our pets, and has more than reasonable prices.  We have been going to Tracy for the past 6 years. So thankful to have found her!  Mary & Gary

name: Tracy Brooks
text: Tracy is fantastic!! And my Ellie loves her!

name: Kim Ziehlke
text: Excellent, highly recommend Tracy, she always does a great job!

name: Michelle Hammett
text: Tracy is the best. Been our groomer for years and loves all her fur clients.❤️❤️❤️🐾🐾🐾

name: Georgeann Hester
text:
Since I did not receive any comment or follow-up after contacting Pet Palace directly, I thought I would share my experience here. I boarded my kitty for July 4th weekend; it was her first time being boarded.

When I picked her up, she was skeletally thin, which I did not notice until I took her out of her carrier when I got home. Granted, she had lost a little bit of weight before I brought her for boarding, but not a noticeable amount. I had already planned on taking her to the vet as soon as I was back in town, but I was never notified during her time at Pet Palace that she was not eating (it was pretty obvious to me that she had not eaten those 4 days for her to be so skinny). I may have come back sooner to pick her up and take her to a vet or requested that someone drive her to a local vet at my expense. She ended up being diagnosed with Feline Infectious Peritonitis, which you may know is a fatal disease in cats. While I have been able to treat her for it, if we had known even a few days earlier, I would have been able to start treating her earlier, and she may not have been hospitalized for three days or needed a blood transfusion just a couple days after picking her up from Pet Palace.

I am not blaming Pet Palace for giving her FIP; this isn't the case at all. I'm just really disappointed with the lack of communication. I wasn't told even when I picked her up that she had not eaten during her stay. I hope that this is not something that happens to any future kitty parent who boards with Pet Palace.

name: John Wells Warren
text: Nick the Wonder Dog loves Pet Palace. He is my 14-year-old Border Collie who was the official church dog at St. Dunstan’s for 12 years.

name: Debbie Simril
text: Love, love, love Pet Palace!  Our fur-babies have always been treated with great care and attention.  I also love the ala-carte items that you can add for extended stays.  Professional and courteous staff!  Great experience every time!  Thank you!

name: Donna Stewart
text: Don't go there. I use to work there. The owner does not treat the animals or her employees well. Go anywhere else but pet palace. I am in legal trouble with the IRS because my tax form was messed up, the wrong SSN was put on my form, and she is refusing to help me. I know of an old Co-Worker who had to threaten to sue and go in with a Police Officer to get her last paycheck. She does not properly train employees on how to handle dogs. One time while working I got bit by a cat...my entire arm swelled up and felt like it was on fire! But she said it wasn't bad enough for me to go to the doctor.  She expects the groomers to groom 8 dogs a day! (at least that how many we did) and there was only 2 of us. It was way too much! We were so rushed for time that we could not be nice.......yeah they may come out looking nice, but your dog did not enjoy that groom. Don't go there.

name: Stephen Wilkerson
text: It still doesn’t sit well with me how this place handled my parents after they lost both of our dogs while we went on a trip! We had to cut the trip early after just one day, we come back to pick the dogs up after they were found and didn’t receive a discount or even an apology! We had to take the dogs to the vet and pay for diarrhea treatment and treatment of their paws! They paid for nothing not to mention the trip we missed out on that was very expensive! I wouldn’t recommend anyone ever use this place! Very unprofessional, uncaring, anything! Should have been put out of business long ago

name: Willie “BassMan!” Joyner
text: Great place for all of your pet needs.

name: Nonie Thompson
text: They cut all my pets hair off!!! Even when they had been grooming her for a long time! No communication- they had a photo to go by, and I had asked for one person always to groom my dog this day she did not! Very disappointed! Look at the photos I posted! 😳

name: Lori Cook
text:
DO NOT take your pet here!!

Thought it would be a great way for our (6) month old Aussie to spend the day -
Boy - was I wrong!

They are definitely not what they advertise -
Pulled our pup out after (3) days
And will never go back!

name: India Powell
text:
If I could give them zero stars, I would.

I took my Great Pyrenees to Pet Palace recently. She’s been there before so we assumed we would get the same quality grooming service.

When we picked her up, her fur was matted to the skin. I believe they didn’t brush her properly and cage dried her. Not only that - there was also a cut behind her ear where they trimmed her hair.

We gave them our number for the groomer to call us and they never did. We didn’t receive any kind of explanation or a refund, which would have been the right thing to do.

We ended up taking her to Moore’s Mill Animal Hospital (which also has a grooming service) and they were able to get most of the mats out. Some of her hair had to be trimmed on her back. However, they were wonderful and we’ll be taking her there from now on.

I am livid. The lack of professionalism is appalling and I trusted them to take care of my dog. If they can’t  find a proper groomer or have better practices for caring for their dogs, then they don’t need to be in business.

It was a very horrible experience and I wouldn’t recommend them to anyone.

name: Angie Ebosele
text: The facility was great. Ollie came home clean and smelling great after his bath too! The only issue was that I don’t believe they fed him his food that I left with him. He had diarrhea all night, and it lasted about 2 days total. The only other time it’s happened was when I first got him and had to figure out which food he liked the most. I called to see if they kept records after each feeding; she said no, but there was a note saying he had his own food. She even said her dog was fed boarding food. That means he was either fed the wrong food or had diarrhea because of something else.

name: Arcquanita Chandler
text: Great friendly service. My baby looked amazing and smelled fabulous. I will be back monthly

name: Alex Burkett
text: Awesome place, weren't super upfront about pricing. Not unreasonable just got suprised when I picked up my pups. Whatever they use to bathe your dog is incredible.

name: Julie Rutter
text:
If I could give negative stars I would. I boarded one of my dogs here a few months ago and all was well.
I have 2 dogs now & needed boarding while we went out of town for a funeral. I called and was told my adult dog could stay w/our puppy in the same kennel For one price, $27. When I dropped them off the same thing was repeated to me as I was contemplating separating the dogs. The girl assured me they would watch them the first day and if there were issues they would separate them and only charge for 2 kennels on the nights they had to be separated.
I picked them up on Sunday and was told they did great and were together the whole time. However, I was billed for a separate kennel each night. I asked the girl at the desk about it and she also happened to be the one who checked them in, quoted me $27 per night per kennel, not per dog and said she checked with another employee and confirmed they could share for one price. I asked her to call the owner because I didn't feel like you should write one price and charge another at the end. She called Jenny, the owner, and Jenny told her it was $27 per night, per dog. She  called Jenny back so I could speak to her and explain to her what I was told. Jenny saw it was her employee calling and she answered the phone "Is she giving you trouble? " I explained to Jenny who I was and what I was told. She talked over me, would hardly let me speak, told me I was confused and no one there would have ever given me those prices... Even though the girl was sitting right there apologizing for giving me the wrong information. She remembered doing it and still thought today that the price was per kennel and not per dog. She told me another employee also thought that. There were also three other customers in the lobby who heard it. I paid the full price but I won't take my dogs back. I've never seen an owner argue with a customer like she did. She was rude and disrespectful, as well as intimidating to her employees. I think her employees are young and just do what they are told. Several ex employees will tell the truth about Jenny and the way she treats people. She has lost my business, and that of my son and his 4 dogs. If that mattered to her she would have never treated me like she did. 😐 She's not the only doggie day care, boarder or groomer around here!

name: Kate Pickard
text: I have a very social Australian Shepherd, and I have never seen her so scared of anything. I took my dog there for a few stays around a year ago.  Her first "daycare" went awesome. They gave me a report card for her and she was happy and seemed to have gotten good exercise. I had pre-paid for a few visits because it was cheaper. Well, after her second visit there, I notice dried pee and poop all over her. They said that dog just pee in their runs and it is normal, but my dog is very house trained and would only pee in her run if she wasn't let out for the 8 hours she was there. Then, for her third visit she was shaking and WOULD NOT go in the doors. She was crying and scared and they took her by the leash and drug her in the back. I picked her up that night and she was crying and then she went out to pee and was trying and it was DARK yellow and very concentrated, like she had not gotten water all day. Whats weird is that after I stopped taking her there, maybe a few months later, they posted a video of her "barking," for national dog day. But that is her nervous bark and whines, not sure why they were more than happy to film her scared and crying. My only suggestion is if you have a dog that is active and likes people, maybe look for another place.

name: melinda peck
text: Love Pet Palace! Our neighbor recommended when we got a new lab puppy. She goes almost every day and can’t wait to get her collar on before we get in the car. We have been very happy with staff and care of our little girl!

name: Donny James
text: Everyone knows my dog when I drop him off and he bolts out of my truck trying to get inside. All I have to do is ask if he wants to go play with his friends and he goes crazy. He’s very slobbery, so I do the once a week bath they offer . I wish they were open past 6 so that I didn’t have to rush after work, but other than that I’m very happy with the place.

name: wayne dodd
text: Boarded my two Jack Russells last week. My cousin worked there a year ago and liked it, so I took my dogs there even though I usually don’t board them. The building was clean, I took a tour and was surprised how big the place is. Would definitely recommend and we’ll be back.

name: Kate Banta
text: I took in two matted Bernese Mountain dogs, a breed that doesn’t typically have an extensive cut when being groomed. The staff took such wonderful care of them and even though they had to be shaved down to the skin behind their ears and in a few other spots, you couldn’t tell one bit. They were so pretty when I picked them up!! Such a clean, welcoming place, and the prices cannot be beat for the level of care and service. I drove an hour to Auburn from my home near Columbus on a recommendation, and I’m so glad I did. I will continue to use Pet Palace regularly!

name: Joeretta Smith
text: My dog was a weekly bath client. The staff NEVER cleaned his eyes nor made sure that he was completely dry. His eyes were so bad after the last bath that the groomer had to literally cut most of his hair from around his eyes. I am SO disappointed at the service. I was warned not to go there but I thought that I would give them a try despite the warnings. NEVER again!!!!

name: Maureen Chase
text: I boarded my two dogs recently at Pet palace. I was very surprised how nice the place was for a kennel, and my dogs came home smelling great! They got a cute little report card from play group, too. My neighbors have used them for many years and they talk about how much they love Pet palace all of the time so I thought I'd give them a try. Glad I did. We'll be back!!!

name: Sophie Tullier
text: Staff is always friendly and upbeat when I bring my two dogs in. They always come home fresh and clean. We are very pleased with the time my pups spend at Pet Palace. Affordable, too!

name: Emily Waller
text:
*UPDATE* (at bottom)
I boarded my dog here (Pet Palace Inc. Auburn AL) this past weekend (06/14/18-06/17/18) for 3 nights and four days, including doggie day camp. WOULD NOT recommend, 0/10. First, they are so busy and understaffed it seems that they don't even take the time to relay any extra charges or changes in charges, they really want to sneak in those extra ridiculous fees. Second, they did not make time for me when I called for an update and were very short and even hung up on me before I was done. Thirdly and MOST IMPORTANTLY my dog came back to me INJURED. She had two symmetrical injuries on the side of her mouth. That they claim to have no knowledge of. They tried to blame my dog and then tried to say I don't know my own dog. It isn't an injury she could really give herself. They claim to have no knowledge of it or not have noticed it but I took her to veterinarian and they said it would have been bleeding and the bleeding on top of the noticeable swelling injuries on her lips would have been very hard to miss. So either they are lying, or they paid absolutely zero attention or care to her. Now she has to be on antibiotics as well as being in pain because of these people and their negligence. I will never come here again and I suggest to anyone who actually loves their pet, not to come here.

*UPDATE*: The manager at Pet Palace called my personal phone number that I had left as my contact number while my dog was staying there, to complain about the honest review I had left of my personal experience. They did refund me for the extra treat charges that were not displayed visually or verbally (they had charged me to give my dog her own treats that I had provided for her and made no mention of it when I told them). They felt that this small action of doing the right thing meant that everything else was fine. She claimed that I was putting false accusations out there. As mentioned above, a licensed vet had told me that the injury would have been bleeding (on her and other things) and swelling (she has white fur, blood and a swollen lip injury like that would definitely be noticeable if you are actually doing your job taking care of the dogs). When I claimed I could not talk because of work and had to go the manager did not want to take no for an answer and continued to try and argue with me about my review being "wrong". This is extremely unprofessional of a business to call and complain to a customer for leaving their honest and personal experience online for others to see.

name: LeejaClane
text: My 8 month old never met a stranger, but she's very quick to indicate when she is it is not happy to be somewhere. After her first day camp, I took her back a week later and as soon as she saw where we were through the window, she was overjoyed and whining to hurry up and get out. That's the highest praise in my opinion. The staff are friendly and professional, and you even get a report card when you pick them up that says how they did that day, both in socialization and whether they drank, slept, had fleas, and went to the bathroom outside for them. I highly recommend them!

name: Will Carol
text: My dogs love this place. We can't say "Pet Palace" at the house without the them getting excited and running to the door. The staff is really friendly and the place is always very clean. We've used them for boarding and baths, and our dogs go to play camp there a few times a week.

name: Jamie Burnett
text: Our sweet Petey Puppy loved this place!  All you had to say was "Pet Palace" and he was at the door waiting to get in the car!  He would run straight to their front door and bark at the person behind the counter until they took him back.  He went 1-2 times a week for day camp, he was groomed there and he was boarded there when we were unable to travel with him.  He required seizure medicines 2-3 times daily and they administered all his medications.  The girls that work there keep in touch as well as the owner and are like family to us because they loved our dog and gave him great care while he was there.  As with all businesses there's always something once in a blue moon that isn't quite perfect, and if we ever brought up anything, like he had a wet tummy one time after camp, obviously not their fault, as our dog LOVED water and probably dumped his bowl, but they apologized and dried him off right away so that he didn't get the car all wet.  They could have just brought us a towel, but they blow dried him so he was nice and dry.  Taking care of something like that makes me respect the business even more when they handle issues with a smile and make sure you are satisfied.  They truly went above and beyond, and when a business goes above and beyond like Pet Palace and they they have great customer service you can't go wrong.  Thank you Pet Palace and Jenny, Taylor, Marlie, Ciera and all the staff for being there when we needed you!

name: Kay McClain
text: I cannot say enough great things about Pet Palace. My dog LOVES it there! From playtime to special treats to special attention!  He is really picky about his friends and he loves it here!

name: Marissa Christin
text: We have left our dog here a few times once for a week period and twice for a weekend. The weekend experiences we didnt notice anything wrong with spunky and happy dog. This last time we left him for a week (07/22/19-07/28/2019) We noticed something wasnt right, he wasnt active as he normally was and all he has done is stayed in the same place, he had been limping or more so walking on the tips of his paws. My husband were hoping he shake whatever off so we gave it two days. Today (7/31/19) ended up having to taking him to the emergency vet, he seems to be extremely dehydrated, will not eat, is constantly shaking as if he is scared and is having a hard time getting on and off the couch or up the stairs. I left him at the vet and will give an update when i go back. But at the end of the day, we will NOT be leaving our dog here again!

name: r williams
text: I’ve been going to pet palace for 12 years, and my dog loves it there.

name: Emily Runion
text: I used to work at Pet Palace and if I could give this facility a negative star I would. The management is TERRIBLE and the manager screams at dogs and employees. There's not enough help to keep up with all of the boarders and doggy day campers and the ratings speak for themselves. I would never board my own animal here because I know it would not be treated well and they allow aggressive dogs to board as well. I was attacked by a dog nobody can handle and the manager refused to tell the owner the extent of my injuries. She tried to convince me that he was "playing". So no, this facility needs to be investigated and I would NEVER recommend boarding your pets there.

name: Kat Jarboe
text: When we arrived with our dog about a week ago for day care services, the very young girl working at the front desk was quite rude and unprofessional. She clearly did not have enough experience or maturity to understand how to handle herself in the role she was in on a busy day. I would not recommend this place because they seemed grossly understaffed, which presents issues with being able to provide proper pet care.

name: Madeline Choi
text: I boarded my animals here for spring break, and I also paid for my dog to get a bath before I picked them up. I picked up my animals and my dog walked out with urine stains all over her, including her chin -- which means that she was LAYING in her urine the entire time! I asked the employees what this was, and they said exactly: "Oh, another customer asked about that earlier. It's just our kennels." I took it as the truth and put my animals in my car. My dog smelled like urine ALL OVER -- I had to take her to PETCO immediately after so that they could bathe her properly. Also, my dog is EXHAUSTED and I left a bag of food for her to have for the week. It weighed the same when I picked her up, so they obviously did not feed her the food I asked them to feed her or they did not feed her at all. The employees don't care either. Don't waste your time or money.

name: Chardie1594
text: I am so disappointed at the service I received during the drop off for my two pets. I stopped in 2 days prior to drop off to inquire about my pets as well as fill out paper working I was greeted by one of the workers who was so rude to me. The following day I called again and whomever answered the phone was rude again, I'm assuming it was the same person from the day before, she left me on hold then hung up. On drop off day she was even more rude than the first time. In conclusion, I will NEVER leave my beloved pets there ever again. They are unprofessional and inconsiderate! In light of everyones rudeness, thank you Christian for your great service!

name: JR
text: Went a few months ago to get my dog groomed. She loves spa days but she was not herself when I tried to drop her off. This was her second time going here and she was not happy. She was  shaking  in the car and would not jump out. She started to whine when I left her making me very suspicious of what happened during her first trip. I have never seen my dog run to me faster when picking her up. I am so hurt as a pet owner and will never let my dog or my friends dog go to this place . They are obviously doing something to make my dog nervious.

name: Maya Branch
text: I was weary about this place from the bad reviews but i gave it a shot anyway. The first few times were okay until I picked my dog up and realized she had urine and dried poop on her. I addressed it with the staff and they made sure it didn’t happen again. Then I go to drop my dog off 11/11 and got attitude from the “manager”. Before we walked fully inside, she had an attitude and asked why was my dog there. No greeting, said it with an attitude and put her head back down to whatever she was doing. I preceded to ask if her day was going well and noticed my dog pooping. I tried to pull her out and she stopped. I apologized and asked the young lady for a bag and paper towels and she snaps at me to take my dog out. Which my dog had already finished bc it wasn’t much. She proceeds to mumble under her breath as she walked to the back to get paper towels and when she got back to the front, so I asked if she had an attitude and she says, “well I mean your dog just pooped and you need to take her out” and I said she stopped by the time I pulled her. That doesn’t give you the right to get an attitude with the customer which she had an attitude when we walked in. Not sure why as the staff loves my dog. Not sure if she was having a bad day but they just opened 15 minutes prior. Either way I will not be taking my dog back. You work with dogs all day so dog poop shouldn’t be a surprise. If you can’t handle that and good customer service then you need a new job...

name: Kellie Sellers
text: Probably talking about the same young girl at the front desk as everyone else, but both times I’ve taken my dog to this place, I’ve been met by an incredibly rude and inconsiderate girl at the front who acts like you are wasting her time and energy. They might should just work on their attitudes a little more and they might have more customers. Will never walk into this place again.

name: Mallie Taylor
text: Our dog was terrified to go here. He normally loves any type of animal daycare, so it was extremely unlike him to be so anxious. After reading the other reviews, it confirms my fears that he was not treated with kindness here. We won't be returning.

name: Forest Dewberry
text: $30/night

name: Lindsey Siggers
text: DO NOT TAKE YOUR PETS HERE ! I have never in my life been so disrespected by a manger of a business and I will not ever bring my dog back there. The manager was very unprofessional and yelled at me and my sister when trying to pick up my dog. That manager should be fired.

name: Cynthia Ross
text: I picked my baby girl up after 3 nights at Pet Palace around 10:30 am.  There was only about 1/8th of her food gone which surprised me. She also came from behind the counter acting totally not like herself.  She whined all the way home and the minute I let her out of the car she stinkied and pee peed. (always does both first thing in the morning)  When I let her in the house, she immediately went to the water bowl and guzzled down lots of water like she hadn't had any in a long time..  Both of these are totally not normal behavior for her.  The "best" part is, I picked her up on a Saturday morning around 10:30 and by Sunday evening she was coughing and sneezing.  Her vet said she picked up a respiratory bug from another dog and she needed 2 prescriptions that she had to take for 10 days.  (She wasn't around ANY other pets except the Pet Palace pets.)  I will NEVER use Pet Palace again!!!  Not only are they extremely expensive but they do not have good clean places for 4 legged babies to stay healthy.

name: Gracie Breitenfeld
text: The staff was really rude. They wouldn’t show me where my cat would be sleeping. When I picked him up he was so traumatized he started shedding mass amounts of fur and was in a terrible mood for days. I don’t know what they did to him but I’m never allowing him to stay there again. Over priced, with unaccomodating staff.

name: Hannah Anderson
text: Took our 1 year old dog for day care. When we picked her up, she was covered in poop. Thought maybe it was a fluke. Took her a second day & she was terrified to get out of the car. Then when I picked her up, she was again covered in poop!!!!!! She wasn't even there an entire day and somehow gets covered in poo and they don't even have the decency to clean her up.

name: Taum Hanlon
text: My dog *loves this place.

name: Michael B
text:
I went here looking for a place to take my dog for an occasional daycare. When I went to check out the facility, the staff was short with me and quite rude. I also asked if I could tour the facility to see what they had to offer and they said they would only let me see it during a couple of specific hours (pretty inconvenient ones) and that an appointment was also required during those times. It gave me a very uncomfortable feeling about the place. I figured they would be proud of their facility, but instead I thought "what do they have to hide that they can only let people see their facility a couple of times a week?" I left, went to another facility in town, and that facilities staff was very nice, honest and transparent. Although Pet Place has better pictures online, I would rather deal with more pleasant and transparent people, and just know I can check in and see what is going on with my dog at any time. I have never gone back to Pet Place, and I have never looked back.
tl;dr: Rude staff and sketchy policies.

name: Ray Wilson
text: We use to board here all the time until one of my dogs came home injured and the other acts like he had been hit. Seems to be ran by a bunch of teenagers or young college kids with no real adult supervision. We stoped boarding here over a year ago.

name: Blake Potts
text: I have boarded our two dogs twice at Pet Palace, and twice they were soaked with urine when I picked them up. If you love the idea of your pets sleeping in their own urine then this is the place for you.

name: Makenzie Bray
text: Very clean and nice!

name: Joelle LeRoy
text: I’m a former employee and I would NEVER bring my own pets here . Unsanitary and hostile environment.

name: Anonymous Reviewer
text: I used to work here.

name: Cari Parker
text: Shady loves the Palace!!!💘💘💘

name: Sunshine Always
text: Love them!! Very kind and caring. Jadda did a wonderful job on my Jace. Very busy ladies so call and make an appointment you will be glad you used them ☺

name: Linda Smith
text: I've only visited Pets First one time and was very pleased with their work! Very Friendly and resonable rates! Going back soon!🐶💙

name: homesteader fifty w/ martha
text: Our pup loves jadda

name: Joan Edwards
text: Jada does great with my girls

name: Donald Dill
text: Great people and experience

name: Kayleshia Thomason
text: I took my Bassett Hound for a bath and my schnauzer for a bath and hair cut. Their prices were much higher than I normally pay, but decided to give them a chance since they were new and closer to my house. DO NOT DO IT! This was a horrible mistake and I left crying. My Bassett Hound was a little difficult for them to get out of the crate. When I picked him up, he didn’t even look like he was given a bath or brushed. There was tons of lose hair I had to brush off when we got home and he still had stuff in his eyes. When I went back to pick up my schnauzer, I had already paid their hefty fee. My bill was $97. They brought him out shaved except for his tail. Not only is this not how a schnauzer is suppose to be cut, he has places there is still long hairs and places he’s down to the skin. When I asked about why they shaved him, I could not get a straight response. The receptionist said that’s all we could do and the groomer said that’s what the receptionist told me. They were not at all apologetic and rude about their mistake. Do not take your pet to this butcher shop of a grooming facility.

name: Jennifer Stovall
text: The lady (sorry couldn't remember her name)that owns or runs this place is awesome with dogs, her and her husband.  I was very pleased with my Sadie's grooming.  And they were great with her , cause she has bad anxiety issues and will bite when having her nails cut.  I highly recommend fluffy friends.  And we will definitely be back!

name: ck malone
text: I got a half done job of poor quality. My dog was terrified and not treated well. She still charged us for half and she was ill tempered. Don't take your problems to work with you please. I have never been treated so rudely. I will not be back. My dog deserves better than that. I never tapped on a window as you claimed. That was totally incorrect.

resp.text: Ma’am as I said yesterday your dog is too aggressive when it comes to even touching his feet. You were tapping on the window distracting him which does contribute to the bad behavior during a grooming session and my employee only sign did not catch the eye but it is up there for a reason. Dogs behave very differently in and out of the home setting and animal psychology is what we use here at Fluffy Friends. Thank you for your business we did discount your bill as promised being that your baby was cleaned. Only now needs a trim which we did give you a recommendation.

name: Justin House

name: jazzlyn glover
text: I have gone several times hoping it would eventually get better, but I have had enough. I take 2 dogs there - Malcolm and Charli. Charli has “lost” SEVERAL collars and today when I picked them up they lost Malcolms leash and said I must’ve taken it with me after I watched her walk away with him on a lease. My leash. Also, it looked like Charli wasn’t even cut - especially her beard which is what I wanted the most. Not to mention how unorganized they are. After dropping off today, several hours went by before they called and had all the wrong information - which i’m not even sure how they had the wrong information considering I watched the lady at the front desk write exactly what both dogs were getting done on a sheet on paper by their name. It is honestly not worth the money, I would recommend Petsmart. They’re more expensive, but they have always remembered my dogs names and been incredibly friendly and they do not lose their belongings. Very disappointed and will not be returning.

resp.text: I'm so sorry you have had a difficult time with us. I know excuses shouldn't matter, but I would like to explain and clarify...  I believe your leash was accidentally placed in the wrong cubby today, and we have it at the desk. Being short handed today put our bathing a little behind schedule. We were a little confused on the notes because the length we have on file didn't take much off of malcum, which is why we called to verify. Also, we would love a chance to fix Charli's groom. We only had her down for a face, feet, and hygiene; not a full body cut, but would be more than happy to take more off her face. Sorry again about the confusion. We will be in touch to discuss further if you like.

text: Took my doodle Reesee here yesterday for her very first big girl Groom and I am in Love! I was so nervous about how she’d look and my husband and I are both very pleased that they took the time out with our busy body! She looks amazing!

name: Marye Mcmeans
text: After verifying an appointment two different times when we arrived there was no record. They agreed to work our puppy in for the day.  I called to verify he would be ready and was told to be there at 5 pm, no later.  I showed up at 4:45 pm after a 45 minute drive and was told it would be another hour.  3 different employees that did not provide any customer service and were extremely rude!  Owner stepped in but it was still not customer service you expect. Disappointed!

resp.text:
I'm so sorry you had a bad experience with us. We have recently had to hire several new employees due to the rise in demand. Because it was our scheduling mistake,  I agreed to still keep and groom your baby, along with our already full schedule, knowing it would make for a longer day for us. I explained to your husband during drop off, it might be around closing time before he would be ready, and he was fine with that.
We try our best to accommodate all of our clients accordingly, and provide loving care for your pets as if they were our own. Sometimes that means we have to spend a little more time with nervous or scared ones, which often means we are working past closing. We apologize for the confusion, but what our staff was trying to say when you called was that even though we technically close at 5pm, we stay until the job is done. We always tell our clients to feel free to call and check in, however we will text when ready finished. We have several clients that travel from different areas and if we know at check in, we can get those pups done first.

Shaggy Chic operates differently than most other salons. We allow for a fun and enjoyable experience for the pets that come in, instead of sitting in kennels all day. Because of this unique service, and our goal of providing a high quality groom for each individual pet, our finishing time varies. If mistakes are made, all we can do is try to accommodate accordingly and handle it to the best of our ability. Thank you for giving us a try, and hopefully you will give us another chance in the future.

name: Tracy Kimbrell
text: Everyone here is always so friendly and nice. I am very picky with my dogs groom and they have never disappointed us! If I could I would give them 20 out of 5 stars.

name: Nedra Harris
text: They ALWAYS do a great job with HoneyBun!

name: Beth M
text: I am not sure who love shaggy check more… divO or myself. It is a hidden dream for any pet owner.  Daycare is the best.

resp.text: We love our Divo! Thank you for the sweet review 😉

name: Joe Bertschinger
text: My boys have been treated well here.

resp.text: Thank you! 😉

name: melvin Young
text:
We were one of the fist customers to come to tonya when she opened. We have 15 dogs so we was bringing a substantial amount of business to her. We are an African American family and expect the same understanding as anyone would. We had an issue with one of the hair cuts and mentioned it and things changed immediately. It seemed we were not welcomed there anymore. Tonya would not return our phone calls so we stopped come. Now we tried to give her a second chance to get our business and we called 2 days straight and she will not take our phone calls or even call us back. Very bad business ethics if you ask me. You just don't treat people this way.
Especially with everything that's going on all
Clients should be important but it's not that way with this busy I'm sorry to say.

resp.text: Let me start by apologizing for feeling unwelcome. Our goal is to provide the best experience possible for each pet and their family when coming to Shaggy Chic. With this being said, when you first started coming to Shaggy Chic, I remember going above and beyond to configure a special discounted rate based on you bringing all 15 dogs in for grooming. After agreeing on this price, we have only ever seen 6 out of 15. Out of the 6, only 4 were brought in more than once. No other client has received special discounted rates for having multiple pets,  however, I made an exception for your family. I simply can not be expected hand out discounts for owning multiple pets. We are still doing the same amount of high quality care to each individual pet, and I still have to pay my staff. Let me also say that we have never given any client a hard time when asked if we could change something about their pet's hair cut. Every client has their own vision of how they want their pet groomed, and we always do our best to comply with each unique style...  As for me not returning phone calls, I am a very busy person running a small business and also grooming dogs full time. This is why I have a receptionist to answer the phones and schedule appointments. It is unfair to say that just because I have not had a moment to return a phone call, that means we have "bad business ethics". My receptionist has been more than willing to answer any question you may have, as well as schedule a grooming appointment. However, you have refused to discuss with her. We try our best to please every client that comes through our door. Nevertheless, we are only human. If you are not happy with our services, then I recommend finding another salon to take your pets to.

name: Winston Waid
text:
Thanks for finally responding. If by settled your mean the check your insurance paid out 4 weeks later that covered the em regency vet and ONE of many of our vet follow ups than yeah guess “settled” in eyes of the law. Also by Alabama state law you would have been better off killing him in your carebecause unfortunately as of now Alabama state law classified him as a possession and worth retail price. But we just want to know WHAT HAPPENED!!!  I’ve done my research this will go away once I find out what happened to our sweet baby. And everything I have stated is factual. Did happen and have all the proof. Contact me and tell me what happened and I’ll remove review. Even though you should be shut down for allowing something like this to happen on YOUR watch.

Added a photo of him leaving emergency vet.
Still no idea how it happened.

Update: 8 months later our dog still having comlpications from injuries sustained here. Hope she’s done something to help protect little dogs because we still have no idea what happened. It not about the money tonya. We want to know what happened to our little guy. I pray this never happens again to another dog.

Dogs stayed 8 hours. Got back with 3 broken ribs!!!!
We dropped off our pups on 9-19-18. Dropped them off at 8:30 am. Well finally at 6 pm we go to get them and one is acting weird. Took him to emergency vet. Long story short he had 3 broke ribs on left side and trauma to eye and face on right side. Nicely asked Tonya about what happened and I don’t know is the only answer we got. She has cameras but of course apparently did not work on that day but they do now. Spoke with her nicely multiple times. Well her insurance paid our claim but only for medical expenses and denied the reimbursement for the groom because Tonya the owner denied to them anything had happened. So when I got frustrated 3 weeks later I went to the place and let her know I was frustrated without yelling or cussing like I wanted to do from day one but did not. Next thing I know cops are there bc her helper called saying she was scared for her life. I have all of this on audio record. If anything Tonya yelled at me when I calmly stated would go public if did not give me my money back bc something happened to my dog in her care. Today is oct 15. We got ins check but no reimbursement from Tonya. Just asked her about it and was told to quit harassing her. Well to this day we still don’t know what happened. But something did because when we left the dog was fine at 8:30 A.M. and picked up at 6pm he was not. Dog was in constant agonizing pain for over week and half. Our vet is the only reason he got any relief until healed because she would sedate him for us. If he wasn’t sedated he laid down staring off in space constantly crying. We’ve used this groomer for 3 years. Don’t think she would intentionally hurt any animal but the fact is he got hurt while in her care and this whole process is completely unprofessional and cannot believe we are getting treated how we are when it’s my dog that has had something happen to him under someone’s else’s care. I’m sorry Tonya but “ I don’t know” is not acceptable when you are dealing with people’s animals. Even though apparently I’ll recieve a law suit for writing this. People need to be aware of what dangers could happen. An animal is a piece of property in the eyes of Alabama state law. Unless you have video evidence you are lucky to get medical bills paid back to you. Never leave your animal at any groomer. Especially a big chain. Thought we were safe dealing with someone we thought we could trust. Will never make that mistake again.
Thank you Tonya for a wonderful experience. Wish I could work somewhere that if I provided a horrible service I could keep the money.

resp.text: This review is inaccurate, and this issue has been dealt with 2 YEARS AGO, when it happened. For the last time, there was no significant situation in which we questioned injury or discomfort while in our care. IF something happened to your dog, he did not show signs of pain/ discomfort at any point during the Grooming proved. I'm sorry that isn't the answer you want, but it's the truth. Therefore, we have nothing further to discuss. You have been Trespassed from Shaggy Chic2 n, and should refrain from posting on any Shaggy Chic related website. Any further communication will result in legal action.

text: Love them! Since I've lived in Huntsville I've always taken my poodle here. The only irritating thing is that I had to call from someone else's number because I have an out of state number, which they never return calls to.

name: Kimberly Sexton
text:
B-Mar Poodle Palace

It is few and far between that I would ever leave a bad review for a company. I always try and understand why I was unhappy with a situation and usually give them at least one more chance before I make up my mind on whether or not I would use them again. Even at that point- I keep my opinion to myself, for the most part.

However..... I'm beyond disappointed with an experience we had today. For 3 years now, if not longer, I have been taking my Shih-Tzu to B-Mar Poodle Palace off of Lily Flagg, here is South Huntsville. Drop off is in the AM between 7-9 and pickup is after 2. We dropped Bailey off and then got wrapped in our day. At 3:18, I got a text from there asking me to pick up Bailey- that she was suppose to close at 3pm! Well- unfortunately we totally forgot! We were so busy and lost track of time! I was clear across town at the time, and when I got ahold of Chris he was leaving right then to get him. He picked up Bailey at 4pm, and apologized several times for any inconvenience! Poor Bailey was shaking like a leaf! Chris said he was so scared!! 😢Well if you know Bailey- this is not him!! His tail wags a mile a minute! He loves people, and especially when he sees one of us! The lady then charged Chris and extra 20.00 and told him maybe next time they would be on the same page for pickup time. 😡
This is the FIRST time we have ever been late to pickup Bailey, EVER! And worse- I must have sent her at least 10 referrals in the last few years! I'm so mad, and so sad for Bailey. I'm not sure what that lady meant by "next time" cause that was surely our last!

I am in no way justifying that is okay that we were late to pick him up. But we run a small business as well, and there is no way we would ever treat a customer that way, that was late to pick up.

She has also now offered a full refund and told me to get a new groomer- however, my concern lies in why she would give a full refund, if she didn't do something WRONG! :(

name: Cami Jennings
text: Took my two pups here today. They went in for their temperament test for daycare, and I tried to warn them that one of my dogs gets overwhelmed easily on leash. They barely greeted me, and took them without asking any questions and threw them into a fully packed yard without reading their charts. My pup must've gotten too overwhelmed and she started to get protective. The main man at the daycare came out and yelled at me, pointing his finger in my face, and saying rude and abrupt things. I doubt this would've happened to others, but he seemed to think he could get away with it because I'm a young 20 year old girl. Would not recommend this place. I thought that they would at least try to work with my dogs because that's their job but they didn't. Treat your customers with respect.

name: hillary lemley
text: Horrible. Horrible service also. My dog stayed with them for 4 days and came home with BLOODY feet and they didn’t even tell me. I had to call back the next morning. I spoke with the owner and she basically blamed my dog, saying she couldn’t sit still. I’m sorry, but she plays at home constantly, and has never came home with slashed paws! I had to take her to the vet the next day and now she’s on several medications to help her heal. AWFUL. Do not take your pets here!!

name: Paul Brasfield
text: Such a nice facility where the owners and the staff genuinely care for your pet.

name: Brittany Ball
text: HH is the best of the best! My shy German Shepherd loves it here. I will never take her anywhere else.

name: Melissa french
text: Excellent facility. Our dog absolutely loves it. The owners and staff are great and very attentive.

name: Susannah Lamon
text: Love this place! The staff is friendly, and the grounds are so nice!! I've taken my pup to quite a few places in Birmingham and this is by far the kennel we feel the most comfortable and she seems the happiest staying. I can tell she plays all day because she comes home just absolutely exhausted. Great place!!

name: Stephanie Baj
text: We love HH Farm! Would not trust anyone else with our girl.

name: Stephanie Casterline
text: We have used Howlin Hollows multiple times for our two dogs when we have gone on trips. The facility is immaculate, clean and beautiful.   The large indoor kennels are amazing with glass doors that the staff write special notes on about our dogs. (If they have a special treat etc)   There are several different areas the dogs can run and play set in beautiful shaded woods and hills. They have a doggy swimming pool that is ionized and a water feature water fall.  It truly is a vacation for our  pups!  Its so comforting to know our dogs are being so well taken care of when we travel!

name: Amanda B
text: Been taking our doodle since she was 6mos old. Everytime we pull up, she squeals with joy! Always worn out when we pick her up too (hooray!). We tried other places too and while perfectly fine for socializing,  after she was full grown, their "runs" just didn't accommodate her activity level needs. Howlin Hollows offer plenty of room to run (or relax!). Great staff, too.

name: Becca Fulmer
text: We searched around the greater Birmingham area for approximately 3 months before we found a place that we were comfortable leaving our pup with. Whereas other kennels and boarding places keep your pet in cages for a large part of the day and rotate them out during the day to play, Howlin Hollows has multiple, large fenced in outdoor areas for your dog to play in all day. All day!! They also have a zero entry pool for your pup to jump in and cool off. The actual kennel facilities are amazing. No cages. You really should at least tour this place before making a decision about whether it is right for your pet or not. It is especially great for high-energy dogs, and dogs that either really enjoy playing with other dogs or that you would like to socialize more. Our pup started off very timid and is slowly becoming much less shy around other dogs. Feel free to contact me personally- i'm happy to share more about my experience with this place.

name: Chuck Schroeder
text: This is like having my dogs at my own house but they get to play and swim in the pool ALL day with other dogs. They get to socialize constantly which in my experience ( 5 dogs) is what most dogs are lacking today. They come home with such a passive demeanor, kids do not have to worry about an aggressive dog and when you walk your dog they would try to play with a passerby dog, not try to pick a fight. Its the owners fault the dog is aggressive- LACK OF DOG SOCIALIZATION!!! Give them a try, you will be thrilled, but your dogs will love it more!!

name: Cynthia Wingard
text: In 30 plus years of marriage  my husband and I have never boarded our dogs when we go out of town always asking family members to care for them or getting a pet sitter. We heard about Howlin Hollows Dog Farm , toured the facility and started trying out the Day Care for our 3 dogs. We were so impressed we've already boarded them twice and couldn't be happier with the care and attention they received!! Kimi and Scott obviously love dogs and take care of their "guests" like they were their family.  I am so happy we can now take our dogs to Howlin Hollows Dog Farm when we travel and have complete peace of mind about the care of our 4-legged children!!!

name: Carlos Enrique Aleman
text: The best place for our Lulu.

name: Betsy Reamer
text: Our favorite place in town - whether for a play day or for boarding, we trust Sadie is having the best time and is very well taken care of. When we pull up, she knows where she is and can't get out of the car fast enough! We love everything and everyone at Howlin Hollows!

name: Heather
text: This is the BEST daycare / boarding facility in the state! The owners are huge dog lovers and all-around good people. The in-ground dog pool is amazing! Your dog will love Howlin Hollows! A++

name: Josh Champion
text: This place is phenomenal and takes great care of our dog!

name: Betsy Reamer
text: We've absolutely loved this place since the first time we took our 12 week old puppy to board her. We've never experienced anything less than the highest level of service and care for our sweet pup. We feel like we're doing her a disservice if we don't take her out there at least once a week because she loves it so much! She gets to run around and swim, and she loves the owners like they're her second parents. Don't discount this place because of 1 review where there are 2 sides to every story and people who have reviewed without ever stepping onto the property. We've been fans of Howlin Hollows from the start and not one thing has made us waiver from our initial feeling. Thankful to have them as a part of the community and as a weekly resource!

name: Jason Lovoy
text: Love this place. You have to see it to believe it. I now recommend to all my friends when asked where in Birmingham to board their dog(s). Whether you have a big dog or little dog - there is a place for them (we have a little dog - but you never have to worry about them getting plowed over by the bigger faster dogs as they have separate places to run.)

name: Ryan Ramage
text: Great place for our dog and not a prettier place around.  Our 13 year old lab loves lounging around the pool and playing in the numerous yards.  Owners a true dog lovers!!

name: Jordan McDonough
text: My dogs love coming here. We always get them back happy and exhausted from all their play. Wonder facility that really cares about dogs!

name: nate Allen
text: EASILY the most beautiful pet care place I've ever seen. I mean off-the-charts nice. Hell, I wish I could stay there. Seriously, it's that beautiful.

name: Jackson Tate
text: Unbelievable place!!! I not only wanted to drop my dog off there, but I wanted to stay there myself for the weekend! Absolutely spectacular establishment and wonderful staff!

name: Mike Schmidt
text: Seemed like a good place. Left the dog for a week. Supposed to get a bath last day. On pickup they said he chased another dog - he does NOT start fights with dogs.  No bath. Said he showed his teeth. He gets regular baths at Petco and others who board him with never an issue.  Add it up, someone likely mistreated him. Would reccomend somewhere else, especially for 40.00 a day and you supply food. Head to take dog to vet.  Has injuries around his eye.

name: Don Gaston
text: I have been using Howlin Hollows Farm since March of this year for my dog's boarding and day care and the results have been exceptional. My wife and I have been looking for a place like this for years where your dog can run and just be a dog. Rosie, my brittany, is a high energy dog that needs plenty of exercise which she can get at Howlin Hollows. Scott, Kimi, and the entire staff go out of their way to make sure your dog has a pleasing experience. The facility is first class and always extremely clean. Birmingham has needed a place like this for your pet for a long time.

name: Shannon Hughes
text:
Howlin Hounds is a lifesaver for me!!  Lokie stayed there a week while I went on vacation and he had a better time than I did!! Lol. They have acres of fenced yard for him to run plus a swimming pool that he loves!!
He goes to doggie daycare a few days a week. The facility is clean and the staff is amazing!!! Thanks guys!!

name: Jane Kemp
text: I have 2 small dogs who have stayed at HHF several times. They even stayed while I was recovering from surgery. Kimi and Scott have been amazing with them. This is the only place my dogs will walk into without shaking their fur off. They LOVE Kimi & Scott!

text: Amazing new facility and tons of outdoor space.

name: Steve Serra
text: Fantastic facilities and super owners. Thanks

name: LoonaTheFluffyCat :3
text: Hey so I have been here all day with my mom and she was very kind to the customers while the building doesn't look professional it is.. I have seen how my mother grooms the dogs but I suggest for  the owners to brush your dogs especially if they are long haired.. If your dogs fur gets matted up enough then it can be life threating I mean no offense of course its just a suggestion.. After they bathe the dogs they let them dry and groom them and then they spray them with a scent that is indeed safe for dogs.. You just need to find a good groomer :)

name: Candra Perry
text: I really recommend this grooming service. My baby Royce Lorenzo had his first trim and bath there  and she did exactly what I asked her to do. I was very happy with how everything turned out. Very laid back people with great hearts! I really look forward to bringing Royce Lorenzo and his brother Red Francis all the time. Royce was very happy and he smelled so good thanks guys☺️☺️☺️☺️

name: Tipsy Toyota
text: Absolutely lovely couple that runs this! They do great work!

name: Hollianne Craig
text: Mrs. Rhonda is the best around! Piper, Ezra, and Petey love going to get groomed! They always look and smell fantastic when I pick them up! Plus, they put cute bandanas on them when the dogs are all done! I’d recommend them to anyone looking for a good groomer!

name: Alexis Hale
text:
I took my dog here about a week or so ago and from the outside it looks great, but the second you walk in it’s completely unprofessional and messy. First, they told me that “due to covid” I would have to place my dog in this little kennel that didn’t even have a solid bottom so I’m sure it was hurting his feet. I then go over to the counter and they proceed to show me a piece of construction paper that has what looks like pieces of a rug glued on with numbers written in sharpie and there were only 4 blade length options. Most other places I’ve been show you what seems to be an endless option for lengths. I pick the one I like the best and tell them. They couldn’t give me a time because they said it depended on how easy the dogs were to groom. The price also went up if the dog was difficult to groom. I leave and get a call around 1ish saying my pup is ready. There was a sign that said they begin to charge after the first 30 minutes I believe after they call. It’s seems like they are doing anything they can to get some money. I show up and my dog is still in the kennel and I go and get him. He practically jumped into my arms, crawling up my chest. I go over to the counter and pay just to get him home. I got home and began looking at him and he was all choppy and messy. There we’re places that looked like they had gotten too close and we’re almost bleeding and places where he was just so choppy. I also noticed when I got in the car THEY DID NOT BATHE HIM!!! Hair was flying everywhere, and come to find out their “bath” is spraying the dog with dog perfume. We went back up there the next day and explained to them who we were and what had happened and the lady was extremely rude and wouldn’t give us ANY of our money back and blamed all of the places where he was skinned up on “hair disease” (we take him to the vet regularly, HE DOESN'T HAVE HAIR DISEASE).

Needless to say, I will not be going there again and don’t advise you to take you’re dog there either. Other places are more expensive, but it’s worth it to pay the more expensive price and get the best quality of work!!

resp.text: I am sorry you were not satisfied with our services.   Although I do wish you had posted a TRUE review.   Yes, we do have a cagebank in the lobby so that we. An have no human contact for your safety and ours.  This is what was required for us to reopen after the shut down.   Your baby was immediately taken out as soon as you left and the lobby was empty so that we could enter and taken straight to the tub for his bath.  You were told in advance that we groom them in the order they arrive and thst we'r woukd call you when he was finished.  There were several others that had arrived before you did.  Once your dog was finished, he was placed back into the lobby for you to pick him up and you were immediately called.  When you arrived,  the first words out of your mouth was how good he looked.  You were not charged any thing extra from the base price you were quoted.  You were simply told when quoting a price on the phone that thst was the base price provided he was not extremely matted, have fleas, or behavior thst made it take a lot longer to do the groom.   You  did not come back the next day.   Your grandmother did and told me you woukd not come.   She showed me a couple of small spots that I had no problem fixing while she was there, but all she kept saying was that you needed a refund because you needed the money for your trip.  I smelled the dog and condemned thst he smelled good (she agreed) but I also offered to rebath him.   Yes there was a small red spot  where he probably had a little clipper rash.  I  told her I could make a note not to cut as short there nwxt time because he was probably a bit more sensitive than other dogs.   (Have no idea where the words "hair disease" came from.)  Anyway, I was as polite as I could be the whole time.   I offered to fix what you didn't like if the hair cut.   I offered to bathe him again and I also offered a discount on your next groom.   But all your Grandmother kept saying was that you needed a refund because you needed the money for your trip.  And that if I didn't refund your money you woukd be giving me a bag review.  I  spent time grooming your dog and had no problem fixing what you were complaining about.   But unfortunately some people just want a free  groom.

name: Pamela Coker
text: I took my little fur baby in for grooming, Rhonda did a great job she is such a nice lady,if I have a problem with my little one that I don't know how to do she can give good advice, She's not only nice she loves what she does and that's why she always does a good job.I will definitely take Julie again soon as she needs grooming again.Thank you Rhonda

resp.text: Thank you so much.  I'm so glad you were happy with Julie's first groom.  She is adorable.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the nice review.   Look forward to grooming him in the future.

resp.text: Thank you.   So glad you are happy with our services.

text: Wonderful people! Explained everything well and  very affordable.  They fit me in the same day!  Highly recommend!

name: Paul Alidor

text: Best vet clinic hands down. The staff is caring and supportive. My puppy has parvo and had given up. He was dehydrated and unaware of his surroundings. This doctor rehydrate him and educated me on how to care for him at home. We are day 4 now and he is actively playing and barking, eating and drinking on his own now. I think we are out of the woods. I can not express how much I appreciate this staff.

name: rosewood
text: Very friendly place takes such good  care of my mom's little buddy Ben. RIP mother we Love you Always & 4Ever you will be truly miss!

name: Maria Mccsantos
text: The best staff and dr. Hall is amazing

name: Doris Potthast
text:
My latest rescued senior Chihuahua Jack had a swollen face on the left side. A bad tooth and an abscess were giving him so much pain . I called 5 animal hospitals around the area in Montgomery. Jack travels with me cross country in a semi truck. It's very difficult to find kind people who understand our problems. It starts with parking the rig and ends withdelivering on time.
Dr. Hasting took us in right after lunch. Late afternoon Jack had a dental cleaning, 3 teeth removed and his nails clipped, and he was back with his family in the late afternoon. How, that was more than I expected. Dr. Hasting and his assistant did a great job. We long haul truck driver never stay very long at the time at one place. Thank you for your understanding and help.

name: Sandy Lyons
text: Horrible experience. Came in with my puppy who was pooping blood. Had parvo and mange, they didn’t want to give me anything for mange yet. After her antibiotics were done she still had horrible diarrhea. Gave more medicine for it. I call after that was through and she had worms and they wanted to give an 8 day medication. Not once did they take her temperature or run tests of any kind except for parvo. No one even looked at her or would tell me what type of mange or why she had diarrhea. Never going back.

name: James Bates
text: Dr. Hastings in great, Hannah is nice too. lol Great place to bring animals. I understand he was a vet at Tampa Bush Gardens. Ask him for stories..... like WOW

name: Tracee Morrow
text:
My 22 lb dog was attacked by a 95 lb bulldog that was OFF his chain.
My dog was tethered to the ground by a trap he had encountered while parading around a dog in heat.
This made for a very bad ordeal all the way around.
Jobies jaw was broken in 3 places.
His canine tooth along with the 2 nearby teeth were snatched out along with the JAW BONE they were attached too.

These wonderful people took such wonderful care of him and us as dogie parents.he was in shock.
They acted quickly with shots for pain & to sedate him. An i v and watched him over night.
He was routed to a wonderful canine vet in mobile and is hapoy and healthy now.
Thanks to this wonderful staff at Loxley animal hospital

text: Everyone is always so sweet and they always do a good job on my little Abbey.

name: Sally Evenden
text: I think Emily is a god groomer and at 2 previous locations we had good results. But after our last visit I would NEVER go again. Our dog did not get his nails trimmed for whatever reason ..I still bleed when he jumps on my legs, I did not get to speak to whoever groomed him and his hair was still in his eyes. I was trying to be careful because of the pandemic and left quickly before realizing. I was the only one with a mask, and the price was high for the results. Very disappointed. Will not return

Im so thankful I found Emily! She has been so understanding of his fears and anxiety and still manages to do such a great  job on him! text: Mrs. Emily is the finest and most talented groomer. We wouldn't take our "finicky" boy to anyone else. The atmosphere is exciting for the dogs that come for play days. We've also used the boarding service at Helena Dog House. They offer a free tour to new customers so check them out.

name: sean thomas
text: The groomer is awesome with my two German Shepherds. One Shepherd weighs 135, and my other one is 120. They are babies, but can intimidate some. The woman who clipped my dog's nails was not intimidated and could tell they were nice. She was so sweet to my dogs.

name: Joey Smith
text: She is the best in town. Give them a call.  Our dog came back looking like a show dog ready to take 1st place.

text: She did a great job, groomed my poodle mutt exactly as I asked.  BUT, they insisted I pay before I even got to see my dog.  And I felt coerced into adding a tip to my payment that was $10 more than what I was quoted with NO explanation.  And I discovered afterwards that my dog had NOT been bathed or blown out.  My son and I were both covered in black hair after holding him in the car.

Appointment was 10:45 and we got called after 4;00 to pick up, Appointments are for? It's usually fine but not this visit.

name: Bingo Caller (workmusiclife)
text: My dog has never shaked when I gave him a bath for the last two years, I take him to try this place out, and I regret it. He threw up when we got home, yellow foam. He was sick, he finally feels better three days later. I gave him a bath three days later because whatever they used on him, has made him smell really bad. He has marks on him where they cut him. They definitely rushed the service, I know, I showed up when they were supposed to be down, hours later they were clipping his nails and rush cutting, him yelping, he never does, and now he shakes. He never did. I absolutely believe the younger lady is the menace type behind closed doors. Be careful. I'm sure it's all dependant on her attitude that day, how the dogs will be treated. Never again shall I go back. It's a business that only have two groomers, both of which, seem very iffy.

name: JimmyD Watkins
text: The Groomers were very gentle with our little Yorkie. They made her feel at ease right off the bat. They were also attentive to my wife and I, as to what we wanted for our pet. They done a fantastic job with her and the cost was better than the previous groomer we were using. I definitely recommend for all pet owners! We will definitely be returning customers! They also have several cute puppies for sale at really good pricing, hint, hint husbands and fathers, for those wives and children that really want them! 😊

name: Debra Holder
text: Best cut my fur baby has had! Very nice workers who genuinely care about the dogs. First time picking up Lulu when she wasn't afraid.

name: Kim Miller
text: I love Pooches Paradise! Especially Ashley! She groomed our little Brittany on Saturday & was so good with her! Brittany gets so scared & anxious but Ashley knew just how to handle her - with a lot of patience & tender, loving care. She spoke so calmly to her. We arrived early to pick Brittany up & she had just started grooming her. We knew she was going to be one if the last ones but our shopping was done & we live outside of Dothan & didn't want to make 2 trips. So we saw first hand the care & attention Ashley gave to Brittany. We are scheduled to come back in 2 weeks. I highly recommend Pooches Paradise to anyone looking for a great place to have their fur babies groomed!

name: Joanna Jeffrey
text:
The owner was very helpful in helping me find just the right accessories for my 2 fur babies!
My babies also go there to be groomed and they do excellent work!!!! This is one happy momma 😁😁😁😁

name: Stephanie Gilbreaith
text: Mrs. Jenise was AWESOME!  We have searched and searched to find a groomer for a 15 week old Morkie- one that was clean and we could trust with our little cutie and finally with the help of a good friend, found A Pooches Paradise! She did an incredible job, made sure we were happy with the cut and spent time visiting with us! An incredible find, and one worth sharing!!

name: Korie Mitchell
text: I absolutely LOVE this groomer! My pup went from zero to hero with this amazing place!! My pup has really bad anxiety when it comes to grooming and feeling cornered so he gets slightly aggressive. But the owner and other groomer calmed him down enough to make him look extremely beautiful and explained how we could overcome his nervousness together!!!! You will not be disappointed when you go to A Pooches Paradise!!!!!!

name: Donna Smith
text: Great place to take your fur babies!!! Sarah did an excellent job on my 2 !!!!

text: Love them all they are so supportive of my feelings and my animals. The vet knows his bizz

text: If your one of those weird people like myself where your furry four footed friends are more like your "kids" than just a pet, well then I have finally found the perfect place to send my "kids" to get pampered and groomed by people who feel the same way "We" do, well then I highly recommend it to you to discover it yourself as I did  If nothing else other than just stopping in to meet Jenise (the owner) and Ashlee (a groomer) you'll quickly see that this is the place you'll start trusting with your "kids"  Feels like home and that's important.

name: Jaime Brannon
text: Love these ladies! Always super nice and have very cute accessories for the fur babies!
