text: Great customer service, very friendly and great groom job on my dog

name: Yvonne Waldon
text:
Oak View Animal Hospital, Dr. Robinson, Dr. Price and their staff are the best!!
They are warm and friendly.  You will not find more concern or better care for your
pet's needs anywhere.  Without a doubt, they are "TOPS"!!!

name: Stephanie Clayton
text: Drs. Price and Robinson are great.  My dogs and cats have been seeing them for years.  Not only do I appreciate their professional work they are very compassionate towards the pets as well.  Also, their entire staff is wonderful, so friendly and truly interested in your pet.

name: Joseph Gay
text: A great group of people that really cares about your pet and you. My dog would have died if it hadn't been for them agreeing to seeing him on a Saturday as a walk-in. Most of the other area Vets were closed or I was told they just see their regular clients on Saturdays. It has been 4 years since that date, my dog is doing fine and he loves going to see the staff at Oak View Animal Hospital. My parents use them them as well and we always board our pets with them when we go out of town. Ms. Renee is always a pleasure to talk to, she the first person you see coming through the door. She remembers you and your pets names. You dont have to tell her who you are when you come in. Great People and God Bless you all.

name: Jill Graham
text: We love Oak View. Dr. Robinson and Dr. Bradac are both so kind and always take time to call and check on our pups after visits. All of the staff that we have interacted with are great!

resp.text: Thank you for recommending Oak View Animal Hospital to other Pelham pet owners. We appreciate you  sharing your thoughts on Dr. Robinson, Dr. Bradac & Oak View!

name: Nicholle Brendlinger
text: Dr. Robinson knowledge and competence inspires confidence always, but her exceptional kindness, compassion and support during less than optimal circumstances truly make her stand out as an exceptional veterinarian. We are blessed to have her.

resp.text: We appreciate you being part of our family!  Thank you for recommending Oak View Animal Hospital to other pet owners.  Thanks for sharing your thoughts about Dr. Robinson and Oak View!

name: Sara Downs
text: We just recently moved to Pelham and Oak View Animal Hospital is at the end of our neighbor hood! We took one of our two dogs there for her yearly check up and everyone from the front desk to the vet assistant to the doctor were great and very friendly. We loved the Dr. Robinson, she was very nice, took time with us and answered all the questions that we had. One weekend we had my brother in law's dog with us and noticed that he had a couple of fleas and called them on Saturday morning and asked if there was anyway that we could come and get a flea pill for him even though he has never been seen there before and she said of course and was very helpful!! I would recommend them to everyone!!

name: Deirdre Morgan
text: Oak View has taken care of my furry children for almost 16 years; starting with our lovely lady of a dachshund, Lucy; whom we lost to the "Rainbow Bridge" a long time ago, through our grumpy lady, Callie, the tortoise shell cat, who was never pleasant to them, and on to our current pair of feline girls who they take very good care of.  A little over two months ago, we had to make the difficult decision to let Callie go.  The vets and staff at Oak View were very supportive to Callie and us and we could not have asked for better people to be with us at a very difficult time.  I will never forget what they did for us then and what they continue to do.  Blessings to everyone there.

name: Darla Spinosi
text: This place is great!  It's located at the edge of a residential section of Pelham, it's been there as long as I can remember.  They've been around for a long time for good reason.  They really care.  The doctor always calls me after to check on my pet's recovery.  And recover they do!  These people have saved my pets more than a few times.  And their fees are quite reasonable.  I will never change vet clinics!

resp.text: We appreciate you being part of our family all these years! Thank you for recommending Oak View Animal Hospital to other pet owners.

name: Steve Hutto
text: I've been taking my dogs here for 3 years. I had to euthanize 2 of my Jack Russell's here and the staff was amazing. Very respectful and sympathetic. They now take care of our 1 yr old Labradoodle for grooming and shots. Wouldn't take her anywhere else.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! We appreciate you being a part of the Oak View Animal Hospital family and recommending us to other Pelham pet owners.

name: Annmarie Burch
text: I have used Oak View since 2006. My dogs love it there. The staff makes you feel so comfortable. I am emotionally attached to my kids well dogs. My baby girl Missy is getting older now going blind and i dropped her off for a grooming. My baby had a seisure they called me immediately just asked if i was still close by. I was. When i got there they told me what happened. I fell over crying. The staff sat with me watched my baby girl called the next day to check on her. This place is amazing.

resp.text: We treat patients like our own pets and worried about Missy.  Our doctors & staff are so glad to have you a part of the Oak View Animal Hospital family!

name: W Price
text: This place has been our vet for years.  Always easy to get an appt; friendly staff; great pet care.  Dr. Robinson is great.

resp.text: We appreciate you being part of our family! Thank you for recommending Oak View Animal Hospital to other pet owners. Thanks for sharing your thoughts on Dr. Robinson & Oak View!

name: Halie Lindsey
text: If I could give a higher rating a definitely would! The Doctors and staff are amazing and my kitten and I went home very happy! We have definitely found our new vet!

resp.text: Welcome to our Oak View Animal Hospital family!  Thank you for allowing us to care for you and your kitten.  We are your partner in your pet's health and here to answer any questions or concerns you might have. Appreciate you sharing your thoughts!

name: Amber Gomez-Mueller
text:
I don't have words for how much I love our family at OVAH, or how thankful we are for everything they do. Our fur babies are as excited to see the OVAH staff as they are when we arrive home at the end of the day after work.

I only have one complaint...  I don't see any photos of our dogs on their Google page. We need to remedy that 😁

resp.text: Amber THANK YOU for you & our dogs being part of Oak View Animal Hospital!  We are grateful you took the time to share your thoughts. Post some pictures on our Facebook page or you can upload pictures also here to our Google page :-)

name: Julie Crawford
text: I have known Dr. Price for several years and he has been a great friend and personally saved two of my animals. Great doctor. Better person.

name: Kitty McCoy
text: I have been extremely pleased with the kind and loving services provided by the doctors and staff at Oak View Animal Hospital. They are courteous and always give the greatest attention to my pet's needs, in addition to a warm welcome whenever we arrive!

name: Janet Attaway
text: Stephanie is a mini-schnauzer.  She is now 4 years old. She has gone to Oak View since the day I brought her home.  She  loves Miss Renee and tries to make a puddle every time she sees her.  Miss Renee took my Facebook profile photo - of course, it was of Stephanie and her big yellow duck

resp.text: We enjoy seeing you & Stephanie every time you visit Oak View Animal Hospital!

name: j w
text: Great!

name: Whitney Gay
text: Dr. Robinson, Dr. Price and all of the staff at Oak View are amazing. We started our dog's care here right after we adopted her from the humane society. We loved how she was treated and how we were treated. After that we transferred our cat's care here, because we were not satisfied with our other vet and had had such a good experience with Oak View. They treated our cat's chronic and severe UTI and he hasn't had one in 2 years; where as at the other vet we felt like he was not being fully treated and was having unnecessary testing for his diagnosis. In Sept. 2013 we noticed that our dog was not acting like herself and it was after hours, so we took her to the ER vet and they misdiagnosed her with gastritis. We took her to Dr. Price the next day because she had gotten severely worse. Within minutes he diagnosed her with an IMHA, which is a very serious, usually fatal, diagnosis. He sat down with me and explained the disease and treatment course. He stayed with her through the night while she received a blood transfusion, to ensure that she didn't have a reaction to it. He even called me late that night to give me an update. Now nine months later she is her perky self. I would never trust my pets to anybody but Oak View! They are so compassionate, caring and knowledgeable. You won't find a better vet in the Birmingham area!

name: Jeanette Proctor
text: Treat us and our pets like family,  love Oak View! Absolutely recommend them to anyone in need of veterinary care for their pets.  Also offer expert grooming and boarding services.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your thoughts on Oak View Animal Hospital!   We care for all our patients like they are our own pets.  Thanks for being a part of our family!

name: Gary Grimes
text: The best care your animals can find in the area.  Very caring and helpful staff.

resp.text: Gary -  Thank you for recommending Oak View Animal Hospital to other pet owners.  We appreciate you sharing your thoughts about Oak View!

name: Linda Dennis
text: Can't say enough nice things about all the doctors and their staff, they are ALL very caring. My best friends and family take their animals to the "View" for care also, and we are all very happy with Oak View and their expertise and care of our precious fur-babies.

resp.text: Thank you for being a part Oak View Animal Hospital's family! Thank you for allowing us to care for you and your furbabies. We are your partner in your pet's health and here to answer any questions or concerns you might have. Appreciate you sharing your thoughts!

name: April Danielson
text: I can't say enough good things about Dr. Robinson. She's a gem and truly cares about our dog. We found her on a recommendation from a family member because our dog needed surgery. Our vet couldn't do it, so we came to Dr. Robinson. We won't be leaving now and all 4 of our animals will be under her care. You will be very glad that you found this practice. :)

resp.text: Appreciate you sharing your thoughts.  Welcome to the Oak View Animal Hospital family!! We are your partner in your pet's health and happy your dog will be getting better! Dr. Robinson & all our staff say thanks for recommending us to other pet owners!

name: Cheryl Hutcheson
text: We found Oak View while fostering for a local rescue group. I immediately could tell how much they cared about the animals *and* the people. We started making arrangements right away to transfer our other animals to their care. I wasn't really unhappy where we were but there are no words to describe how much Dr Price *obviously* loves his job and his patients. There have been several times when he has called over the weekend or in the evenings just to check on our pet who was not feeling well. In all my years of owning animals, I had also never had a vet who gave you their personal contact information and never hesitated to answer right away! The rest of the people at the clinic are wonderful as well and Renee is always such a joy to see when you come in. We can't imagine ever using another clinic and I would follow Dr Price anywhere he moved his practice!

name: Lisa Arnold
text: I was very happy with the services today. Although, I was called and told she was ready after 5 hrs for a bath and nails grinding, she was not ready. They did correct the problem with the nails.

resp.text: Lisa Thank you! We are grateful you took the time to share your thoughts & recommend Oak View Animal Hospital to other pet owners.  Thanks to you & your pets being part of our family at Oak View Animal Hospital!

name: Tracy Vinzant
text: The welcome desk staff Renee is exceptionally friendly, and you can tell she truly cares about her job and the clients (both people and fur babies!)

resp.text: Thanks for recommending us to other pet owners!  We appreciate you sharing your thoughts.

name: lmeeler01
text: Oak View has been awesome in taking care of my 4 year old french bulldog.   She tends to get into things and the doctors and staff have helped her in the major issues with surgery, as well as, the day to day allergies and illnesses.

resp.text: Thank you for recommending Oak View Animal Hospital to other pet owners. We appreciate you & your your dog being part of our family at Oak View Animal Hospital!

name: Lenny Ferguson
text: Actually, maybe a .5 star. Oakview Animal Hospital told me I could adopt a perfectly adorable labradoodle, whom I'd begun loving the moment we met. I'd planned to pick him up the next day. Then I got a voicemail saying they'd given him away to someone else. They did not give me any advance notice. Their priority is animals, but their clients are human. OAH ought to really consider their bedside manner. I know OAH originally wanted this dog to be adopted with his buddy, and that's why they gave them both to someone else. But promising me the dog, who ran to me and put his head in my lap upon meeting, and then giving him to someone else is bloody rotten. I pulled all of my current dog's records from OAH and I will  never go back.

resp.text: We appreciate you wanting to adopt and provide a family to a homeless dog.  Our team reached out to you about the adopting of both dogs into one family for their best interest.  Please call our manager to discuss your concerns further.

name: Jill Hudson
text: Oak View is full of knowledgable and compassionate staff. They help you every step of the way, keep appointment times, and are thorough at every visit. I will never go anywhere else!

resp.text: Thank you for being a part pf Oak View Animal Hospital's family! We are your partner in your pet's health and here to answer any questions or concerns you might have. Appreciate you sharing your thoughts!

text: There is no better vet in the area than Dr. Price!  He is knowledgable, great with both my pets as well as me! text: I just don't know where to start ......these folks are great! Great Doctors and great staff.  They all care and it shows.

text: I looked and looked for a good vet since we are new to the area and I struggled to find a place to take out new puppy. But after reading all the excellent reviews I knew we had found the right vet. They were wonderful with our little Ruby Sue (Shih Tzu). name: Penny Loyd
text: The vets and entire staff are caring and patient people.  We have three dogs and a senior cat so we visit Oak View a lot.  We never intend to go anywhere else.

name: Tyler Gaston
text: I have nothing but wonderful things to say about Oak View Animal Hospital- especially Dr. Stipes! She was able to work my kitty right in after he had gotten into a neighborhood scuffle.  She provides the best care for our fur babies and cannot imagine using anyone else for our pets' healthcare!!

resp.text: Appreciate you sharing your thoughts!  Thank you for being a part Oak View Animal Hospital's family! Dr. Stipes & all of our staff are your partners in your pet's health - and especially want to make sure they are ok after scuffles!

name: Tyler Robbins
text:
My story does not have a happy ending but I thank everyone at Oak View Animal Hospital for making the journey an amazing adventure.

I adopted Max from the Birmingham Humane Society. A year old border collie mix of some sort, who knows? I did my research looking for a vet and asked my friends who they recommended. Oak View came up multiple times so eventually i decided Oak View would be Max and mine's vet. I could not have been happier with the choice. They helped me take my firsts steps as friend and pet owner and made both of us feel like we were part of the family.

Max didn't have his first seizure until 3 months after i adopted him. Oak View walked me through the different reasons a dog can have a seizure and laid out a plan to help moderate or even eliminate Max's seizures. Had Max's condition been epilepsy or even one of the many normal conditions that can cause seizures i can honestly say Oak View would have been able to help him. Through the empirical method we tried everything to help Max. Unfortunately Max's grand mal seizures persisted and i lost a piece of my friend after each one. Dr. Price and Dr. Robinson admitted that this may be beyond their scope and I respect them all the more for it. I took Max to Neurologists, pathologists, and almost every specialist at Auburn and in between. No one could put a finger on it.

Within a year my friend was no longer himself. Oak View helped with his final moments and the level of caring and comfort they provided i will never forget. Thank you Oak View. I can never thank you enough for the love and support you gave Max and me.

If you are debating what Vet to use i highly recommend Oak View.

resp.text: Our sympathies on your loss - you worked hard to help him with his seizures and issues.  Our doctors and staff wished we could have helped Max and provided you with more time with him.  Thank you for working with us and other specialists to try to diagnose his conditions.  We wish the outcome was better for you and him.  Thank you for trusting us and allowing us to care for him.  If you do adopt again, we look forward to having you part of the Oak View family.

name: Bryan Stramer
text:
I cant say enough about this vet clinic.  My great dane was being boarded when his stomach twisted...   he was rushed to this clinic and the vet had to do emergency surgery.  I called as soon as i found out and was told my dog was in surgery and they called me several times with uodates.  The entire staff was friendly and helpful and they helped eleviate sone of the stress i was having.

I would highly recommend using this vet if your pet is ever on need of medical care.

resp.text: We appreciate you sharing your thoughts - thank you! So glad your dog is doing better!

name: Deana McGriff
text: These are the best in the world. They became my vets during the loss of my cat Smokie. They were kind, compassionate, and felt that loss with me. I live near Pell City, but I drive to Pelham to see Dr. Robinson, or Dr. Katie. They know me and my cats by name every time we have a visit. Wouldn't trust my fur babies to anyone else!

resp.text:
Thank you for the kind words! We appreciate you and your cats being part of the Oak View Animal Hospital family.
Thanks for recommending us to other pet owners AND that you drive so far from Pell City to come see us!

name: Lauren Lewis
text: The staff is so friendly and helpful and Dr. Price is a top-notch veterinarian who is personal and more than qualified to help take care of your pup.

name: Trudy Johnson
text: I would never take a pet anywhere else! When you're here, you are all family! Don't live in the area? It's worth the drive!

name: JJEubank
text: There's a reason why Oakview has 28 perfect scores. They are the Best! If you are looking for a Pediatrician for your pet, this is the place. Not to mention they don't have to send you here or there to have a test run on your pet. They have an extensive lab and up to day equipment that can give you results most of the time very quickly. If not, Dr. Price has worked very hard to network with other specialized Veterinarians around the Southeast and beyond to partner with the care of your pet. The staff of Renee Porter, Julie Jordan Evans, Brandy Falletta and others have years of experience and work together as a team to ensure that you and your pet have as pleasant experience as possible. Even though Julie is a Tennessee fan. I guarantee that you will not only be pleased with Oakview but you will know that your pet is getting the best care possible.

name: Judeth Thomas
text: Switching vets is never easy, especially when you have a 100 pound dog who is terrified of everything, including strangers. But let me just say, I am SO thankful you guys are the first vet I tried after moving to the Pelham/Helena area! I can NOT thank Dr. Katie Stipes and the rest of the amazing team at OV for taking such great care of my babies for the first time today! You guys were so sweet to my super timid big baby AND kitty. So thankful we found the perfect vet so close to home! Bubba and Fitz will learn to love you guys, too ;)

resp.text: Welcome to Oak View Animal Hospital! So glad you found us and appreciate you helping us by writing recommendations to other Pelham & Helena pet owners. Appreciate the feedback and kind words and so glad to have you, Bubba & Fitz part of our family!

name: Patriot Thunder
text:
The best!!

name: Kacey Hayes
text: Drs. Price and Robinson have taken care of our adopted family for years. My fur kids are actually excited when they realize they're going to the vet. Oak View treats every animal like they're family, and as long-time clients we appreciate this beyond words. Two days ago we had to make the awful decision to let our baby Matilda go home forever, and Dr. Robinson and the staff were so patient, kind and understanding. They care as much about your animal's wellbeing as you do. I couldn't recommend them highly enough, and am so grateful that we have them as healthcare providers.

They are so thorough with everything they do, and they even followed up with phone calls and cards to make sure Roman was ok and feeling better! They also try to make everything they do is as financially feasible for us as possible. i really appreciate everything they do! I will definitely be bringing Roman back to them in the future!!

I am leaving a five star review to show my gratitude for such an incredible experience. The man was right- knowledge certainly is power, and I look forward to visiting in the future with the knowledge that my furry family members are so well-considered.

text:
1st and hopefully not the last visit. Boarded my dog for a week. Show up today, and nothing I asked was done. Besides boarding, I asked for a nail trim, groom and bath. Upon arrival, none of this was done. Prior to me boarding him, I was told twice on the phone to mention to one of the girls when I arrived.

When I dropped him off on the 8th, I had requested these services to be done. The girl that was there said it would be done and that they would call if they had any questions. When I get him today, I find out none of this was written down on his chart. I think you need to train your employees to write down notes on our pet’s chart when busy or not to ensure items requested are done correctly. I only give this two stars because your comped me on a nail trim and bath.

resp.text: Thomas, we apologize that our timing did not meet your expectations.  We do delay baths on boarding dogs so they are freshly bathed when you arrive for pickup.  For your wait time, we did not charge you for the bath and nail trim in hopes to make up for your short wait time.  We apologize this did not meet your expectations.  If you would like to discuss further, please feel free to call our office and ask to speak with either Janet or Tara.

resp.text: I am sorry Danita that you had a bad first experience.  We tried to call customers to reschedule prior to arrival to let them know our groomer had a family emergency.  We apologize you didn't receive your call before you arrived.

name: A E
text:
I have taken my dog here a few times. Not only does my dog now have kennel cough, my dog has came home now with a nip to the ear, and had a wound on the butt area. None of this was there before I took my dog here. Staff is great and professional. More likely will not be taking my dog here again.

I just want to edit to add. He doesn’t have kennel cough. He’s actually a lot more sick. He’s running a fever between 103-105.3, lethargic, no appetite, and not drinking. We’ve been to the ER vet for the fever when it got to 105.3. He’s been to his normal vet and they have no idea what’s making him so sick. We’ve been given antibiotics and his fever still won’t go down. My dog became this sick after taking him here. I don’t know if another dog they let in had something that was given to mine or maybe the food and water bowls weren’t properly cleaned. Whatever it may be is slowly killing my dog and is becoming highly expensive in vet bills trying to find out what’s going on.

resp.text:
Thank you for providing your feedback and letting us know about this issue. We set a high standard for ourselves and are truly sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations. Please call us at (205) 413-8164 and ask for the Resort Manager so that we can better assist you.

Thank you,

PetSuites Hoover

name: Jonathan Taylor
text:
This place is pretty annoying.  No one picks up the phone “taking care of dogs can’t answer”

Hire more people.  If you are going to act superior - be superior,  pay for a receptionist, and think about customer service

name: Erin Nelson
text: I was extremely nervous about boarding my sweet pup Lucy because the last time she was boarded she injured herself. The staff assured me that she would be well-cared for and that I would be notified of any issues and I received a tour before leaving her in their hands. She enjoyed her individual playtime and received lots of love during that time. Not only am I beyond pleased with the services provided, but I will ONLY be taking my girl to PetSuites of Hoover for future boarding needs.

name: Adrienne Samani
text:
Do not leave your dog here! I was at first very happy with pet suites and their services when they first opened. But they’ve grown so much too fast and without the proper staff to take care of your pet. They are too short staffed and are too overwhelmed, frustrated, and not communicating with one another well. I once left him for day care and asked if they could
feed my dog breakfast which they’re response was that it was a $29 fee. They didn’t feed him the entire day and would rather have him not eat for 8 hours over $29. Over the weekend that I boarded him they allowed me to pay the “gold package” when he was already approved for group play. They lied about sending photos as part of the package when I asked about it they said they had to “shift through the photos” before sending them but I never received them. When I went to go finally pick him up after receiving no word about him there was a woman in the group play area walking away from the dogs, shooing them, and yelling them to get away from her. It’s one woman and several dogs so I understand she’s overwhelmed but this is clearly a staffing issue. On a tour of the area before leaving my dog therein on the morning of our trip the cages had not been cleaned out and were dirty. I asked for a refund and they refunded me the price I paid for the gold package. I got my dog back tired and not happy. For the prices they are demanding this is the worst experience I’ve ever had at a dog boarding place. Please give time to this facility for them to find the proper amount of staff before leaving your dog here.

resp.text: Ms. Samani, thank you for taking the time to speak with me today.  I was so sorry to hear that Georgie’s experience did not live up to our usual standard of service.  We grow by hearing where our opportunities lie, and as discussed, your feedback will help us deliver the standard of care we guarantee.  I look forward to speaking with you soon to discuss the immediate improvements we’ve made to our services, and hope to see Georgie in the future.

name: Lizzy Carstensen
text: We were very impressed with Nall Daniels and with Dr. Clark in particular. They got us in right away and were very courteous. Our dog had to have a minor procedure done and everyone was great-from the receptionist to the tech to dr. Clark calling us with multiple updates. They were so kind and you can tell they really care! They were also very open about pricing upfront so we knew exactly what to expect.

name: Karen
text: I would never trust anyone with my fur babies but Doctor Daniel's and his wonderful assistant Brandon they are the best.

name: Jennifer van Arcken
text: I can't say enough positive things about Dr. Emily Soto, who we totally credit for saving little Otter's life. After taking Otter to multiple vets when he was ill and not getting better, a friend recommended Nall Daniels. Dr. Soto accomplished emergency surgery on a Saturday that saved his life. She was very concerned not only as a vet but sincere concern for his well being. She provided very clear instructions on how to care for him during the critical days following surgery. She called and checked on him daily.  He is doing great now! Thank you!

name: Douglas Beckham
text:
My wife and I are new to the high powered world of the  “working breed” of German Shepherds.  We recently purchased one, Ramos, from  Germany.  After about  6 weeks here,  he developed a case of bloat that could have killed him.  With bloat, the stomach actually "flips over" and cuts the blood supply off to the stomach, causing a rapid distension, and death if not treated quickly.  Fortunately, Ramos' stomach flipped back without emergency surgery.

Not wanting to go through this again, we researched bloat and found the best “cure” for it is a laparoscopic assisted gastropexy.  In this procedure the dog's stomach is sutured to the abdominal wall. The sutures eventually dissolve but the stomach is held permanently in place by an "adhesion" preventing recurrent "flipping".  Many animal hospitals do not have a laparoscope or the skill to accomplish this procedure.  Dr. Daniels was able to take care of this surgery and Ramos is 99% normal after five days. He has personally checked on Ramos 4 times on his own time since surgery.

Everything about Drs. Daniels and Clark, and their clinic and team  was strictly professional, yet courteous and friendly.  We can't forget Cassidy, the glue and the center of their clinic.  Exceptional personality and warmth!

If you are looking for a superior team to take care of your special “family member”, consider Dr. Daniels and Clark at Nall Daniels Animal Hospital in Homewood.

Not close enough for you? As Joe Biden would say, "Come on man!!"
This is not about closeness!!
It’s about quality !!!!!!!!!

Douglas Beckham, D.M.D.

name: Emma Pacey
text:
When I adopted my dog, the one thing the previous owner recommended is for us to take him to this office since he had been bringing him here his whole life and they "knew him really well". The first time I took him for his annual shots and a check up I asked about the small lumps on his body and they said it was nothing. 6 months ago I took him to this office to get a check up because we had some concerns. After paying hundreds of dollars for tests and x-rays, they assured me that there was nothing usual going on with my dog. This week he started getting very sick, and after a trip to a different vet, we found out he had cancer and it was very prolonged and caused other problems like anemia, kidney failure and lesions on his lungs. This kind of progression doesn't happen in 6 months. It happens over years. He had been coming here for years and they never once said anything about the cancer that was all over my dog's body and covering his organs. At this point, he was in too much pain, couldn't eat or drink, and could hardly breathe. The new vet and I decided it was best to put him down so he wouldn't be hurting anymore. After years of coming to the same office they never said anything remotely close to cancer.

There is nothing I can do for my dog anymore, but there is still something you can do for your's. DO NOT bring your animals to this office. There is no way a cancer this severe goes unnoticed for so long with an office that provides quality care. Find somewhere to take your pets that won't treat them like they treated my dog. I hope this doesn't happen to anyone else.

name: Quentin Collins
text: Always super friendly staff! Prices are comparable. Dr. Clark is awesome! Highly recommended.

name: Della Clark
text: Amazing staff. Only place I'd go.

name: Ryan Halcomb
text: My dog was referred here by my primary vet for a laparoscopic liver biopsy. The staff at Nall-Daniels was outstanding. They kept me updated on every step of the process and laid out a clear plan for the next steps. I was nervous at first taking my pet for a surgery at a place I have never been, but as soon as I started talking to the staff I knew my dog was in good hands. I would definitely recommend this place!

name: Lizzy Dee
text: They were so attentive and helpful. I got my cat groomed and a collar for her to wear when given medicine and they have kept up with us.

name: Jody Poe
text: Nall Daniels Animal Hospital is great! My little dog "Molly" was so well cared for there right up until the very end. She had to be euthanized on December 22nd, and everyone at Nall Daniels was so sweet through all of this. After Molly died, I got the sweetest cards from Dr. Daniels and Dr. Dunaway as well as from other staff. They even had a beautiful plant delivered to my home in memory of Molly. Molly always got excellent medical care at Nall Daniels, and they will definitely be my vets for my new little rescue dog that I adopted. I highly recommend Nall Daniels Animal Hospital.

text: They are awesome people! I have been taking my Pookie dog there for about three years.

text: Last week my little 10lb Dachshund was bit by  a copper head twice in our yard and Nall Daniels was WONDERFUL. They immediately took him back, got an IV started to counteract the effects of the venom, and monitored him very closely. Thru lots of prayer and the amazing Veterinarians at Nall Daniels, Gus was completely healed in 24 hours!  I would recommend everyone take their pets to them!

text: I rated this place 5 stars at first. They did surgery on my daughter's dog. He ended up dead. They kept telling her he was OK over the phone. She called THREE times. They had 3 chances to say bring him in.

name: Tom Atkins
text:
In the year or so I’ve used Nall-Daniels I found them to be competent veterinarians, but based on exam costs I had begun to wonder if their prices were high.

So when it was time to have my pug spayed, I decided to get quotes from two of the highest rated vets in Homewood. The prices I was quoted by them were very close to each other... $250 and $260.  I then called Nall-Daniels for a quote. I was very surprised to hear an amazing price of $823. When they heard me gasp over the phone they quickly added that this was a worse case estimate.  I quickly thanked them for the estimate and moved my vet account for my 3 dogs to one of the two highly rated vets that gave me more reasonable estimates.

I wondered later what was included in a worst case scenario! A Heart transplant?

name: Nicole Harris
text: The staff was very nice and professional they gladly answered every little question i had

name: Kirk Atkinson
text: I've had four dogs cared for at Nall Daniels - they do an amazing job. Very friendly and knowledgeable techs, the vets keep our dogs in peak health and boarding is very convenient and economical.

name: Corin Thompson
text:
Nall Daniels has always been good to us. I've always been wary of local vets because they all have terrible reviews and it makes a lot of places look sketch. They have been willing and able to give us quotes for treatments so that we can make the best decisions for our cats based on our income.

Our cat Bubbles was diagnosed with bone cancer. The vet did everything she could to get the right diagnosis and give us as many options as available. They could not treat her there but she offered info for treatment elsewhere. We really felt that everything had been done that could be done. I definitely recommend this place 100%

name: Lorraine Donald
text: The dog referred to by Ms. Phillips was a dog that was given up to Adopt A Golden Birmingham with a sense of urgency.   Upon arrival to the clinic the dog had to be carried in and was recumbent the whole time and clearly in medical distress.   The blood panel showed that the dog was in end stage renal failure and to complicate matters was Heart Worm positive.  The medical team at Nall Daniels immediately relayed to Adopt A Golden Bham their findings and indicated that the dog was indeed suffering.  It was their medical opinion that the dog should be euthanized.  Neither Adopt A Golden Birmingham nor Nall Daniels Animal Hospital medical team take these decisions lightly.   We are in the business of rescuing and saving dogs.  Not making this decision and watching the dog suffer was simply not an option, as much as it devastates all of us involved to terminate the life of any of our dogs.   We have the utmost respect for Dr. Daniels and his medical team and are proud to be associated with their clinic and the "above the call of duty care" they give to all the rescue dogs that they have treated for us and will continue to treat.   We are all saddened by this.  Lorraine Donald Founder, Adopt A Golden Birmingham

name: Andy West
text: Nall Daniels has the most knowledgeable staff that we have seen in Birmingham. They are also the most caring group of people you will find and will put the needs of your pet first.

name: April L. Butler
text: Great service and techs that seem passionate about the animals, our pup seemed happy to go and not anxious when we picked up, as she has at other facilities.  Although they are a bit pricier than others, it is worth it for piece of mind.

name: Erin Laney
text: Wonderful Dr and staff all the way around!

name: Susan mcgriff
text: The girls in front are so sweet.. I use Dr Daniels is a very good person,surgeon..

name: Jean Lindquist
text: The service I received at Nall-Daniel Pet Hospital far exceeded my expectations! Nall-Daniel’s provides a variety of veterinary services including well pet check ups, grooming, surgery, and prescriptions. We went there for our yearly check up and vaccinations for our two dogs; a senior Golden Retriever, and a six year old mutt. The entrance was very clean and clam. When we got called back, we were in a decent sized examination room with a vet tech, I can’t remember his name, but he was a very kind and patient young man with brown hair. He was very thorough with us; he listened to and answered all of our questions. He even provided us with a printed out quote of what all the shots, the visit, and the treatment for the ear infection that our Golden had, before performing any procedures. Then, Dr. Dunaway came in to examine them. She immediately got down in the floor and started loving on the boys. You could see her passion for animal care when she came in the room. She was very articulate and detail oriented, laying out all of the treatment options for the ear infection and recommending medication for his arthritis, too. Her bedside manner was impeccable and I felt listened to and informed as she explained everything that she was doing. We never felt rushed, even as it got near closing time. All in all, it was a wonderful experience. I had called fifteen clinic before choosing this one. The reason I chose them in the first place was because they were one of the most affordable. Sometimes, affordability comes at the expense of the quality of care, but not here. I could tell they genuinely cared about the well being of our animals, and I think that we have found a lifelong vet! I can not recommend them enough!

name: Shocklemzoa
text: My little doggie got scratched in her eye by one of our cats. When I got home her eye was puffy and irritated. I immediately too her to Nall Daniels Animal Hospital. There was a major down pour of rain as I pulled in. As I walked in I was warmly greeted and told them what happened. Within a couple of minutes they were looking at my dogs eye and found a little scratch. They gave her some medicine for pain and put some other medicine in there to make sure there wouldn't be an infection. I could see my little precious was already starting to feel better. This is a wonderful place to take your pets. They treated my little doggie like she was one of their own. They even wiped her down with towels to get the rain off as she was shivering a little. Great service. Highly recommended. Thanks NDAH!

name: Keri Cartee
text:
Last week I had to make the difficult decision to put my sweet dog of 15 years to sleep.  I had recently made Nall Daniels my vet and had only needed to bring my dog in a few times before she died.  Although the prices are not low (comparable to other vets, but all are high these days it seems!) the care she received was excellent, the staff was very friendly, and every time I brought her in I received calls to check on her in a day or two.  When I brought her in a week ago, I knew it was probably going to be time to put her down.  She was suffering and could no longer walk.  The staff at Nalls Daniel couldn't have been more kind, caring, gentle, thoughtful, and patient with me and my family.  They made the process as personal and easy as it could be made.  They took good care of my dog and of me until the end.  They were respectful of me and my wishes during this heartbreaking time.
Today I returned from a luncheon to find beautiful flowers waiting on my porch in memory of Mini from the staff at Nalls Daniel.  I am overwhelmed at their kindness.  Thank you, Nalls Daniel, for caring for my sweet furry friend... and for caring for my heart today as I've been missing her so much.  <3

name: Alex Pearlstein
text: Awesome vet. Highly recommended.

name: Robert
text: Wonderful general vetinary

name: Katy Williams
text: Top notch professionals who care about the pets that they treat!

name: Anita Gann
text: Very caring. That are wonderful with my gut babies!!!

name: Erica Phillips
text: Euthanasia is their specialty! They did so without my consent.  They gave up on my dog within a few hours ( never take your dog to this clinic) for something as simple as puppy vaccinations they may be okay doing so. #sadistic

name: Paul Cipollone
text: Great care

name: Robert Levy

resp.text: Thank you for your review!  We appreciate your business.

name: Lyndie Co
text: We've been taking our dog to Gypsy for several years! Not only does she do a wonderful job, but our dog loves her and is excited to go see her - and that means a lot. Gypsy is always happy to work with us to get our dog's haircut just right. We highly recommend her!

name: anslee overton
text: This place is absolutely terrible. Rude customer service.. my dog was dropped off at 7:30 am and wasn’t done until 4 pm. After telling me he would be ready at 12! Very disrespectful communication! DONT TAKE YOUR DOG HERE..

resp.text: Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback.  However we would like to clear up a few discrepancies about your visit. Your dog was scheduled to be dropped off at 8am, which you called to see if your boyfriend could drop off early which we accommodated.  Your dog was scheduled to be ready between 2 and 3 pm, however due to heavy matting, thunderstorms and constant calling to find out the status of your dog’s groom we were unable to meet that deadline.  Our records indicate that we called you to let you know your dog was ready for pick up at 3:09 pm today, our records also indicate that you called 7 times beginning at 10:30 am during your dog’s groom and your grandfather called 1 time.  See a dog does not sit still for us to groom them just because we ask it to so we groom each dog a little at a time so we do not stress your dog out during their visit.  We try our best to meet the time frame that we give you for a pick up time, however, when they are heavily matted or if the weather is bad it affects the time it takes to groom your dog.   While we are very accommodating and allowed your boyfriend to drop off and pick up your dog, if you would like to ensure the groom better meets your expectations at your next groomer please be present at drop off or pick up to explain the details of the groom you would like.  We understand that you were not happy with the outcome of this visit and would not want you to have the same experience at your next groomer.

name: Christena Hasenbein
text: Had my babies groomed today! Such a great place! She is very patient and professional. She took such good care of my puppies! Love their cuts! Did exactly what I asked for. Great prices! Will be back!

resp.text: We appreciate your business and thank you for the 5 star review.

name: Christine Hardin
text: We love Fozzies! I have a special needs poodle that is blind. Gypsy does an amazing job with her.  Her cut always looks great and is also tailored to our needs for our sweet Nellie. I would highly recommend Fozzies.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review.  It is always a pleasure to have Nellie.

name: Danielle Routen
text: I would not recommend. I went there for my first time today, and won't be back. It is partly my fault for not saying exactly what I wanted. I just said I wanted him to be cut short. I didn't think they would butcher my shitzu's face. I have always every time he has gotten groomed he has bangs and they would shape his hair to his face. No, not this time just basically shaved all the hair off he's face. He didn't look like the same dog. In the almost eight years I have gotten him groomed this is by far the worst grooming he has ever had.

resp.text: I apologize for any miscommunication on how you wanted Shilo groomed.  My understanding was that you wanted a short summer cut, if I had know that you wanted a teddy bear face or beard left I would have been more than happy to accommodate that face into the summer cut.  I would hope you would try us again and we could communicate better to get you the exact cut you want for Shilo.

name: Theresa Turner
text: Took my Maggi  and had a full groom done,  looked great.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and review.  We appreciate your business.

name: Debrorah McBride
text: She was very good with my baby Marshall and done a great job.  She will be the 1 that does Marshall from now on.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review.  Look forward to taking care of Marshall in the future.

name: Marie Jochum
text: I picked up my sweetpea she has been at fozzies 5 days. I always get a report from the owner on how she did while I was away. I forgot sweetpeas bowls and she didn't say a word but I apologized for forgetting. Thank you so much for the love and care you give my baby.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review.   Sweetpea is always a joy to have, look forward to her next visit.

name: Mary Fleming
text: I will never take my fur babies to this shop. All because how one woman acted in the drive thru line at Starbucks. She got out of her vehicle because she felt that she was next in line and needed to tell the girl in front of me off. To feel above someone in a drive-thru line when you didn't go to the end of the line is asinine. You shouldn't have your business sticker on the back of your window and act like that. You are very welcome for cutting in front of me in line. You will never get my business

resp.text:
I can understand your frustration with the incident that occurred at Starbucks, however we have not visited Starbucks.  None of our vehicles have a sticker or logo on them.  I appreciate your position, but the person that did this is not with Fozzie's Paw Spa.  Since you live in Arizona and we are located in Cullman, Al I think your issue was with Fozzie's Pet Spa

13246 N 113th Ave Ste 1c,

Youngtown, AZ 85363

If so please adjust your review.

text: Great place. Great owner.

resp.text: We appreciate your business and the great review.

name: Courtney Woljevach
text: She does a great job grooming our Cat

name: Tickety Boo
text: I have been to several Groomers in Cullman for my half maltese half basset hound, Hiccup. Every one of them,except this one, has said they could not complete his groom (either saying ears or nails couldn't be done), because of his little attitude. Which I understand. He can be difficult. I have taken Hiccup and my other dog here once. And they were fantastic. Hiccup goes again today and I am beyond excited to see their work. They are also the only ones who have ever paid any attention to his tail. Most of the others send him home with it looking still a bit ratty. But he came back from here with the fluffiest tail floof I have ever seen in him. This will be the groomer I use from now on. Hands down the best in Cullman. Thank you for taking such good care of my fur baby!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to post your review.  We appreciate your feedback.

(Translated by Google) Very good for pets

(Original)
Muy bueno para la mascotas

name: M Smith
text: My dog seemed to have a great time at doggy day care. He was happy and tired when I picked him up. The staff is incredibly knowledgeable and kind. The facility appears clean.

name: Matthew Mayo
text: We take our dog rascal here for grooming and daycare regularly. He’s always so happy and excited to go, and comes home tired out at the end of the day, which is quite a feat for a jack russell. The groomer always does a great job with him, and he looks (and more importantly smells) like a million bucks after. I’ve recommended JHH to all of my friends.

name: Wendy Montealegre
text:
I LOVE Just Happy Hounds.  First, the facilty is spotless.  And their stellar staff truly love these animals.  It's genuine.
I do quite a bit a rescue, and sweet Sarah Mills, Katelyn and the rest of this amazing staff have boarded several rescues. Teaching these dogs basic manners training and socialization.  This work helps ensure they will have a successful adoption later!
Just Happy Hounds not only provides excellent care for your personal dog, they do extensive community outreach, and have saved countless dogs.  I can't say enough good about them!!!

name: james meredith
text: Very nice people. Stayed late to meet me so I could drop my dog off on a sunday!!!

name: Brittany Stephens
text:
My dog began daycare at JHH at approximately 6 months old and attended at least 2-3 times per week. I always thought she enjoyed it as she seemed excited to pull up and be dropped off. At around a year old, I started noticing a lot of staff turnover at the facility. Although I should have taken heed, I did not and my dog continued to attend day care regularly. I began noticing that my dog was very timid of the staff. In particular, she was called by one of the managers/trainers and immediately backed up, tail between her legs, and laid down in a submissive position behind me. This time I took note and my dog never returned to the facility. I still have pre-paid day care days that will go unused. When I inquired about my dog’s reaction, it was explained to me by staff that my dog was regularly kept separate in a kennel in the back during the day. AND, that her “training” involved being taken into the yard, on a leash, while other dogs were allowed to approach her and she was given commands to obey. THIS RUINED MY DOG. She has dog aggression issues to this day, largely due to her extreme anxiety which I believe was engrained into her at a developmental stage while at JHH. Please do not take your dog to this facility for daycare.

Also, please note that most of the favorable reviews were posted at least a year ago. While the more recent reviews question the dogs well-being at the facility.

name: Emma Tolbert
text: Terrible! I paid $74 per night for my 2 senior-age shelties to be boarded in the “Beach House” suite while I was out of town. When they were picked up they were soaking wet and filthy, as if they had been left outside in the rain. They were also hungry, and an excess of their food was left that should not have been if instructions were followed. Definitely would not recommend if you are looking for your pets to be well taken care of!

name: Christina Fortugno
text: Just Happy Hounds needs to be your first and last look at daycare for your best friend. I moved to Birmingham a few months ago and did not know a soul. I came for graduate school with my best friend (Oliver) and the center of my world. I shopped around for daycares like my peers do for their human children. I chose Just Happy Hounds because the staff was friendly and I loved how my dog was always playing. He does not spend hours alone in a kennel like he would at home. They have far exceeded my expectation for customer service and outright exceptional care for my puppy. Oliver had a scratched cornea from playing a little hard and required surgery. I was stressed about what to do. I thought I could not take him to daycare while he recovered for surgery. He required extensive medications and needed to watched more closely in the cone of shame. The JHH team took care of Oliver post-op just as well as I would have at home. I never have to worry about my best friend while I am at work/class all day. I know he is being loved and played with as he is at home. I could not be more thankful for such incredible care of Oliver during his time of extra need. As a nurse, I am always caring for everyone else. I have been incredibly thankful to have someone help me out and give me peace of mind. Never bring your baby somewhere else! Sarah and her team are incredible. JHH is the best home away from home you can bring you furry friend to.

name: Abigail Martin
text: I have been trying to contact them for the last ten days after my dog was groomed here. I have called and emailed to no avail and have heard nothing back. I have many concerns with how well he was supervised the hours he spent here.

name: Drew Griffith
text: I took Buddy for grooming Savannah the groomer did a excellent job in grooming Buddy. Buddy smells wonderful.  He was full of matts when I dropped him off and know he is not. Savannah has done the best job of any grooming place I have ever talking buddy to

name: Kayla Rivera
text: They are wonderful with my dog. I have needed to leave before on fairly short notice and they have always been accommodating. My dog comes back happy. I will always feel comfortable leaving my dog there.

name: Anna Waters
text: I take my dog here once a week,  and he loves it. He hasn't always gotten along with other dogs, but he is so much more sociable now after a few months of weekly daycare. The staff at JHH is so nice and helpful, and I trust their judgment. Their services are also really affordable. I can't recommend them highly enough.

name: Cj Paxton
text: I have a giant breed dog ( Cane Corse  @ 160 lbs. )  Sarah and her crew have been great with him. He loves going there to play and hang out. No other place want to work with him because of his size. Wish I lived closer to them we moved and he isn't able to go now but I will have vacation soon. And he will be there for 12 days.

name: Raphael Cohen
text: Pasta and ambiance are both good. Great lunch place

name: Matthew Spivak
text: My dogs HATE getting groomed, but JHH was incredible! I could tell they genuinely cared for my boys and went the extra mile to make them feel comfortable. My dogs were in a much better mood when I picked them up compared to other places.

name: Stephanie Agee
text: It was okay I had to keep calling for the groomer, after she was reached I took my puppy in for a bath in a couple of days he was oily

name: mylilgigi2018 Mills
text:
Mrs Cole
Sorry you feel like this about JHH, but I can’t  imagine Sarah ever yelling at anyone her companion for what she does is above all.
The  dedication  she puts into running to JHH  is fabulous I wouldn’t put my baby anywhere else.

name: Bethany Cryder
text: Gracie loves her day care days.  I love the staff.  They treat her so wonderfully. Cannot recommend them enough.

name: Taylor Stroud
text: We have been taking our dog here for over a year now. She absolutely loves it. She gets excited whenever we ask her if she is ready "to go to daycare". They love taking care of our pup and do a great job. definitely recommend, especially those working close by at UAB and Children's

name: Terry Pribyl
text: Great service my dog loved the people. Kept my Lumpy for a day in a pinch, and didn't even charge us for the first visit.

name: Bryan Reed
text: Attended the Birmingham Bowl on the way home to Texas on a road trip.  I needed a place to keep our dog during the football game.  The folks at Just Happy Hounds were great.  My dog was actually sad to leave her newly acquainted canine friends.  I would highly recommend Just Happy Hounds!

name: mark gotfryd
text: The dog returned happy but lost weight. From being active all day or under fed??. She was returned with multiple bumps... insect bites... Flea?.. Gave her bravecto. The people are very very nice and obvious dog lovers...

name: Julie King
text: Friendly staff. 1st class care for your furbaby. Easy to find. Groomer does a great job. It's easy to get an appointment and prices are comparable to other less fancy places. There's a great vibe at Just Happy Hounds and I will continue to take my little beloved furbaby there! She got a groom that was precious but not as short as I needed for her comfort due to hotspots and they didn't hesitate to fix it for free. Great place!

name: Julie King
text: They do a good job and love my nany

name: Caywood Yamnik
text: I took my dog here for a year and a half and still they did not know her name, and called her a boy almost every time. The staff has very high turnover, and there seems to be a big internal communication issue.

name: Mark Reeder
text: Great way to get the extra energy out of our puppy plus learn socialization skills. Great place for boarding as well.

name: Kelly King
text:
I would like to say I’ve been to several doggie daycares and Just Happy Hounds by far is the BEST!!!!
You can really tell they care about your baby! I have to tell you about my experience with them today. I dropped my baby off for the first time today for her boarding I
was greeted by Sarah and Josh with warm welcomes. The others staff wanted to know exactly want Annabella need during her stay food, bath how much when. I have to say JHH has it together and I can tell Sarah is there because she loves the babies. Now I can go on my trip with no worries! Thank you JHH staff for all you do.

name: Shay Hoffman
text:
Very friendly staff however the groom on my Pomeranian wasn't quite up to snuff. I took him in at the end of March 2017 for an all over trim down to 1/2" (tail included), specific attention to his ears, and a sanitary cut.
The overall cut was uneven around his face, legs, and tail - it looked chunky, spots were missed and others cut too short. The sanitary cut was what I asked for but I noticed a razor burn/cut on the inside of his leg after we got home. They did a great job on his ears which is usually a tough spot so it seems odd that the other stuff was so spotty.
This groomer just doesn't seem to have the skill for my dog's coat or their prices. We won't be going back.

name: Leah Moseley Papp
text: My dog loves coming here and the staff is great.

name: Yashna Patel
text: My dog received an injury, it was hard to contact anyone who knew about the situation and management did not cooperate or empathize. My dog suffered a large bruise and blood spot on her back left leg. I had to call several times and finally got ahold of management. They did not find out how the injury happened and I finally had to take my dog to the vet. Also, I requested nail trimming while my dog boarded and they forgot to do so. I scheduled a drop off for my dog for boarding and no one was in the office to receive her though I let them know ahead of time. I definitely do not reccommend this place.

name: Dona Bonnett
text:
"We are so pleased with Just Happy Hounds Midtown.  The dog groomer did a fabulous job on Trouble, our 11 year old rescue dog and we definitely recommend Just Happy Hounds Midtown in Birmingham for anyone needing dog grooming, boarding, dog daycare or training. This is a wonderful new dog facility and the staff is great - thanks so much for taking such good care of my baby!  Dona Bonnett-adr Business & Marketing Strategies

Copper loves to play at doggie daycare with the other dogs while he is at Just Happy Hounds.  I would highly recommend Just Happy Hounds!

text: Valerie, Brandon, and the staff at Bones are over the top with your furry friends! They are always willing to exceed your expectations and take care of your pets. They have took care of my GSP on short term and extended stays with no issues!! Customer service has always been spot on, and they communicate very well with you via text if anything is needed. If I could rate any higher I would! Thank you guys for all you do, I will continue to recommend everyone to you.

name: Lisa Lightsey
text: Bones, beds and biscuits is the best, most friendly and caring place to board your pet! Piper loves going to see his other family there! The staff is beyond awesome! The girls treat Piper as their own! Can’t say enough about how great this place has been to us!!

name: Kayla Gilbert
text: We LOVE Bones! My Ellie girl loves going to doggy daycare! She’s always greeted with happy, smiling faces and lots of love! The staff is excellent in easing any worries and extremely accommodating to your pup’s needs! Daycare has made a world of difference in Ellie’s separation anxiety.

resp.text: I love your Ellie! -Brandon thanks for the review we appreciate you!

name: Brenna Williams
text: The only place I leave my dog! She goes most week days for daycare and boards here anytime I’m out of town. My dog is so timid and shy, but she never hesitates to go with these girls. They obviously treat the animals with so much love. I love that I can leave my pet and feel at ease that she’s loved and taken care of, whether it’s just a few hours or for several days.

name: Robert Harkins
text: They take excellent care of my little buddy...I  highly recommend them...

resp.text: We Love Buddy!

name: Michelle Smith
text: Excellent care when leaving my English bull with them! Not everyone understands the care they need.  Ozzy made himself at home and loved being there.  Staff is outstanding!!

name: Kathryn Davis
text: My dog LOVES going to Bones! Every time I go out of town I felt so guilty till I brought him here. He loves the workers. It’s like he gets his own vacation when I go out of town. I couldn’t say enough good things about them. The facility is so nice and clean. I never have to worry about him when I’m gone.

name: Rochelle Price
text: I was very happy with how my Mini Golden Doodle got treated. Alisha was wonderful with  her. I asked her for daily updates  and she didn’t miss a day and it made my vacation great because I didn’t have to worry about Gabby . I will be taking her back . It’s the best place .

name: Brittaney Gooch
text: Bones, Beds and Biscuits is such a great place! They are always quick to respond to booking dates and/or any questions I may have. The environment is clean and our baby is loved on and called by name the minute we walk in the door. He’s never hesitant to go and isn’t desperate to see us when we come in the door for pick-up. So, I know he is having fun and being well taken care of. I love that they offer baths before pick-up, so he comes home smelling clean. And my favorite thing is getting to see pictures of him posted to their Facebook page while we are away. Our entire family is always anxious to see the pictures and it makes our heart happy to see him doing well. We couldn’t recommend them more!

name: Forrest Davis
text: The people there are great with dogs. They'll make your dogs feel like royalty. The biscuits fit my dog's taste rather than mine though.

name: Jaime Wynn
text: Our pup receives excellent care here. She loves the staff and is always so excited to go to daycare! Highly recommended for overnight stays or daycare.

name: Kalyn Riley
text: Our Stryker loves going to Bones! Anytime we go out of town this is where he stays! He seriously gets so excited when we tell him he’s going and forgets all about us when he is there! They treat all the fur babies like their own and you can tell they actually love taking care of them. I highly recommend using Bones, Beds, and Biscuits for your fur babies too!

name: Penny Gribble
text: We always leave Bella at Bones when we have to be out of town. She always comes home happy. So grateful we have a place to leave her that we don’t worry at all.

name: Kasey Knudson
text: My moms dogs stayed for a week at bones and they felt so comfortable. At home they're food aggressive and are territorial. But being away from home they were completely different dogs!

name: Debby Nelson
text: Bones Beds and Biscuits has helped me many times with rescue dogs. The staff is amazing and make me feel like every dog matters. They really take time to know the dogs and try their best to make each dog feel special. They are my friends.

name: Gloria Burns
text: Parker has been going to BBB for probably a year.  It has been a great experience for him.  The girls treat him like a baby, and it is good to know that he is in such good hands.  Plus, he gets so much exercise, he is worn out by the time he gets home!!

name: Michael Howard
text: I have been taking my little guy here for almost a year.  There is no better place!  My dog loves going and drags me in every morning.  Yes, he goes every day during the week.  I have boarded as well and it is great.  It’s his second home.

name: Abigail Strickland
text: Our pup loved Bones! He is very large due to being an Irish Wolfhound and they were even able to accommodate our big baby. 😊

name: Julie Russ
text: Bones is the best boarding and daycare around! We wouldn't trust anyone else. The staff and facilities are amazing, and the prices are so reasonable. We looooove Bones!

name: Amanda Kabel

Huxley gets excited when I tell him that he gets to go to daycare and play with his friends. Also, Bones, Beds and Biscuits is very clean! You can tell that they take pride in their business! I would recommend them a thousand times over!

text: This place is amazing!

name: Jim Fisher
text:
EDIT: This business is under new ownership so my old 1 star review (below) is no longer applicable. I do want to leave my old review in case the old owners decide to get back into business. The new owner asked that I give them another chance and I certainly will.

****OLD REVIEW*****
I've carried my dog, Stella (a very sweet Cocker Spaniel), about a half dozen times over the past 2 years.

One two of those occasions, no one was there to open the place at the appointed time. Having to wait on them while already late for a flight is not good.

Then, after using them for all that time, the last time I picked up my dog, they informed me that I was not welcomed back. Stella had evidently scratched a door jamb or otherwise did some damage to her room. What kind of place would keep dogs in a pen that can easily be damaged by dogs?

These folks majorly inconvenienced and insulted me. I wouldn't use them again if they begged.

name: Jake Lee
text: Friendly staff and they truly love the animals.

name: Camree Hickman
text: Loki loves it when he gets to go!!!

name: Kelly Haynes
text: My 13-year old is happier than he's ever been! I can't thank the staff of Bones, Beds, & Biscuits enough. Madix has severe separation anxiety, and has a tendency to destroy the house when left alone. That's why we are finally trying a doggy daycare, and couldn't be happier with the results! They have totally catered to his issues (anxiety, deafness, blindness, cancer, bad back), and he is so much happier! In fact, yesterday when I picked him up, he jumped into my car for the first time in probably a year. Thank you so much, Kim, for creating such a wonderful place for our fur babies.

I will be taking her back for more pampering!

text: Good service, friendly folks all at a reasonable price. I like the location as it’s close. Also like that our dog isn’t in a cage most of the day.

text: My fur babies love going to Pawsh Pets! They not only look amazing, they come home happy!! I definitely feel at ease when I drop them off for their pampering!

text: My first time there I asked to meet and speak with the groomer just to introduce myself and meet the person that was going to be handing my pet and tell her about my elderly dog and his special needs, well I was told she was busy. At time of pick up I asked if I could see the groomer once again she was too busy. Perhaps I was taught a higher standard of customer service, idk. Even though my pet received a good hair cut and the location is very convenient for me, will I return, probably not, which is a shame since I have eight dogs that need service.

name: Liz Joffrion
text: Great grooming service. I have been taking my two Cairn Terriers to Kimberly for hand stripping (in preparation for the conformation ring), one for two years and one just short of a year. Her expertise and positive attitude are exactly what you need in a professional groomer!

resp.text:
Liz,
Thank you for the kind words trusting us with your Terriers. We look forward to seeing you all again soon!

name: Donna Thompson
text: Best groomer in Athens Limestone. We have tried every place in town and surrounding area and not found anyone that was compatible with our dogs special needs.  At other places my dogs would have anxiety attacks when pulling into the parking lot.  Now I tell them we are going to go see Kim and they race me to the car.  Weeks after their grooming their fur and skin is still so soft to touch. She takes such good care of them while they are in her care,  unlike other places, Kim will take them outside and give them food and water.  I have one that is in diapers and she takes such great care of her and making sure she is always in a clean diaper. Now that I have found Kim, I'll never use anyone else.  I highly recommend Pawsh Pet Spaw to any and everyone who ask for grooming and boarding needs.

resp.text:
Donna,
Thank you so much for sharing your experience. We're always happy to help out with your pups!

name: Marshall Bosarge
text: We started using Pawsh Pet Spa as soon as they opened the doors when they were located in the Clements area. The service is second to none!! Kimberly is the ONLY person who has ever given our Bella a bath and cut and NEVER gave her razor burn. The service and price are fantastic. You truly get more than what you pay for in my opinion. Since Pawsh Pet has moved, I hate driving the distance, but I’m more than happy to make that drive just to have Kim take care of our baby. Once you have used them once, you and your pet will be spoiled. Thanks Kim, we’ll be seeing you very soon.

text: Great service.  My dogs love Kim

text:
Professional staff. Clean and inviting atmosphere.
Reasonable rates. Offering a wide variety of care.
I would recommend Pawsh Pet Spaw.

resp.text: Mrs. Common, thank you. We appreciate you bringing your boys to us. They are super sweet! Thank you for your review, we appreciate YOU!

name: Tim Shaw
text: I've had several appointments with Pawsh Pet Spaw, and the staff is always very polite, and professional. On Recons 1st visit there, the groomer was unable to chat, but that was fine with me since she was most likely giving another pet the full attention it deserved. I really respected this since Recon is an elderly dog, and found it comforting to think that he would be given the same un-interrupted attention. The woman up front addressed any details I had concerning Recons arthritis, and had me fill out a card listing any special needs Recon has. Great Groom, Great Customer Service. Thanks Gals. You Are Appreciated.

resp.text: Thank you so very much! We LOVE our elderly clients, they deserve all the extra love and attention for their old bones! We really work hard to give our furry clients the best experience ever. Thank you for your kindness and understanding, and always being a loyal and trusting client, you are VERY appreciated!

Then she said he would be done by ten but they were not done until 4pm.   They really should try to be more compassionate and understanding of others. But I guess it's a good thing they work with dogs instead of people. And also I was able to groom another dog with mats like my dad's without having to completely shave him.
