resp.text: Thank you so much for selecting us to groom your dog and for this awesome review. Call us anytime.

name: Kim Shaw
text: I have been using Zoom to Groom for about two years now, and they are fantastic. My groomer is Daneka, and both my dog Shasta and I love her! Not only is she an extremely talented groomer, but she is outgoing and extremely friendly. When Shasta (who does not like baths) sees Daneka, she runs to the door and wags her tail. And I get superb results every time. I wish I knew how to post a photo to show you how good Shasta looks after her groom, but I can tell you that this place can’t be beat!

resp.text: We love Daneka and we are so happy you love her also. Thank you so much for this review.

name: Dain Andrus
text: We have a small Pekingese and have been looking for a groomer for over a year.   These breeds are notorious for their dislike of baths and grooming.   This company provides a mobile grooming service that is completely self-contained in a large custom vehicle.  The scheduling was at our convenience and simplistic.   Ms. Bre showed up on time and within just over an hour, our miss priss was ready for Broadway.   We have had numerous groomers but Bre was exceptional.  Best grooming we have ever seen for our dog.   Just this alone would justify repeat business however our dog was clearly eager and content with Bre’s handling.  Past groomer’s have been mean and the dog responded in kind.   Not with Bre!!!  Dog loved her.   The company offers a full range of services.   Strongly recommend this company.

resp.text: Thank you so much.

name: Shondalyn Richardson
text: If you don't feel like leaving your house. This is the best mobile grooming service for your pet. They do an awesome job! I highly recommend this place to everyone. ☺😉

resp.text: Thank you

name: Belinda G
text: Groomer Lauren did a beautiful full groom on my Mom’s Schnauzer! This company is top notch! They communicate by text and phone. You may need to leave a voice message if you call them, but they will return your call. They give you a time window of arrival. Then during your time window, the groomer will text with a 30 minute time of arrival.

name: M H P
text:
Didn’t show-
Didn’t call-

I called them after my appointment window of time and then some had passed.

Someone texted  :  “The van was having issues and your phone # was taken down wrong”.

Caller ID from the original appointment call should’ve been used if that were true.

Unprofessional and Unreliable

I hope I’ve spared someone else!

resp.text: Please give us a call so we can discuss this. We are so sorry there was any issues.

name: Yasmine Mathieu
text: Their groomer left and I got stood up for my appointment. Same thing happened with the “rescheduled “ appt. They were apologetic but that does not help my dog who needs his grooming as his nails are overgrown. Tried to hang in there with them but they could not get it together. Few professionals can earn a living during Covid. I wish they took their blessing more seriously. When they do show up they do a good job.

resp.text: We are so sorry there was an issue. With COVID going on there are somethings that are out of our control. Please give us a call and we can discuss.

name: ricky westforth
text: Always do a great job. On time,  courteous,and quick. I love this business.

resp.text: Thank you

name: Hollie Gardner
text: I had both my fur babies bathed and hair cuts for cheaper than chain store and a lot less drama with the dogs. I will use no other than this place!! They really care about their clients.

resp.text: Thank you for this review and allowing us to groom your fur baby.

name: Born in the 70’s Peace
text: Daneka, is the best  she's very professional .Recommend her highly  for your fur babies  !!!!!!

resp.text: Thank you

name: G S Thompson
text: Zoom to Groom is a Great Service. They are very good with my "overweight an easily frightened" German Sheppard. They always do an excellent job on her. Thanks guys.

resp.text: Thank you

name: Jesse Harris
text: The absolute greatest groomers!! I love them!! They always so such a great job! I am moving and am going to miss them very much! Polo will too!

name: Cherry Harris
text: Great groomer, Rachael is the BOMB!  Great convince. Lifesaver for people with medical issues that keep them from driving.  I’m elated to have this service.

name: Alexandra Maffett
text: Zoom to Groom is a wonderful company. They do an awesome job cleaning our two pups who detest baths! I strongly recommend them.

name: Laura Sanderson
text: Rachel was very easy to work with and did an excellent job on our pup! He loves not having to sit in a kennel for 8 hours.

resp.text: Thank you

name: Elio Orta
text: It's expensive but very good service and result.

resp.text: Thank you

name: Dorothy Bridges
text: Love the Zoom to Groom.  What a fantastic idea and so convenient.  Plus Maxx did not have to stay hours somewhere waiting to be groomed.  He looks so sweet.  Thanks to Rachel.

name: Mateo Arenas
text: Our dog came back uneven and bleeding. We usually have a great experience with these guys, but this is the second time we have had the groomer Jessica and we will be requesting not to have her next time.

resp.text: Please give us a call so we can discuss this review. We understand the comment and appreciate the time for a review. You are still a regular customer we do every two months though even after this review so we would like to discuss this review. Thank you

name: Kacee Pruitt
text: Very good but pricey

resp.text: Thank you

name: Stephanie Mansmann
text: Booked put for almost a month AND quoted $130 for a dog bath...how???

resp.text: We are so sorry we are booked out but November and December are busy months due to the holidays. We do have availability later in December. We are checking with the receptionist on what happened because a price of 130.00 there is no way that was for a bath only. A full groom on a very large dog with an extensive full groom maybe 130. Full grooms include everything and not just a bath. I am sorry if there was some type of miscommunication.

name: Amanda Hurst
text: I can't review because they never returned my call.

resp.text: We are so sorry someone did not return your call. We take pride in calling all of our missed calls back. We hate you left a 1 star for that.

name: K Mac
text: It was Lucy’s first groom and she seemed to feel very comfortable with them! Jessica gave us exactly what we asked for. Love it!

resp.text: Thank you so much for this review. Jessica is awesome. Call us anytime.

name: Tylene McLeod
text: They do a Fantastic Job n their nice staff is Nice!

name: Jennifer McDonald
text: Our puppy was happy and did not come back panicked like he does from regular groomers ,he hates the drying crates.  She was nice and great with our fur baby and well worth the extra money!

resp.text: Thank you so much for for this awesome review. We love all of our fur babies and they are our top priority. Please call us anytime.

name: Mandy Watts
text: They did a good job on my dog

name: Elizabeth Emery
text: I've used them for over a year now and wouldn't go anywhere else. They came through when my dog rolled around in a mud puddle, they were there within 2 hours.

name: Vance Olmstead
text: Usually able to fit dogs in same day as long as you call in the morning, and do a good job. New location is a bit of a drive for me compared to last one, but my dogs know Rhonda and do good for her

name: Crystal Gaddy
text: Got my Yorkiepoo Chase's haircut and nails trimmed. We will be back. Great ladies, Mrs.Rhonda, and Ms.Cathy very patient. .. My son enjoyed helping the ladies clean up while we waited.

name: Kay Goddess
text: The staff is friendly and welcoming! My pup had the best time with them and came back so soft! Also the prices are very affordable!

resp.text: Awee Thank you so much  !! We look forward to seeing your fur Baby again soon  !! ❤❤

name: Sandra Crews
text: My little Tink (Yorkie) was so soft and smelled so clean!! His haircut was perfect!

name: Alicia Davis
text: Horrible place! They called me and said my dog was ready to be picked up, when I got there he wasn't even ready. When I got him in the car I realized his eye was swollen shut. I took him to the vet the next morning and they said he has a Corneal Ulcer, which they suspected was caused by using non-dog products and it got into his eye causing a chemical burn. When the owner was notified of the incident she immediately got defensive and blamed me and implied I do not care about my fur baby.

name: Macey Booth
text: Overall an awful experience. The place smells like a chain smoker lives in it. They only take cash or check, but dont let you know ahead of time. They called me to let me know when my dog was ready, and left a voicemail. When I called them to let them know someone was on their way, they acted like they didnt have my dog. They closed early. They were rude at pick up. They did not even cut my dog the way I asked.  If I could give a 0/5 I would.

name: Latasha Tolbert
text: THE WORST GROOMING EXPERIECE WE HAVE EVER HAD! My dog looked better before he went in to them!  Cut doesn't look fresh, hair on ears and tail wasn't combed out!  Almost looks like he was groomed about three or four days ago.  Then on top of that, they tell me when I came to pick him up they don't take credit cards, but checks or cash only!  I would not recommend this place to anyone who is particular about how their dog looks after being groomed.

name: Ronda White
text: Super nice and got an appointment right away! My two pups look great! Will definitely use them again if I am I town!

name: Kathy Clark
text: She does a good job

name: Lavish
text: Wont be coming back they messed our poodle up. Bad haircut.

name: Rhonda Ball
text: This place is Awesome  !!

name: Vickie Mitchell
text: Made an appointment and no one was there when I got there

name: Cyndi Johnson
text: My dog received the best treatment. All my questions were answered and I felt as though the new vet did a wonderful job! I would see her again! I have never had a bad experience. I highly recommend them to everyone!

name: Mayle Pujol
text: We are new in town....Finding a great veterinarian was important! We had a great experience From the moment we were greeted at front desk to the moment we checked out. I was very concerned about my dog getting sick bc he’s usually healthy. Dr. Brumsky took her time checking Forrest and making sure he got the right meds and dosage. He’s doing better and we are thankful to her and staff.

name: Becky Pounders
text: North Alabama Animal Hospital is outstanding. The love and care they show for the animals they treat is amazing. They care about each one as if it was their own. They have been great with helping our Willow and I wouldn't even imagine taking her anywhere else. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a place for your fur babies. You will not be disappointed.

name: Sidney Magoon
text: I took my dog, Jethro, there and they were great! The vet was very helpful! He sat on the floor with my dog and was interacting with him to gain his trust so he could look at his ears. I thought that was just awesome! I was also in and out in a timely manner.

name: Christy Shaw
text: We Love NAAH!! They are wonderful, the whole staff!! Our Max Loves going to the vet, his tail starts wagging when we get there, they are really great with all animals!

name: Susan Cole
text: The staff are always so kind and very knowledgeable. Most important, they care about my fur baby.  I lost a kitty last year, and they were so kind and comforting to me during my loss.  In the end, they went above and beyond to help her and without a doubt, she received the best care possible.  I'm thankful for all the staff and will always remember their kindness and dedication to the work they do.  You will feel the same after your first visit.

name: Brenda Lee
text: I got a little crazy when I went to Birmingham and Rocky got worse than he had been and posted a negative remark. It has been taken down. I came home and saw Dr Thompson and we discussed Rocky and options. At one point Rocky could not go outside without coughing. I have been following the plan that was worked out with Dr Thompson and Rocky went out today. He was not coughing and before I could catch him he was across the road checking out girls. Thank you Dr Thompson for giving my dog back his quality of life. We have been out several times and no coughing. We are following the plan.

name: Terri Sassone
text: We are new to the area and changing vets is stressful. Benny's visit was great. He's a special needs senior boy and the vet and staff were awesome. Benny had them trained to give him treats in no time! We will be bringing our other two hooligans in soon!

name: Heath King
text: We started using NAAH after moving to the Shoals area, and our experiences so far have been excellent. We had to make the difficult decision this week to put our dog down after his fight with cancer. We were so pleased with how compassionate, patient, helpful and caring the staff at NAAH were. I would highly recommend North Alabama Animal Hospital to anyone!

name: Lee Renfroe
text: North Alabama Animal Hospital is a very kind, caring practice with high quality veterinarians and staff.  I hold them in very high regard and trust them completely with my pets!  Awesome organization!

name: Janice Smith
text: I trust that everyone at North Alabama Animal Hospital will take excellent care of my pets. They are always competent and compassionate. It is obvious that they love what they do!

name: Laura Hamner
text: North Alabama Animal Hospital does an amazing job caring for our chocolate lab. I would, and do, highly recommend NAAH to anyone who is looking for a team to care for their beloved pet(s). Keep up the good work NAAH.

name: Catie Gajewski
text: The staff was very friendly and the doctor was very thorough getting my leg updated on vaccinations.

name: Vince Brewton
text: Troy and his staff provide great care and treatment. North Alabama Animal Hospital is one of two vet practices in the area we recommend to friends and newcomers. Troy's expertise and experience are outstanding.

name: Emily Parker
text: They have taken care of many of my fur babies over the years. They not only provide great care of the animal but the owner as well. I’ll never forget the horrible day I had to put my Sweetie girl down but I will also never forget the compassion of Dr Youngblood and the techs that day. I highly recommend this office and all the docs!

name: Camilla MIller
text: Everyone was fantastic. So nice and helpful. Thank you for the love you all have for animals. Don't believe you could have made the experience any better!

name: Sandra Johnson
text:
Wonderful  Drs. and staff, they are very patient and caring toward both patients and owners. They really do strive to give the very best care that you could possibly want for your pets at extremely reasonable prices. In my opinion
They are the best in the business. You will never regret taking your babies (pets) to
them.

name: Alison Hawn
text: We are forever grateful to NAAH for all they do to take care of our two babies Max & Okie! They are both high maintenance pups and require a great deal of medical attention. We are always beyond satisfied with the care they receive and the courteous way we are always treated. We truly appreciate everything they do for our babies!

name: tuscaniracer27
text: You guys are always amazing. Your customer service and pet care are top notch. Thank you so much for providing such a great place!

name: Sara Shapiro
text: Dr. Bonner at North Alabama Animal Hospital has provided the best of care for our three dogs. He is professional and is always responsive to their needs.

name: Christy Arnold
text:
What a great team at NAAH!
You all are awesome!
Daisy is happy

name: David Painter
text: I've taken my dogs here for years. I've seen all the doctor's at some point and time. I usually see Adam Thompson; he's very nice and listens to your concerns. I highly recommend all of the doctor's.

name: Cassidy Beck
text: I've been to plenty of vets in the Shoals and I was recommended to come here by a family member and this will be the only vet clinic I use from now on. my cat had a small procedure done & the vet called me personally to tell me that everything went well and took the time to explain what all they did and asked if I had any questions (Ive never had a vet do this before) The receptionists and the other ladies were super nice, too. A great experience.

name: Laura Engdahl
text: I like being able to go in the clinic with my pets. Under the current circumstances- COVID19- I understand why I could not. I think that the curbside process worked quite well. NAAH is a great place to take your pets. Very caring. I’ve been using them over five years. They always get you in when you need to get in. 😻😻😻

name: Rebecca Patterson
text: Excellent care for our senior schnauzer “Sophie”. Not only the normal checkups but an extensive surgery made us feel like they truly care as much as I do.

name: Lisa Morgan
text: Very clean facility. Staff is very professional and pleasant. Atmosphere is very pleasant. My pup loves the staff. They treat him like there own. Would highly recommend my friends and family to this facility.

name: Darcy Williams
text: Dr. Thompson and the rest of the staff always go above and beyond to take care of my kitties and always keep me well informed. I appreciate them so much!

name: John Fisher
text: We brought our dog here at the recommendation of neighbors. Our dog had a cut on one of her paws. At any rate, we were thoroughly impressed by the quality of care and compassion of everyone we met. Highly recommend.

name: Harleigh Houston
text: I honestly couldn’t have asked for a better experience. Y’all were beyond amazing!!

name: Sandi Ayers
text: All the doctors are very competent, knowledgeable and caring.  They are willing to do all they can to help with anything your "family" member needs and they don't forget you either.

name: Jean Goodson
text: The veterinarians at NAAH are simply the absolute best in the area and from my experience in the state.  They are kind and caring to pets and parents and never fail to go the extra mile for our beloved fur babies.  The entire staff from the front desk to the back kennels are unfailingly nice and professional.  These folks are the real deal!

name: Forrest Davis
text: The staff here are incredibly helpful and knowledgeable. They will answer any questions you have about treatments or the health of your pet. You can tell they truly care about keeping your animals healthy and happy.

name: Teresa Box
text: I was so impressed with NAAH! My Crocker Spaniel has finally got relief from a chronic skin condition. We saw the vet Jason Bonner. He was so thorough.  He listened asked questions, gathered his info, examined dog. We talked again and came up with a starting plan. And after 3 days Harley is starting to jump and wanting to play again! #1 Rating in my book

name: Michelle Petty
text: Your staff and Veterinarians have always had my fur babies health a priority. Everyone is always very kind and professional but yet you make patients feel like family.  I’ve had several Veterinarians for my fur babies over the last 20yrs and I must say your office is hands down the very best.  I know you care for mine as you would your very own and that is so comforting especially when at times have to bring in sick and critical babies without your care and explanation of procedures may have turned out not in a good way.  Thank you so much for your continued care for both pet parents and pets

name: Heather Sheppard
text: Everyone at NAAH is wonderful!! I would not trust anyone else to care for my pets!

name: Patricia Dyar
text: The only improvement possible I can think of is not under your control. I’m an owner of a new patient and I have yet to see the inside of your clinic due to COVID-19!  This, too, shall pass!  Very pleased with your handling of the pandemic!

name: Kyla Pearson
text: By far the best vet hands down! My Sassy Frassy Just loves them! I love that they love my baby like she was there’s! Very friendly also and that’s a plus in my book!

name: S Stewart
text:
Appreciate all the NAAH team That took care of Odie.  Great training as well. He goes to get in the crate at home just to rest.
Just amazed at your wonderful therapy throughout Odie’s two surgeries and all that extra care.  And yes includes the crew that gave extra petting, extra trips out to tinkle and more.
Odie really is a great dog.
He had a set back this past Friday night with a hurt right knee. (I’m thinking slept on it wrong).
Dr Troy gave a great assessment and treatment.  He finally is not having to give to it (on Tuesday).
Odie is protecting himself better now. Being very careful.
Thank you Thank You Thankful for ALL of you ⚽️🥏 no more playing chase the squirrels 🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿
(Too expensive a game)

name: Jennifer Warren
text: Fast friendly staff. I was kept informed about everything that was happening and all the options were explained in detail. I would highly recommend North Alabama Animal hospital

name: Melissa Tapp
text: Everyone went above and beyond with our dog Chloe and we were very happy! This was the first time we used North Alabama Animal Hospital and even with having to do curbside check-in due to the Covid-19 issues, everyone was very professional and responsive. Dr. Thompson called me off and on during the visit to discuss treatment and recommendations for Chloe and explained everything in a way we could understand. We will continue to use them for Chloe and for our other pets as well!

name: Caitlyn Brewer
text: They make everything so convenient from making appointments to refilling meds. I brought my fur baby there when my old vet was insisting apoquel was a fix all for my dogs allergies even after I told her it had stopped working. NAAH listening to everything I had to say and helped me look for answers. Now my baby is on Cytapoint and feeling so much better! This dog mamas heart is happy

name: William Cooper
text: Absolutely the best experience I have had with animal care specialists!

name: James Lamar
text:
Had Christmas plans to come to Muscle Shoals to visit my dad and then on to Monroe, LA to visit my son. I sent a message to North Alabama Animal Hospital inquiring about boarding. Dr. Thompson called me and answered all of my questions and even invited me to come to the office for a tour when I got in town.  I took my Cavalier King Charles, Sam, with me for the tour and everyone was so nice. I had no concerns after the visit on what kind of care my Sam would be given. The next day I took Sam in and he stayed 3 nights. When I picked him up there were no issues at all. The staff is great and the rates are very reasonable. I’ll definitely board him there again in the future.

James

name: Michael Richardson
text: Always leave feeling my pets have had the best of care

name: Butch McGee
text: The staff is so very friendly to my pet and I. The curb side service is a safe and smart way to receive care for your pet.  All my questions and concerns were addressed and never felt rushed at all. A great place for pet care

name: Lise Griffin
text: 'When my fur baby has an illness or medical condition, I need someone I can truly trust. That is North Alabama Animal Hospital.

name: Victoria Atkinson
text: I've been bringing my dog hear since 2012. The staff are always pleasant and the doctors as well! They genuinely CARE for the overall health of our fur babies! I recommend this team to anyone who has just become an animal family to those who have had their fur babies.

name: Jay Oliver
text: This is by far the best animal hospital I’ve ever been to. The staff comes out and calls your pets name when it’s there time for the visit. They are always ready to answer any question you may have along the way. 5 star animal hospital.

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Austin Lee
text: The staff was really knowledgeable and friendly. The treated my pet like one of their own

name: Karen Minnelli
text: We have been using North Alabama Animal Hospital for about ten years and could not be more pleased. Each staff member is very professional and obviously loves what they’re doing. It is very clean and the doctors are awesome!  Strongly recommend this facility for all your pet needs!

name: Maps
text: I'm not a local and came into the area for family reasons. I needed a vet to go to and my brother told me to go here. It's the best around he said. I'm biased as I love my vet at home but when I walked in I was impressed just by the looks. Neat, organized and clean with plenty of space for people bringing in their fury family members. Everybody was very friendly... From the staff to the techs and docs.. Even other customers! Great atmosphere. My dog is special to me as she is my medical service dog and I require different methods of care with vets that not a lot will provide. Not here... They were awesome and did everything I asked for and then some. Above and beyond! If I lived in the area, this place would be my only place. If they were where I'm from I would switch in a heartbeat.. Of you love your fury friends then you should be taking them here for care.

name: Heather Butler
text: They're awesome friendly and kind .my dog has an issue with his leg they're so sweet to him

name: Rohan Williams
text: Best service for my dog.  My Cane Corso can be a handful but they treat him like their own.

name: Debbie Ames
text: The very best veterinary hospital I have ever used. Highly recommended!

name: Richard Incontro
text: Easily the best care available in the area.  Four young, bright doctors each with different areas of interest who are all familiar with your pet's clinical needs and coordinate for the highest level of care.  My best buddy would not be alive if not for them.  And not to leave the supporting staff out..they are fantastic!

resp.text: Thank you from all of us! We love Brady!

name: Emily Smith
text: Staff is very friendly. The doctors are very thorough and never leave you with any questions. Dr. Bonner and Dr. Thompson always make us feel special! Would recommend NAAH to anyone!

name: Donna Ellis Brown
text: Dr Bonner really cares about the pets.  He doesn't just treat them as a number.  He thinks of them as individuals needing care.   Also,  the girls that work there are gentle and make the pets feel comfortable.

name: Shanna Jean
text:
I 've been to 4 VETS in our area and I'm so very thankful that I finally found one I like. Dr. Thompson is spot on and the best in my book!
All of the staff is so comforting and friendly. I feel as if my fur babies get the best treatment and taken care of to the fullest. So happy to be a client.

name: Jenny Louise
text: Brought my baby Coco in due to breathing problem an didn't think he would make it through the day an after antibiotics an shots my baby is lively an as feisty as ever an doing great,the Dr.and nurses were great an very helpful ,will be bringing all my babies here from now on,they are the best

name: Sara Kennedy
text: North Alabama Animal Hospital has been there for my pets at all stages of life. From small puppies and kittens to the end of my senior dogs life. I wouldn’t choose anyone else to care for my animals.

name: Cara Gough
text: This is the absolutely best place to take your pets! I wish I had a doctor for myself that was as knowledgeable and caring as Dr. Bonner!

name: Kimberly Tennyson Hamilton
text: I love North Alabama Animal Hospitial! Especially all the employees. Emilee Hankins was very friendly and thoughtful with our Eli! We will be back!❤️ Thank you all!

name: Ashley Carpenter
text: Great Vet, great vet techs! Everyone there is caring and compassionate

name: Abigail Smith
text: Incredible business. Takes very good care of your furry family members!

name: Susan Thornton Willingham
text: Absolutey would not go anywhere else. Excellent team work! Explaining the issue fully, giving detailed guidance, and an open willingness to listen to all your concerns without rushing you along. Using ppe to protect themselves and the public during the pandemic. Pet app that gives a little back for use on pets needs, appts, messaging is awesome.

name: Ryan Aday
text: We always have the utmost confidence that the Doctors and staff at North Alabama Animal Hospital will give the very best opinions, diagnosis and care for our 4 legged furry family members.

name: Will Wheeler
text: I will highly recommend North Alabama Animal Hospital to all who ask. Very kind and loving and professional. Y'all have treated all three of my cat children wonderful. I just cannot think of any other place I'd rather take my babies to have their health care taken care of. I want to say thank you to all at the north Alabama Animal Hospital the receptionist to the doctors.

name: Rebecca Siery
text: I am very pleased with the service provided to Allie. She had gone through a couple of bad experiences at another Vet's office. Although I brought Allie in just for grooming services, I knew she ( and I) would be nervous during her first visit with you. I understand Allie did very well and I attribute it to your team's professionalism. In addition, Allie's coat never felt as clean and soft as it did after your grooming service. Allie will be coming to you for all her needs, including annual vaccinations. Thank you for making Allie's (and my) experience a pleasant one!

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Andrew Massey
text: Our Great Dane had somehow impaled herself through the chest and out her back under her arm. We thought she was going to die that night. The Dr.'s stitched her back up and she walked out the door with a limp the next day. 3 days later she is running around like nothing happened. We will always be thankful for them.

name: Craig Keller
text: We trust North Alabama Animal Hospital, the Vets & Staff with the care of our boy, Chappy!  They are great with detailed diagnosis, care instructions and suggestions to improve his life and help us keep him active and healthy.  Fantastic service!! Craig & Cindy K.

name: BCS
text: Highly recommended. Really put my pup and i at ease, even with the initial phone call. If your in the shoals area or can make it to this location please do.

name: Taelor Wallace
text: Brought my spaniel here while I was in town visiting over the holidays because she was acting sick. They got us in immediately and were very helpful. They were thorough and assured me that if anything changed or if we saw any setback, I could call or bring her back in. I highly recommend them!

name: Stephanie Flanagan
text: I have always had a great experience with my pets at NAAH. I’m open to seeing any vet there because they’re all knowledgeable and show their love for our pets, as well as being honest about why treatments are or are not needed. Thank you NAAH!

name: Michelle Sibley
text: Dr. Youngblood & Dr. Bonner have always given our pets excellent care!

name: Joanne Bush
text: Excellent, skilled, animal loving, and compassionate vets and technicians.

name: QuadCities Daily
text: Great folks who care about your fur babies as much as you do

name: Belinda Bishop
text: even though it was past going-home time, Dr. Bonner & staff stayed with us, going over options to hopefully help our Ringo feel better.  never a mention of being delayed.  this is truly one of the most, if not the most, caring vet clinics we've ever had.

name: Cre Thompson
text: My sweet Moe has asthma and Dr Bonner has been so straight forward and proactive with her treatment. I appreciate him and the entire staff of NAAH so much! They are so caring and helpful! I wouldn't take my loving pets anywhere else!

name: Sarah Ann Evans
text: Dr. Brumby and every tech was fabulous. This is my first pet and first vet experience. They took great care of Pablo and got me in an out within an hour. I was able to schedule my appointment and get in the same day. I will definitely be back.

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Mallory Angel

text: This is hands down the best place to take your dog in the state. I just read some negative  reviews on this great business. It looks like these people don't have there facts straight. She is the only person i have ever known that truly 100% of the time put the pets and the customers first each and every time. I can't say enough great things about Kimberly and her staff.

name: Stephanie Smith
text: Absolutely in love with this business and their staff. They constantly amaze me with how they treat my dog like their own. They know us and our dog by name, they constantly are sharing their accomplishments and experiences with us. My dog is absolutely in love with the staff, some days I worry my baby won’t even come home with me! Love this place!

name: Stew Hayles III
text:
Took my dog to the Barkery in October 2020. It was z horrible experience.  I blame myself because I waited until the last minute to make a boarding appointment at my usually facility, which is Golden Animal Hospital in Pike Road(great service and care everytime!). We boarded our 18 month old golden doodle for 10 days. He was supposed to be groomed the last day he was there. We keep his hair long so he was only supposed to be washed and trimmed.

When I dropped him off, the receptionist was nice enough but the place smelled very bad. I've used several dog care facilities since we're new to Montgomery and the Bakery was by far the worst in cleanliness.  The dogs and the administration area are all in one. This created a very unorganized check-in since the receptionist was moving, picking up and pushing dogs off the counter the entire check-in. I looked over this because we were literally flying out of town the same day.

10 days later, I called to the Barkery know I was headed to pick my dog up. They told me that they had to cut his hair down low because he had a few matted areas on his legs. I didn't like that but its understandable. I arrive to the counter and the owner hands me a bag of hair to "prove" how bad the matts were! They brought my dog out and he was literally shaved down to skin😥 It was so sad! They didn't even grind or clip his nails. It was clear that they had no clue what they were doing. They couldn't find his collar and leash. They said that I must have taken it with me. I usually take them with me at my normal grooming place but I thought I remembered leaving them. I didn't take the time to debate the point because I was almost numb at the sight of my dog. I just kept telling myself, "This is your fault for waiting too long to make an appointment and taking him to the ONLY place that had an opening" Now I know why they had an opening. For the life of me, I can not figure out how people are giving this place good reviews.

When I get home and the family and I console each other, lol.....I find my dogs collar and flea collar buried in his door food that I had left with the Barkery. My dog also wouldn't eat for days after we got him back and he was sick for at least a week. He sneezing and vomiting. Btw, he smelled horrible. I was trying to figure out what they used to wash him and if they actually bathed him the day before I picked him up.

This was the worst experience ever and I would learn to groom my own dog if this was the only place open. On top of all of this, the receptionist and owner never apologized for the haircut. They basically blamed me because I let him get matts.

Worst experience ever!

name: Jonathan Bowman
text: This place has helped my dog tremendously with his separation anxiety. The staff was amazing and took a lot of time making sure he was comfortable and okay being there without his family. He absolutely loves going now and tries to fight me to leave. I cannot say enough amazing things about this place!

name: Amber
text: Love the staff and they are so good to our pups! I get cute pictures of my babies and they always remember me when I come in!

name: Dan Knotts
text: The staff at the Barkery are awesome!  When I first brought my Jax in they ask a lot of questions at first and realized they just cared about him. He has anxieties and they made him feel good enough for me to leave without much fanfare. He must have played hard because he was out not long after getting home. I see why you ask questions like  allergies,  a jumper, aggressive etc. They cleaned him up and obviously took good care of him. Thank you Kim, I can see you are a true animal lover.

name: Monica Apps
text: My baby Pebbles loves her friends at daycare, every time I say let’s go to daycare she starts jumping around. I love the whole staff there, wonderful place of business.

name: Leigh Ann Bowden
text: Today I brought in my pit mix to get her nails clipped. She has never been a fan of having her paws touched, much less letting us clip her nails. Kim & her staff at The Barkery went above & beyond to make it an easy (instead of terrifying) experience for my Harleigh Girl. I even rewarded her with some of their delicious homemade dog treats. When Harleigh got some she was all smiles & absolutely loved her Banana Cupcake and Zebra Cookie. I would definitely recommend The Barkery to anyone looking for pet grooming, doggie daycare or even just a nail clip.

name: Sydni Bing
text: I bring my 3 fur babies to The Barkery for daycare and grooming. My dogs are always so excited when we pull in the parking lot they’re already trying to get to the doors!! The staff members are the sweetest things and i just couldn’t ask for a better second family for my babies.

I would rate a 10 out of 10 if I could

name: Sandra Norris
text: I bring my 2 basset hounds for grooming and daycare, my girls Lily and Molly. The pull me into the doors, they love Mrs. Kim and all of the staff. They are always exhausted whenever they come home!

name: Maryla Webb
text: My dog is the best testament to the Barkery. He goes absolutely nuts when I take him there and yesterday didn't want to leave to come home.

name: Makayla Washington
text: Can’t say enough good things about how compassionate the staff here is!! My family recently had our four-legged family member, Nala, pass away. Nala used to have regular appointments with Kimberly and when they hadn’t heard from us around the time of her next one they reached out to check in. When we informed them of her passing you could tell the staff members were actually upset as well. Then a few days later in the mail they had even sent us a card apologizing for our loss. Whenever we decide to add another four legged member to our family, we will be returning. Thank you to The Barkery for treating all your clients like family!

name: Amanda Rowland
text: Recently started bringing my babies to doggy daycare at The Barkery. The girls at the front were very professional and took time making sure my babies were comfortable before starting to allow my babies in with the others. The environment is fun and happy. It was a joy seeing just how happy and excited the other dogs coming in were. We will most definitely be returning!!!!

name: Alexandria Harvest
text: Pet Parents BEWARE! On July 2, I dropped my dog Midnight off at The Barkery, we planned to go out of town, so we let the staff member know that we would want to do daycare and boarding, because we planned to go out of town and would be back late. We ended up not going out of town, so my sister called The Barkery  at 5:35 to inform them that we would not be boarding and we were coming to pick midnight up, she said okay, everything seemed normal. My sister got to The Barkery 6 minutes later and call and through tears told me that the Barkery allowed my dog to get out of their gate, around 5:00pm,  THIRTY MINUTES AGO. Apparently Haley the staff worker, did not want to upset her and tell her over the phone. Mind you, they thought we were boarding, and at no point did they reach out to either Emergency contact listed on the paperwork, had my sister not unexpectedly showed up, it looks like they had no plan to reach out. We were told that Haley was in one room(making mop water), and Kimberly the owner was in another room(cleaning) while the dogs were outside, and unattended. They heard a loud noise, and a customer who was coming to pick up their dog came in and informed them that a black dog with a blue collar had gotten out. They had no idea because they weren't watching. One Hour later, me and my siblings were out looking for my dog with NO ASSISTANCE from The Barkery.  No one called either of Midnight's listed emergency contacts,  reached out to establish a perimeter, or even apologize and explain what happened. I had to reach out to Kimberly and request that she call me via text. When she did call, she did not apologize, she simply blamed us because he jumped the fence, all while not looking for my dog that she lost. My dog has been coming to the barkery since they were on Woodley rd, and he's never jumped. Around 7 I went back to Barkery, and Kim

name: Kaleigh Culver
text: My yorkie,Oscar stayed all week for boarding while we went out of town for work and he loved it so much I didn’t think he was gonna leave and come back home to me!!! Stopped and got him a pup a chino afterwards:) We will definitely be back! Thankful to find someone I can trust with my fur baby! Thanks to,Kimberly and staff @TheBarkery

name: NaTasha Williams
text: My experience with the whole staff was absolutely amazing, they took care & loved my baby Rue.

name: Micheal Waters
text: Ordered a birthday cake from The Barkery. They had it ready the same day and my dog absolutely loved it!

name: Patricia Macon
text: My dog Lucy goes here for daycare and grooming and she gets so excited whenever we arrive. She always looks and smells so good whenever she gets groomed with Kim!!

name: Greg Hooper
text: Hands down would never take my dogs anywhere else. My dogs are ecstatic to come in and never want to come home!

name: Kim Tomberlin
text: You can really see how much they care for the fur baby clients and their parents. Their treatments are amazing, they do baths, messages, hair removal brushes them so well and does all styles and sizes  of grooming.  I was very happy to see when you board your fur babies they have someone there  with them  24 hours a day . That means so much to me. They make wonderful treats from scratch that look so good and healthy. I know that mine will be there quite often. You can trust that when you take your fur child there they get the best care possible!

name: Zovi “Zovi” V
text: Pet Parents BEWARE! On July 2, I dropped my dog Midnight off at The Barkery, we planned to go out of town, so we let the staff member know that we would want to do daycare and boarding, because we planned to go out of town and would be back late. We ended up not going out of town, so my sister called The Barkery  at 5:35 to inform them that we would not be boarding and we were coming to pick midnight up, she said okay, everything seemed normal. My sister got to The Barkery 6 minutes later and call and through tears told me that the Barkery allowed my dog to get out of their gate, around 5:00pm,  THIRTY MINUTES AGO. Apparently Haley the staff worker, did not want to upset her and tell her over the phone. Mind you, they thought we were boarding, and at no point did they reach out to either Emergency contact listed on the paperwork, had my sister not unexpectedly showed up, it looks like they had no plan to reach out. We were told that Haley was in one room(making mop water), and Kimberly the owner was in another room(cleaning) while the dogs were outside, and unattended. They heard a loud noise, and a customer who was coming to pick up their dog came in and informed them that a black dog with a blue collar had gotten out. They had no idea because they weren't watching. One Hour later, me and my siblings were out looking for my dog with NO ASSISTANCE from The Barkery.  No one called either of Midnight's listed emergency contacts,  reached out to establish a perimeter, or even apologize and explain what happened. I had to reach out to Kimberly and request that she call me via text. When she did call, she did not apologize, she simply blamed us because he jumped the fence, all while not looking for my dog that she lost. My dog has been coming to the barkery since they were on Woodley rd, and he's never jumped. Around 7 I went back to Barkery, and Kimberly and her significant other, Jake arrived( how she had time to go get her boyfriend while she claimed she was looking for my dog, not sure). Kimberly ran inside the building, never spoke, never apologized and sent Jake, who is not an owner of The Barkery,  to "deal" with us. Apparently, Kimberly had lied to Jake and told him that she was threatened by myself on the phone and was called a b****h, which was untrue, I was actually quite pleasant all considered. When Kimberly finally came outside, I asked her was she ever threaten or called any obscenity and she said no that never happened. Jake went off to smoke his KOOL cigarette, because the whole reason he came was because of her lie.Why Kimberly would make herself to be the victim when she lost my dog is beyond me. Kimberly yelled us, blamed us,  cursed, and never once apologized. I understand that things happen, but if you're a dog sitter and you lose the dog, you need to take some form of responsibility and at least be sorry and try to help. Instead of being concerned,  Kimberly(owner) and her daughter, and another staff member keep screaming about their "Livelihood".  Thankfully, me and my family were able to go out looking at 6:00 am and posting lost posters and found Midnight near Huntingdon College. The staff members saw us looking for our dog, offered no help, and still no apology.  Today is July 9, and The Barkery has never followed up, or showed any concern for their negligence. My dog refuses to leave me or my sisters side since this event, so I'd advise you to find another place to drop off your four legged family member.

name: Tim Watts
text: I witnessed the entire staff act in a rude and extremely unprofessional manner . The entire staff allowed my sister's dog, Midnight, to walk away from the facility due to the staff not regularly monitoring the outside activities of the animals. Furthermore, they waited until a family member arrived at the facility to pick up the dog instead of calling the emergency contacts to notify of the situation, approximately 30 minutes after Midnight ran off. The owner, Kimbery, argued with us, accused us of calling her a derogatory term, admitted she lied about being called a derogatory term, and then refused to look for the dog. This incident occurred on Thursday, July 2nd. Today is July 5th and we have yet to hear from Kimberly on the status of the search for our dog. I highly recommend that you look elsewhere for your dog sitting needs.

name: Shantel Stewart
text: There is no doubt that there are plenty of boarding and grooming places to go to in Montgomery.  HOWEVER, The Barkery has a staff that is loving and caring.  I have been going here for about 6 years.  The staff is unbelievably loving and caring.  They become emotional attached to your dogs and become your friend.  Kim, Steve, and Sydni are all so very sweet.  If your dog is not the playful type, then they may not like this place.  The Barkery has a very dog friendly natural playful atmosphere where all of the dogs get to be dogs!  They get to play and socialize with one another and get treats and loved on by the staff.  Every dog owner is particular in their own way and that's understanding.  But despite them being our fur children, they are still dogs and want to play with one another and run around.  If you want your dog to have fun and be loved and for you to feel secure knowing that they are safe, then the Barkery is the place to go!!  I'll never go elsewhere.  My dog instantly gets excited the moment we pull up and is eager to run inside.  That lets me know that they too love going there.  And don't get me started on how amazing they smell when they get groomed.  As silly as it sounds, I could smell my dog all day after they get groomed.  I LOVE THE BARKERY!!!!

name: Jennifer Craig
text: My experience was horrible and I am sure my 65lb bulldog was traumatized!!! I took my furbaby Karmen in on 3/22/17. I wanted her bathed, nails clipped and glands cleaned, and ears cleaned. When I picked her up her head looked wrinkled, not normal.I just thought probably nothing considering she had never been groomed before, BOY WAS I WRONG!!! Whatever it was got worse daily and actually looked different daily! I tried calling the boutique on Mon because I wanted to explain what was going on but they were closed. I had an appointment in Georgia on Tues and I knew by then my dog needed medical attention so on my way home I made her an appointment with Greenbrier Animal Clinic. The vet agreed that it did look like clippers had been used and it also looked like an allergic reaction but couldn't understand why it was just on her head. I asked the vet to call Lylias Poodle Boutique and find out exactly what they did. Our vet said that Dorthy the owner explained their procedure and was very apologetic and told us that she wanted to pay the vet bill, and bathe Karmen in baby shampoo. She also wanted to get a look at what was going on. I told the vet that I really didn't expect her to pay the bill buy the vet said go ahead and let her and let her see what was going on with the dog. The next day my husband and I took our baby into Lylias Poodle Boutique, I thought for sure she would look at the dog but she rudely said I can't give her a bath today!!! I said, I didn't bring het for a bath. I had the invoice in my hand. She said I am not paying the bill and why didn't you call me 1st and I did try Mon but they were closed, to make a long story short, she had zero concern for my dog! She didn't even try to get to a private spot to discuss the situation. She just verbally attacked me and wouldn't let me explain anything! I couldn't get a word in edgewise. She was like I talked to the vet and I said YES I asked her to call you. She got quiet when a customer walked in so I took the opportunity to say, Well alls I know is someone in this place did something to mu dogs head. She then told me that I was rude, I said um I believe you are the rude one!!! She said LEAVE, JUST LEAVE! I then said I used you for over 16yrs, I cannot believe this!!! She said LEAVE!!! I DON'T NEED YOUR BUISNESS!!! I said I will leave and you need not worry I dont need your buisness. The vet treated Karmen for an allergic reaction but she was completely unsure what she was treating. I now believe it may have been blisters from scalding water, I don't think we will ever know exactly what happened. I honest to God cannot believe the way the owner Dorthy treated us. I took my yorkie to her for almost 16 years and recommended this place for years but now I say beware!!! You just don't know what you will get!!!

name: Lyn Stephens
text:
An hour into this twilight zone experience I finally got Rocky.   He was dirty.  He was supposed to have been bathed the morning of pick up and was not.  He was panting horribly and obviously in distress because of lack of water.  When we arrived home it was apparent he had not been taken outside as needed.
He was frantic to get to his water bowl.

Here is my story.

We have used Paws to Relax regularly for 7 or more years but never again.  What started as a slow decline about a year ago has now crashed and burned.  Apparently the overseeing authority at Crawford Road Animal Hospital has lost control and/or simply does not care because they have been blatantly ignoring the decline.   I only hope they do not operate their veterinary clinic in the same manner.
Some sort of change occurred about a year or so ago that resulted in a frustration process of drop off and pick up.  Being solidly satisfied with previous boarding care given to my pets, I overlooked this and dealt with it.  This mutated into being harder and harder to keep up with what time and what days they would and would not be there as hours available became less and days open became a guess.
This lack of customer service raised questions as to the care of my pet. He continued to appear happy and well taken care of so I dismissed these thoughts and tried to adapt to their customer service inconsistency.

I arrived to drop Rocky, a Boxer, off Tuesday June 30, 2020 at 11:45.   I had been told there would be someone there until noon and then back at 1.  No one there.   Had to call Crawford Road Animal Hospital to get someone to take Rocky in.  TWICE.
I expressed concern about care for Rocky since no one was attending the boarding dogs as promised.
I was assured they were being taken care of so I left him.
Today, July 3rd was pick up day.   Without ALL of the horribly frustrating details about the unconcerned attitudes ,  I will say it took an hour to simply pick up my pet from a place that is supposed to have an in house person available and to care for the pets left in their charge.  And then his condition was startling.

I had been trying to contact them prior to my arrival.
Calls continued to go to voicemail with a message that they were closed.
When I arrived it was obvious they were not closed because employee cars were there.
A technician from the vets office was taking in a pet at paws to relax.  I asked her to bring out Rocky when she came out.  She returns without Rocky and proceeds to walk by me with no acknowledgement.  I had to call to her to get her to stop and she mumbled that someone would bring him out.
Waiting   Waiting , Waiting....nothing.  Call again.  No answer.
Then a technician finally came out to get a dog from another car that pulled up for veterinary service.  I asked for someone to come next door to get Rocky.  Was told ok.  Nothing.  Same scenario again 10 minutes later.  And again !   Three people and getting close to an hour and no one answering a phone anywhere or following thru.
Nothing.
I understand when people are busy but this was different.  It was as if everyone considered it not their job.
Finally the FOURTH person comes out and proceeds to the Paws to Relax building to get Rocky.   She is very nice and apologizing profusely.
An apology can not fix the breakdown of this business.  It is a shame that a business created and tended wonderfully for years is taken over by incompetence and turned in to this debacle.
There is nothing that can make leaving my pet unattended and in need of water and exercise ok.

Make your decisions about your pets as you wish but I will never again subject my sweet Rocky to their ignorance and incompetence.

name: tiffany B
text: I have been taking my Shih Tzu here for 5 years and the last two grooms landed her with red swollen eyes yet noone knows why. Then she had some matted hair from rolling around and I asked the groomer not to cut her ears... again they shaved her completely BALD. IM NOT HAPPY WITH THIS! I wish I could post the picture

She then threw herself behind the kennel door ( with other dogs including a large pit) crying " she can't keep him! The lady at the desk was very nice and apologetic as we're leaving in disbelief because as said on the phone as his name was given " oh- she knows him". I was humiliated leaving as other two guest cringed against the wall like I now have a viscous man eating dog.
- it gets better. I called to talk to her. As I point out that she works with animals, SHE HUNG UP ON ME! This is a lady who would send me videos and pics of my dog playing while being boarded. So now. We have to cancel our getaway because everyone is full

text:
DO NOT TAKE YOUR PETS HERE!!

These people obviously do not know how to groom dogs properly.

Almost a year ago, I trusted them with my baby and came to find out when I got him home, that they had gashed open his stomach so badly, I had to take him to the vet to get staples..
I shouldn’t have, but I took him back later to be groomed since they knew his situation and knew to be careful in that area and all was fine.. until Friday.......

I trusted them again, but this time, received a phone call that told me that they had taken my baby to the vet for another open wound that needed to be stitched!!!!! I am so angry, and am wondering what in the world they use to cut these innocent dogs?? Are they even qualified?

Again, please do not trust this business with your animals.

name: Tiffany Pitts
text: Today was our second visit to this clinic. We took our new puppy Priscilla in. The assistant was outstanding as she was the first time. She is sure to ask questions on how potty training is going, how feeding times are going and how Priscilla's over all attitude has been and was also able to answer questions we had. The doctor was very quick but when his assistants are trained the way they are and spend the amount of time they do with each patient, I'm ok with the doctor being quick.  All in all, I would recommend this vet clinic to any of my friends and family.

text: I was at the Vet clinic when Scott was there on 10/25/18  Dr. Leonard explained that he could not suture the wounds in question due to the length of time the wounds had been exposed. They were going to take the dog to another clinic but could not get the other clinic to answer the phone so they stated they would let Dr. Leonard treat the pet. They also told the staff they did not have alot to spend on their do so they needed to keep the cost down. Dr. Leonard goes above and beyond to explain several ways to treat your pet based on your funds. I have used him for over 15 years and trust him fully with my babies! name: CBowman
text: This is the worst place to take a animal in a emergency, he flat out lied about what he was going to do to take care of our baby and what little bit he did do he did a half way job. We left straight from his office after he charged us a large amount and left our baby in a kennel all day bleeding and suffering we went straight to another vet that tried everything they could to save her and without knowing what all this man had done she talked about the grass and debris she was pulling out of her wounds that he supposedly cleaned. He talks down to the owners of the pets so I hate to think what our girl went through when we left thinking she was going to surgery, she was not given anything for pain she didn't have the first stitch in her and he released her with all her wounds open and bleeding, the other vet spent over 3 hours stitching her up and closing wounds, that's how bad she was and he released her like that, and if you still choose to use the vet you should know his anti inflammatory shot he gives combined with the other two he routinely gives causes ulcers in the stomach or shut the kidneys and liver down. This man is a lier and if it was possible I would give negative stars -*****

name: Rebecca Barkey
text: Valley Vet.. First, the place is kinda dirty, run down and stinks! I went there because its convenient to my home, but after several months of using them, its obvious they care more about making money than about your pets health!! I was already displeased about being talked down to when I asked Dr. Leonard about getting my dogs monthly flea/tick and heartworm meds from an online vendor. He told me it would only save me a few dollars, blah blah... but, he seemed to fail to realize that, they are MY dollars!! 4 months later, after paying about $45 a month for her meds through him, I finally decided to place my order through 1800petmeds and pay $60 for a 3 month supply.  Of course, the Rx has to be authorized by your vet, who we just saw less than 2 months ago and had an appointment to see again on the 17th for her final round of puppy shots and to make an appointment for her to be spayed in the coming weeks. After a week has passed, 1800petmeds has faxed them for approval 3x and I have called twice. Finally, they called my husband to say it'll be $18.50 to approve her prescription, and she will need a $25 heartworm test first??? Regardless of the fact that she's been under his regular care since the day I got her at 6 weeks old. I am switching vets. Like, today!!!! I will not be extorted by a cheap, condescending vet who cares more about making a profit off the meds than about the health of my dog. Also, at her last visit, I had her nails trimmed, it was going right along fine when he got to the 8th toenail and all of a sudden she yelped so loud and totally freaked out and he couldn't finish.. but, of course, he didn't cut or hurt her.. she just suddenly got upset.. after calmly letting him cut the first 7 nails!  The ONLY thing I can say positive I can really say about this place is there's a very nice lady that works there on Tuesdays, who seems to care about pet owners and helping them save money while caring for their fur babies.  I used to interact with her alot with my previous pup, who I lost tragically in April, but I haven't seen her much since I got the new one. I'm not sure of her name, but it wasn't the vet, or his wife, who treats my dog like she's just any old anonymous dog... didn't even bother to write her name on the folder containing all the shots, treatment info she sent home, it's just a blank card with no "pet's name" written in the blank. Same with appointment cards.. to them, she's just any random dog. Convenience isn't everything! Go elsewhere!

On top of that I was able to do Sunday pickup which most places don’t offer, and I it was nice to see how happy my pups were when I picked them up. I could see they enjoyed themselves. I will be using this place again later and the doggy daycare in the future.

name: Jeanette Young
text: Called for appointment and was told its first come first out. Bring babies in at 7am and groomers show up at 9am. I asked about waiting for them and was told it was an extra twenty dollars each to wait for them. So instead of 68.00 for both babies it would be 108 for both. This is scam. I have taken my babies to the groomers since they were old enough to go. I have NEVER EVER been charged a waiting fee. I have an appointment time bring my dogs to groomer at time of appointment and then wait in car till they are done.

resp.text: We book the babies for their spa day. The babies are done in the order that they are checked in. If a parent needs a pick up time we try to accommodate them. If a baby has special needs as in older or health issues as you explained little bit has seizures. We offer a private session ($20 more for the extra time set aside) parents stay in room with their babies. Babiess do not leave our hands until returned to the parents . We open at 7am babies are checked in brushed bathed dried walk for potty time. Finished and returned to parents. At no time do we tell a parent they cant sit in their car or in building. If 2 babies get here before yours. Then those 2 babies would already be started. Your welcome to wait its just not fair to put them 1st if others got here 1st. Every salon has different policies. Some book appointments 1 by one have no cages ect. If babies are happy with their groomers its best they stay with whom they are with. A change may trigger little bit to have another seizure. Im sorry your not happy. We want whats best for little bit new people and rushing him may not be a good thing.

text: I take both our dogs here. The other day I had to bring my Chihuahua in because he wasn’t feeling good. I called when they opened and they worked him in that morning. They let you know every step of the way what is going on and what they are doing. I even had to bring back urine and fecal samples and they called 30 minutes to an hour after I dropped them off to let me know everything was normal.

name: Jeni Crane
text:
Our family cat was having trouble urinating.  He was not acting himself and he was staying hovered on the litter box.  It was late in the day , close to closing for the clinic.  When I called in the staff was friendly and made room for me on the schedule.  When I got to the clinic the receptionist came to the car masked for the safety of clients. (Covid)  they cared for my cat and kept me informed along the way.   Mufasa our cat had crystals in his urine and a blockage.  They sedated him and took care of the problem.  He was hospitalized over the weekend and the staff and doctor Hankes kept us informed to keep us from worrying.     We now have him home and we have him on special food which for convenience we can buy there when needed.    It's been 5 days and the staff has called to check in to see how mufasa is.  I can not brag enough on how excellent the clinic is run and the loving hearts the staff has.
Bravo!

name: Sir Consumer
text:
Sadly animal care at 'All Creatures Pet Hospital', is not a priority. Today it was clear, $money$ is their priority. My son's Service Dog, needed antibiotics. Dr. Hankes stated he will give my sons dog the antibiotics he needs as he came outside to explain why. Then the itemized bill came out and I was going to be charged almost $50, for the meds!!. This was not a 'gift' as Dr. Hankes stated. The lady stated the Doctor has a bad habit of saying those things. I did not get the antibiotics due to an incredibly, and highly inflated prices. I found the same prescription from GoodRx, for less then $20 that Publix could fill. All Creatures will not send out prescriptions to help animals as I telephoned and was denied this service to help my sons Service Animal.
Although the staff seems very kind. The Vet Dr. Hankes, needs to learn better communication skills and consider helping animals by paying his license to send out prescriptions, if this is the reason. Perhaps there is an unknown underling as to why 'All Creatures Pet Hospital', chooses not to. The high mark up on prices leads me to believe other prices are inflated. Time to look for another more caring animal clinic.

name: Bryan McCullar
text: No way to make All Creatures Pet Hospital better when it’s already the best.  They have adapted to curbside service exceptionally well. While I prefer being in the office, with Akira, you have done an excellent job adapting to Covid.  Your staff is very helpful and do an amazing job.

name: Robert Miller
text: Dr. Ted and his staff are AWESOME!  They really care about your pet and take the time to make sure to answer questions and ensure a quality level of care. They will explain any treatment procedures needed and give you options for you to make an informed decision.  I highly recommend All Creatures, you will not be disappointed.

name: Jules
text: I rushed my dog here after he broke his leg at the Black Creek Dog Park on a Saturday. After they did the X-ray, they told me he would need surgery and they would have to refer him out. I wanted to take him right away, but they assured me no one would be open until Monday. They lied to my face. The office they referred me to (and who they said they work with all the time) is open 24/7. They kept him the entire weekend without giving me any updates, delayed his surgery, and charged me $900 for the unnecessary boarding. My advice is to drive the extra distance and find a reliable vet in Birmingham who won't swindle you.

resp.text:
Wow! We can't believe this review. This review is completely unfair and not honest. Her dog was seen here four months ago. We don't know why she is suddenly writing a review. First, we don't keep pets here just to make money. We did not charge her $900 for boarding. That's just not true. Hospitalization (boarding) was charged for her pet to stay here for two nights at the cost of $108.22, which included administering the pain medication and antibiotics through the weekend. We stayed late to examine, sedate (to eliviate her dogs pain while she was positioned for radiographs), administered intravenous fluids, splinted her leg, and administer pain and antibiotic medications to her dog through the weekend. All treatments that we provided were completed at her request and signature. The charges weren't any different than would have been charged at any other clinic in Birmingham. This client was not our client and she couldn't get in at any other vet in the area late on a Saturday morning just before we closed at noon.

Finally, we could not discharge her pet because he was completely asleep (sedated). It's something that vets just don't do. Bad things can happen when patients aren't kept quiet and still to rest and stabilize while under anesthesia. Also, the liability of someone driving in a hurry down the highway, slamming on their breaks and causing their dog to fly through the air and breaking it's neck is not a smart thing to allow.

Also, our honest experience had been that the surgical center doesn't see patients for routine fractures on the weekend. They are kept hospitalized at a general hospital or at the ER until Monday. The emergency hospital that is associated with the surgical center IS open 24/7 for emergencies throughout the weekend. That is probably the information that the client is referring to. This wasn't an emergency as he wasn't in shock and we had stabilized him on intravenous fluids. We literally called down there today and the technician told us that a bill for observation through the weekend for a dog with a simple fracture on intravenous fluids, antibiotics and pain medications at the emergency hospital would literally approach $2000.

So, we saved this client over $1000, saw her dog when nobody else would, stayed late and provided high quality medicine, and did what was best for her dog.

This review is not honest or accurate and should be removed.

name: Donna Elliott
text: All the staff at All Creatures Pet Hospital are wonderful! They are so helpful, friendly, knowledgeable, professional and best of all they love my furbaby, Paislee, so well that I know she is in the best care.

name: Tabbitha Turnet
text: I couldn’t ask for a better Doctor for my sweet Daisy. She had what I though where allergy issues because of her chewing at her back end.  I took her in to be examined and the staff was very nice and caring. Dr Hankes came out to speak with me after her exam and told me she actually has knee problem which explain the bitting/chewing. He referred surgery to fix the problem but with the financial struggle that covid has caused everyone we just couldn’t do it. We decided to move further with a management plan instead of surgery. He also made it very clear that if in the future we wanted to go ahead with the surgery he himself would do it. I couldn’t ask for a more understanding Vet or more helpful staff. My daisy has been doing much better since we got her on her new medication and is not in anymore pain. We have also started a savings account so we can get the surgery done asap! I would highly recommend this clinic to anyone!

name: Dana HARDEN
text: Will not use again, Mercy Animal hospital is SOOO much better. Wanted to charge a $300 deposit before they even saw my pet.

name: Joyce Wohn
text: Nothing against the clinic I don't like having to wait outside to get results, and as this was my pets first time, I like to met Dr. Otherwise she was better soon after 2 visits and meds. Thank you Joyce Wohn

name: Zane Bush
text: My wife and I have been using Dr. Hankes since 2006, he is very knowledgeable and treats us like family! He even has come to my house to do some farm calls for me to deworm and trim my goats feet. They are very fair on their prices and give us a military discount as well for all of my pets! The bloodwork they did prior to my beatrice's spay was something that i did not think was necessary, but Dr Hankes and his techs explained the reasons why she would need them and we found out she was a diabetic! Im so glad that they caught this in time now she can be treated and she is on the right dietary food that they have there and is doing so much better! We would have not known if he hadn't told us the risks she might be facing during surgery! We love him and all the girls they are the best!

text: I wish I could add pictures of screenshots but go to their Facebook and check their reviews. Dude literally compared animals to a repoed vehicle. DO NOT trust them to tell you correct pricing. They have multiple bad reviews for the same problem.

name: Melissa Brand
text:
Had  a very great experience at the clinic there
Very good and friendly specially Ashley Johnson one of the vet tech who was very good with my dog thank you very much

name: Rebecca J. McWhorter
text: I recently moved to Gardendale and chose this office because it's close to where I live and it was well-reviewed.  I have 4 pets- one I just adopted, and I took her in to establish care. The first time we went, the lady who examined my dog came out to speak to me, gave me a thorough explanation of the exam, tips on treating her skin issues, food, etc. I was told she had an ear infection and we needed to come back 2 weeks later for a re-evaluation.  She told me to come back on a Saturday so I could see the same vet again.  We did just that.  However, this time my dog was examined by Dr. Hankes.  Our appointment was at 10:30am, but we weren't greeted until 10:55.  Dr. Hankes called me instead of coming to speak to me directly (which is fine, it was raining).  He told me that the heartworm medication I was using was ineffective and I needed to do some research on it online.  I've used it for years per a veterinarian in the family's recommendation.  I still can't find poor reviews about the medication online, for the record.  He also said that he preferred to not use 1800PetMeds because it was too much trouble for him to fax in prescriptions.  I asked him to examine my dog for another concerning issue I had, he said he would, but no call from him or response.  A few minutes later, a girl came out with a credit card machine (no invoice) asking me for $70.  I was hoping to start taking all 4 of my pets here for their vet needs, but we will be returning to Avondale Animal Hospital, where the vets take the time to answer all of your questions and don't upsell medications.  The receptionists are extremely kind and friendly, but the mask ordinance is not valued whatsoever.

name: Jami Lynn
text:

Doctor Hankins and all of the staff were great and we are very grateful for you taking such good care of my baby we will be back to see you soon !

Dr. Hankes was great as well as I saw both with Skeeter. I found them be reasonable, friendly and professional.
