text: Dr Ted is the best vet in town! You will always get excellent service from Dr Ted and his caring staff.

name: Tammy Hill
text:
I am the person who bought Mercedes and was on the phone with Kb Bolds when the estimate was given and heard everything that was said. Your person said $129.00 and that includes spayed, boarding for one night and a catheter. Then you called her twice requesting that she changed her review and because she doesn't you imply that she's trying to cheat you. How can you slander my daughter because she doesn't change her review when you guys even gave her a refund because you knew that you were wrong.
It's not even about the money it's about the principal. She owns two homes (CA and AL), 4 cars, an RV, and supports herself and her children, do you really think $400 means that much to her or our family.  Not one bit. You need to stop before I get my attorneys involved.

name: Stephanie LeBerte
text: I've been to other big vets in town, & NOBODY has taken as good care of my babies than All Creatures. I was told by the "other" vet that my 5 yr old cat couldn't be saved, but All Creatures has given me options that the other vet didn't and now my baby is looking like himself again. I won't be taking my pets ANY where else from now on! 😁🐕🐾

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words!! The experience that you and Aubie had at our hospital is what we strive for each client and pet. Our motto is "We give your pets the care they deserve!"

name: Kb Bolds
text: I called to find out how much it would cost to get my dog spayed and they quoted me a price of $129 saying it included the spaying, boarding for one night, and the IV catheter. They get her vet records from my vet and told me she needed a bordatella vaccine, ok fine. I drop my dog off and they call me later to say she’s doing great. The next morning, they call and say she’s vomiting and want to give her an injection for the vomiting and I agree after them saying it’ll be $49 for it. I go to pick up my dog and the total is $415!!! I was charged $179 for the spaying, an additional fee for the IV catheter, and a stool sample that I didn’t even consent to.  I only brought her there instead of my normal vet because mine is an hour away and I have an infant but lesson learned! I will NEVER use this place again.

resp.text:
Hi Ms. Bolds,
We are extremely saddened to hear that you felt as though your experience with us was not pleasant. We strive to give our clients and their beloved pets the best experience we can offer. Your sweet baby Mercedes came in on 7/14/20 for a spay, which went perfect. Unfortunately the morning after her surgery, we noticed that she was vomiting a little, which we immediately informed you about. When we spoke with you about the vomiting, our associate suggested treatment, which you approved. The relief veterinarian that was on duty thought a fecal exam (stool sample) would help us to be sure that there were no other issues associated with her vomiting, which may have been miscommunicated (we gladly refunded this nominal fee). With this test we did find that Mercedes had hookworms, which can be associated with vomiting in many pets. We informed you of her results and suggested we deworm her. At that time you declined that service. At pick up the receptionist informed you of all charges before finalizing any payment, which at that time you agreed to with no questions asked or problems. When we spoke on 7/16/20, two days after your sweet baby had her surgical procedure to discuss your overall experience, to our surprise you told us that you were unsatisfied with our services. At that time you stated that when you first called for a price quote you were quoted $129 for the spay and were also told that included an IV catheter. This could not have happened as all of our receptionist have been on staff for quite some time and know that these procedures are not included in the surgery fee. I think what happened (because it happens a lot) is that you truly wanted these important protective measures for Mercedes but it all added up to more than you expected it to be with the treatment for the vomiting and nausea. Also, on the sheet that you filled out with the list of recommended pre-surgical procedures such as blood work and IV catheter, the price is clearly stated next to it. Plus there is a box to check yes or no as to whether you wanted the procedure or not right next to the price. Why would we ask you to chose yes or no if it was already included? We refunded you over $107 (which we didn't have to do) as a gesture of good will and you still remained upset and gave us a negative review. Bottom line is that you chose the added procedures which were performed.

name: Rebecca “Yo Momma” Saxon
text: We've only being using this veterinarian office for a few months. We got a NEW PUPPY, Miss Lola, but we've finished our puppy shots and will be getting neutered soon. We have had nothing but great experiences here. ... professional and loving staff and Veterinarian. .

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words! We always strive to take care of our clients and their beloved pets in the best way possible!

name: Karey Johnson
text: Christal, Kayla, Ashley, & Dr.Hankes went above in beyond to work patiently with my family & my aunt’s injured cat last night ! Thanks for being so amazing! I highly recommend All Creatures to anyone looking for a compassionate team to care for their fur baby... ❤️👏🏻

name: Jake McAllister
text:
Up sales!! BEWARE!!!

So to start this off please understand, I am not a medical professional, however I professionally remove and rehabilitate wildlife. I am very experienced in just about all wounds, injury's, illnesses, and human harm caused by domestic and non-domestic animals.

I have recently adopted a Dutch Shepherd, my primary vet for all of my inquires is Mercy Hospital(whom in my experience I would trust with my own life!)

My dog was a rescue, obviously covered in parasites from previous settings.

I explained the situation to the profession under review( my wife made this appointment due to the ease involving COVID-19, as mercy was booked)

Keep in  mind as a wildlife professional, I have already assessed my dogs illness.

The main reason for a vet was to acquire a  accurate heart worm test.
When handing over my beloved Dutch shepherd I caught myself telling the vets office about her harmless  Sinus Arrhythmia Heart Rhythm(very common in dogs while sleeping)

Longer story shorter, the vet personally talked to me telling me that my dog has a serious heart murmur, and attempted to sway me into the tests to verify. I already knew with no doubt there is not a heart murmur.

The doctor himself turned into a upselling salesmen attempting to use sympathy to sway me into purchasing tests. I am also a licensed insurance producer for Alabama so I am very aware of salesmen tactics, and I will say he tried. He tried very hard in his sympathetic approach claiming I need to do it now, its very serious.

I then proceeded to my normal vet at Mercy Hospital for a second opinion. My Vet listened to my dogs heart for an extended period, as well as got another in house vet to listen as well as me, we all concluded there is no murmur and the heart is in great condition, afterword's ran tests to conclude.

This goes to show, don't try to scam people on sympathy, you never know how educated the other party is in your field.

Also as a consumer warning always be weary of ratings when choosing a service, especially when life is involved, a huge amount of services either pay for reviews, or pay there employees a commission per 5 star review.

I wouldn't use a dishonest practice such as this, but I also can not say my mentioned vet is your best choice, I only speak from personal experience.

resp.text:
We unequivocally and absolutely DO NOT upsell unneeded diagnostics at this hospital! We offer and provide medically what is appropriate for each pet. We are sorry that Mr. McAllister did not have the experience at our clinic that he wanted. Due to the accusative and completely unfair nature of his review, we must clear up numerus false assertions that he has made. We have reviewed the chart from his dog's visit with the doctors and staff involved. After discussing, all involved remembered clearly the visit. To say that we use sympathy to perform inappropriate diagnostics is completely inaccurate and unfair.

First, he requested (just like any other clinic, our receptionists write down EXACTLY on the chart what the client requests for us to do) to have his dog examined because lately she had been mopey. That was his exact words. The primary request was not to have a heartworm test performed. That was a secondary request.

Secondly, his dog had a heart murmur and wasn't feeling well. That is something very different than a sinus arrhythmia which is completely benign. The further cardiac diagnostics that we offered to fully assess the heart condition in a rescue dog was completely indicated (remember this is a rescue in which the medical history is unknown) and was the best medical practice for this dog. Sometimes diagnostics that are performed come back normal and that is great but it doesn't mean that the diagnostics weren't indicated. All vet hospitals offer tests that commonly come back normal.

Both of our doctors have been out of vet school 24 and 47 years respectively and are very capable of diagnosing heart problems. They do not offer diagnostics that are not indicated but they do offer the best medical diagnostics and treatments for all pets. Do some pet owners decline to have offered diagnostics performed. Yes, every hospital experience this on a daily basis. Do some murmurs come and go? Yes. Did this happen in this case? Maybe.

Also, why did the other clinic go ahead and do the further diagnostics if it wasn't indicated?? The answer is that they were indicated! Unbelievable! The diagnostics that we offered were indicated.

So we were presented with a large breed dog that was approximately 5 years old (which makes it middle aged) and had been RESCUED. Dogs that have been rescued commonly have heartworms because they haven't receive proper care which includes heartworm prevention. If it had heartworms they very well could have and commonly can cause a heart murmur.

Bottom line: for someone untrained in the veterinary field that rescues and rehabilitates animals to accuse us of using sympathy and scamming people to increase diagnostics is deplorable. The other clinics in the area know we don't do this just as we know they don't practice this way either. This clinic has been here for over 45 years and the current owner has owned it for the past 15 years. We have a great reputation and thousands of happy clients.

This review is a good example of LIBEL and is illegal. It should be removed!

name: Willie Webster
text: Exceptional  service. Best vet in town. i drive 45 minutes just to use them for my Hercules. Received  above and beyond service from Jeni Jami and Lara. You guys rock!!!!!!! Recommend to anyone.

name: Cynthia McKinney
text: I recently went with my daughter when she took her cat in about a problem it was having. I felt we were treated very rudely by the vet. He made my daughter feel like she was mistreating her cat when I know she takes very good care of her cat. The cat got sick very quickly and he made it seem like her cat had been neglected for a long time. He seem to treat everyone rudely, we could here him get angry over trivial stuff and get mad at the people in the back. It was very unprofessional and my daughter said she is never going back. I had brought my dog in several months ago and saw Dr. Oaken and he was very nice and seemed really kind and helpful, I recommended the clinic to my daughter based on my experience with Dr. oaken, but then she got the other vet and didn't understand the difference. One of the ladies at the front desk was very sweet and nice, she was the one having a baby. I was shocked by the other lady, I found out later she was the manager. My neighbor is the one who told me she was the manager and she had had problems too. When I was there she kept putting people on the phone on hold to continue her personal conversations that had nothing to do with the business. She also gossiped the entire time I was there and even gossiped about a customer who just left!!1! That is awful and I couldn't believe someone like that would be manager. My daughter was in tears when she left, she paid over $200 to be made to feel like an awful pet parent. We will never come back and will tell other people too.

name: Lanette Parker
text: The new management isn’t very personal or friendly.  This Lady who called herself the “manager” wouldn’t sell me the medication I needed for my dog. It was all very unfortunate and unprofessional. I’ve been going there for 5 years.  I can’t believe the Doctor hired someone so mean to be around animals. She was like a terrifying virus, don’t let your fur babies around her.

resp.text: Ms. Parker:  I am glad you took the time to express your concerns about the care you received in our clinic on Saturday, February 22, 2020.  I was sorry to hear you were already having a difficult day and we have all had bad days.  I empathize with you and I hope you are doing better.  Per our conversations, your cat Lily has not been seen by a doctor since May of 2018 and it is illegal to dispense prescription medications to animals not under routine veterinary care.  This is entirely to protect, your baby, Lily.  We are still here to provide for you non-prescription items for Lily and since Ava has been seen within a year, and has a negative heartworm test, we are happy to assist with any prescription needs you may have.  I am terribly disappointed my attempts to help you within the confines of our laws and affections towards the overwhelmingly important pets we are honored to care for was interpreted as you feel.  I am here if you would like to stop by the clinic at any time and work towards understanding each other and caring for Lily and Ava.  Kind regards, Catherine West, All Creatures Pet Hospital Practice Manager

name: Roger Paul
text: Recently we began taking our three dogs to All Creatures Pet Hospital; we transitioned from another practice.  Dr. Hankes and his crew (Desiree, Allie, Catherine, Jackie, Ashley and Ellen) have been a true gift.  Sadly, one of our dogs became heartworm positive despite being on a heartworm medication. Dr. Hankes was abreast of the literature and knew that the med we were using has a failure rate against resistant strains that came to this area following Hurricane Katrina.  Dr. Hankes and his staff handled the transition of our three dogs with dignity, efficiency and professionalism.  On a busy Saturday he worked us in and again the following Monday for “round two” of treatment. We were allowed to be with our dog during treatment and every step in the treatment was explained.  We now have our dogs on a medication known to be effective against heartworm, including resistant strains.  When Nick had a complication following treatment, Dr. Hankes and crew worked him in yet again and got him back to feeling better.  It is a blessing to be in the care of a knowledgeable, kind and compassionate provider.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words about our clinic!

name: J Lo
text: Dr. Hankes and his staff are fantastic! I live in TN and was in town visiting friends and family, and needed a vet to check out my fur baby. He was able to work my puppy in last minute before the holidays for a minor surgery. He took excellent care of him and throughly answered all of my questions. He was so kind and professional. It’s so nice to have met a vet that I can trust...and that my little guy trusts, too. I wish I could find a vet like Dr. Hankes here in TN.

name: Leola Gibson
text: Dr. Hankins is very approachable and kind. He explained to me in detail all issues involving my pet.  The staff is exceptionally accommodating, especially (mommy to be). I call her that because I can't recall her name.

text: My husband and I travel a lot for his job and a couple months ago my gsp was put on medication for seizures. Unfortunately it is a controlled substance and he needs to be seen by a vet for refills. I called All creatures vet and they were able to get us in the next day. All staff was incredibly friendly and was able to work with us in finding a non controlling medication. Prices were very reasonable as well! Highly recommend this vet!!

text: They saw our little 12 year old Shitzu with a severe bacterial and ear infection when they were about to close for the day.  We were so thankful because they could have turned her away since it was actually after closing time.  Thank you for staying open to see our little angel.  She was in agony, but with your treatment, she is on the road to recovery!  Thank you so much!!!

text: My husband and I took our puppy to all creatures for his 3rd round of shots and 3rd puppy visit. After having a very bad experience at Stewart animal clinic, this place did such an AWESOME job. They took great care of my sweet buddy, even when he got super excited. The vet checked his teeth, listened to his heart, looked over his previous records and asked us questions about his health the previous shots he had gotten. I was so pleased and happy when we left. The techs and front desk staff are also so great. Kelli checked me in and let me know beforehand that they had two emergencies come in and there could be a wait, I was okay with that and filled out paperwork. The two techs that worked with buddy did such an awesome job of helping keep him calm and holding him so Dr. Hankes could look at him. All in all, I’m so pleased with all creatures. You have patients for life!

name: Christina Presnell
text: Dr. Hankes and all of his staff are awesome!  They took such good care of our furbaby!  I could not be more pleased with the care and service she/ we received!  I highly recommend All Creatures Pet Hospital! They are the best!

text: The only place I use for all of my animal's.  I love everybody that works there.

text: This is a great place. They know me by name and my pets.  Always friendly and very helpful. Will answer my questions anytime. Dr Hankes is a great vet and his assistants are wonderful.  I feel complete trust in them with my dogs. Thanks to all of you for making our visits great!

text: I'm a broke college student living in Tuscaloosa and I always take my dog to All Creatures Pet Hospital. text: The lady I spoke with on the phone was very nice! And made me feel safe about taking my dog there. We have an appointment this Thursday for my little ginger and we can't wait!!

name: April Clark
text: I can not even describe how wonderful they are here!!! A week ago we thought we were going to have to put our beloved fur baby to sleep. Our baby has IVDD and another  local vet put the wrong medication in our baby’s pill bottle and it caused him to almost seem paralyzed and caused liver damage. Doc and Denise got our baby on the proper medications and with only 4 laser therapy treatments our baby is back to normal!!! Our dog is happy, walking and no longer crying in pain!!! Our family is beyond grateful to everyone here!!

name: Damaris Leon
text:
DO NOT CROP YOUR DOGS EARS HERE!!!!!
It has been 3 months and everything possible has been done to get my dog's ears to stay up. That includes the vet constantly having the ears taped and me doing the same at hone. When they told me they start doing the ears at 13 weeks and no earlier, I was a little sceptical because every other vet said not to do it after 11 weeks but since this was my vet for a while I trusted them. But now Im left with droopy ears and I paid $450 for it.
This is just a little heads up for anyone thinking about getting their dogs ears done here. Also the receptionist (Jenny) should not be allowed to work or much less talk to the clients, she has a horrible attitude and she's very rude and nasty.
They do not call you and let you know about stuff that happens, you just find out on your own when you get there. Apparently they don't watch the animals because I've had numerous issues with my other pets where they had to have surgery for injuries that occurred at daycare. They have lost me as a client and I'm telling everyone else too!

name: Ingrid Ridgeway
text: First let me start of by saying I’m beyond thankful for Dr. Hanke and his staff at ACPH. About a week ago, we brought our puppy in because we honestly believed he had Parvo and was dying. To make a long story short, Dr. Hanke went to do a routine check and just so happened to touch our babies’ tail and we discovered it was insanely infected (he also had a serious skin infection). We scheduled him for surgery the following Monday and I must say, EVERYONE at All Creatures treated us like we were family to them! We couldn’t afford the unexpected expense of his treatment at the moment so they were willing to work with us on paying the bill. They even provide pet insurance!!—Which we are purchasing.  I can NOT thank these people enough for literally saving my fur baby, Luca. Highly recommended!!

text: All Creatures has always treated our dog (a toy poodle named Baskie) with great care. Denise, Dr. Hankes? and the rest of the staff always do a wonderful job taking care of our baby.

text: This place is AWESOME! I take my hyper puppy everyday to their affordable doggy daycare. He is worn out everytime. The staff is very friendly and is always willing to answer any questions you may have!

name: Adam Roderick
text: Took my cat in at 7:30am for some serious coughing fits that often led to vomiting. Waited until 11:30am to call and check in. When I called, they said she had been seen but that the Vet was busy and would call me back to discuss. I waited until 2:00pm before getting fed up enough to show up in person. When I showed up in person, they said she had not yet been seen (6 1/2 hours later). They said I could wait but that it would still be a while before she could be seen. The whole time I was there, I could hear loud dogs barking and making noise in the back. Lulu (our cat) is a very small cat (a runt I found when she was 4 weeks old after her mom abandoned her). Thinking about her being left in a cage for 6 1/2 hours with big loud dogs barking gets me livid. I have never written a review online before but this was enough for me to start. DO NOT take your pets here. Especially if you have cats. They are extremely careless and are very inconsiderate of mixing pets. The whole time I was checking in, a huge retriever kept sticking his face into the carrier I had Lulu in. The front desk saw that, saw me pushing him away, saw the owner doing nothing about it, and didn't say a word. Truthfully, everyone there seemed nice enough but they are incredibly sloppy and careless. And when you take charge of the care of one of my family members (yes, Lulu is a family member) sloppy isn't good enough. She deserves better.

name: TeResa Worland
text: Vet is more interested in renovations than caring for animals. He neglected my animal to the point of almost death, within 2 days the new vet and surgeon had my cat at a 50 % percent change of living. When I asked for the records someone wrote on the last pave animal was fine at last list, yet within 2 days Mr animal had a 7 inch mass in his intestines. SO lying was also a great part of his heartless treatment. And for him to write the cat was fine. Was telling me he knew be was negligence in supposedly caring for my animal. Please don't take your sick fur baby to him, he is notorious for giving steroid shots which damage animals kidneys. Love your animal enough to avoid this place,

resp.text: We are sorry that Ms. Worland felt this way about our doctor. But we know this is not the truth. Our doctor is very caring and loves pets a great deal. We have remodeled and we do apologize for any inconvenience. But that didn't change the way we cared for her pet during that time frame, which was FOUR MONTHS PRIOR TO THIS REVIEW. We offered all the diagnostics that were needed to diagnosis the cats condition but Ms. Worland declined the tests that we wanted to perform. It is difficult to diagnose a condition without the proper diagnostics being performed. From the results of the examination Ms. Worland's cat appeared stable to go home. Also, an animal's condition can change dramatically and we are always here for clients to call us if a pet's condition changes. Finally, we seldom give steroid injections and only when they are warranted.

name: Tammy Boyington
text: Thank yall for taking care of my turtle Odais 🐢🐢🐢🐢🐢🐢🐢

resp.text: Thank you very much for the nice comment! We are glad to help anytime!

name: Shane Sanders
text: They should change their name because they don't treat all creatures like their name says. Will never call them for anything again.

name: Tammy Boyington
text: Thank yall for taking care of my turtle Odais 🐢🐢🐢🐢🐢🐢🐢

resp.text: Thank you very much for the nice comment! We are glad to help anytime!

name: ZombieJonathon
text: The entire staff is extremely caring and thorough.

name: Doreen Williams
text: I carried my dog in on 7/29/14. She finally is walking better. BUT NOW ANOTHER PROBLEM my dog was trained to her potty pads. So there is my problem , what did they do to my dog. I have got to start all over again . It is much harder with a grown-up dog. The dr said it would be easier. NO!!  For what I paid them for two days they need to re-train her. I am going to talk to someone concerning this matter . MY DOG WILL NOT GO BACK THERE .

name: Shane Sanders
text: They should change their name because they don't treat all creatures like their name says. Will never call them for anything again.

name: Dakota Goodwin
text: all 3 of my pets go here and I couldn’t be more satisfied.very clean and always friendly

name: Mindy Tobin
text: So I have taken My dog here a few times. The first few visits were pretty routine. They are nice ,clean and respectful.My dog had some swollen lymphoids and he  needed blood tests and such. I couldn’t afford them right off. They went ahead and did the test and let me pay it in payments.That was really going beyond the norm when it comes to a vet. So the test came back As cancer. I am so devastated. I was so upset in the office that I had to walk out side and get my self together. When I was out there I locked my keys in the car! Grrrrr... My phone wallet and insurance information were all inside of the car as well! Dr. Fuqua called a lock smith and paid for thier services! I couldn’t believe it! He is a good doctor and an even better man! Thank u Dr. Fuqua!You are awesome!

name: Ben Baugh
text: I have been using All Creatures for the last 10 years. I have 3 Dachshunds and Dr. Hankes and his staff treat them with great care.  I live 30 minutes away and its worth the drive to get great care for my 4 legged kids.  The staff treats our dogs like family. The services they provide are priced fair and reasonable.  In fact, Dr.Hankes  has made himself available on weekends to make sure our pets are taken care off when we have emergency's from time to time.There have been instances that we have needed his expertise on a weekend and Dr. Hankes has helped us out then as well. If you need a Vet that knows what hes doing, I suggest going to All Creatures and tell them Ben sent you.

name: Kelly Daniel
text: We love visiting Dr. Hankes and his staff at All Creatures Pet Hospital! They always love on our two fur babies when we visit their office. Dr. Hankes was especially patient with our many questions when we added our most recent rescue puppy to the family. We wouldn't recommend anyone else to take care of our babies!

name: Charles McKinney
text: Fantastic staff who will remember your name and your pets. Very personable.

name: Erica LaRoman
text: Love the workers and how they treated my baby Minnie! I recommend them to any one they are nice to talk to.

name: Erica LaRoman
text: Love the workers and how they treated my baby Minnie! I recommend them to any one they are nice to talk to.

name: Jennifer Levesque
text:
We have taken our fur babies to Dr Hankes for several years now. He kept my yorkie Rudy, who had congestive heart failure, alive and happy for many more years than I thought was possible. Once Rudy did pass away Dr Hankes was very kind and understanding of our pain he even sent me flowers. My other fur baby Fi-Fi a Chihuahua mix that had been abandoned in a box on the vets door step. Knowing I was looking for a puppy he gave us a call.
When we got our next puppy Pete a few months ago from Tuscaloosa Metro Animal shelter we had dr Ted check him out and even though we had a free neuter do to us at the shelter we prefered to have Dr Hankes perform the operation because Ted uses more safety procedures and gives the animal pain meds to take at home where many vets skip things like IVs and pain control. Ted puts the animals safty and pain control as a high priority.
Dr Hankes has so much experience with animals from trauma (U.S. Army vet) to being a cat lover himself. He truly is an awsome vet.

name: Candy Rue
text: I felt very comfortable with the staff here,  I felt 100 perfect sure in placing my bull dog in all creatures hands.

name: Marie Haulsey
text: The folks at All Creatures took wonderful care of our four animals during the three years we lived in Gardendale.  Everyone was friendly, and took the time to get to know not just our animals' physical concerns, but also their personalities.  Our dogs miss their human and animal friends at day care.  In one case of emergency, Dr. Hankes and Denise stayed over an hour extra to take care of one of our animals, and in another, Dr. Hankes made a special trip back to the clinic for us.

name: Ken Levesque
text:
2-15-17:  my two dogs went to All Creatures two days ago with explosive diarreah and vomiting.  It was a horrendous weekend.  We tried Pepto Bismal and other things.  Monday morning I took my little dogs down there and was greeted warmly by the staff.  They showed genuine concern asked lots of questions.  The feeling I had was like they were family.  Then the doctor just didn't alleviate the sickness but it was almost "creepy" how he COMMANDED the situation.  My pets came home the same day and the vomiting and diarreah FULLY ERADICATED.  Animal medicine is converted into TALENTED HEALING at All Creatures Pet Hospital.  I can't another option around here.

I've taken my 2 dogs to Dr. Ted many times in the last year or so and have had nothing but a great experience.  I think he's a terrific and caring doctor and extremely knowledgeable.  All of his staff are friendly and always on the move.  They don't like it when people have to wait and they seem to work really hard to get to everyone.  I also have had my 2 pets in the kennel there and I was invited to go back and see them anytime I wanted.  I did go back to the kennels and the "condos" and they are extremely clean and beautiful.  Dr. Ted is an Afghanistan Army Veteran so I'm really glad that my vet is a real vet!  He saved my little dog from a heart problem that otherwise would have killed him.  I went to Dr. Ted when the treatments he was getting in another Vet Clinic in Gardendale weren't having any affect.  I've been please ever since.  I won't go anywhere else.  I've never thought I over paid either.

name: Billy Hughes
text: Kind and caring staff and doctor!!

name: Janet Sanders
text: On Oct 31st 2014 my 4 pound toy poodle Gabbi was dropped by my elderly father. She fell four feet on her head to a concrete floor. She was unconscious and not breathing. I rushed her to her Veterinarian Dr. Ted Hankes at All Creatures. Dr. Hankes and his staff did everything right to save her life. At the time we did not know that she had two scull fractures and a fractured vertebra. Thankfully Dr. Hankes prepared for the worst. The care he gave her kept her brain from swelling and kept her alive. After getting Gabbi stable he sent me to an emergency hospital where he continued to call and check on her the entire weekend. I am very happy to say that because of his excellent care along with many other excellent doctors my precious girl is completely well. Other than the fact she is extremely spoiled and overweight. If you could see Gabbi today you would never know the head trauma she suffered. She had a checkup today and is doing very well. I can't put into words the gratitude I feel for the entire staff at All Creatures. Thank you to everyone that had a hand in saving my baby girl. Also thanks for the care you give her older sister CoCo.  My husband and I will be eternally grateful.

name: Jan Berry
text:
Dr. Hankes, Denise, and the gang at All Creatures are tops when it comes to taking care of my baby girl, Sasha!  BYW, please don't tell Sasha she's a c-a-t.  Sasha was adopted from All Creatures 12 yrs ago as a 6 wk old when Dr. Allen held the reins and my son was a lab tech.

With the arrival of Dr. Hankes (and my son was gone to college), as you can imagine there were questions about the changes coming.  I have been so very pleased with the continuation of great services and getting to know another vet who is not only a well trained physician but truly loves all the pets that come in and wants the very best for them and their guardians.  The big bonus is that Denise (Sr. Lab Tech), who Sasha usually sees - and Sasha's very shy, has won over my baby and even has her choosing to stay with Ms. Denise instead of me after injections and exams some days.  That says A LOT for the caring ways of the team at All Creatures and who they are as crew members/care givers not just employees..

Recently, Sasha had a period of rapid weight loss after getting a kidney issue under control and Dr. Hankes found that she had a growth on her thyroid as well as fluid around her heart causing breathing issues.  She was a very sick little girl.  Dr. Hankes treated her heart and brought it under control and within a period of weeks.  Dr. Hankes, teamed with Dr. Hall, was then able to remove the problematic portion of the thyroid and the growth.  Now 4 wks after surgery, her heart is doing well - she's gaining weight and running round the house like a wild 4 yr old instead of a 12 yr old.  Dr. Hankes and Dr. Hall did a great job with the surgery, the staff let Sasha recouperate in her basket with a blanket from home and are now keeping a tabs on her for a while to make sure her remaining thyroid is functioning properly.  Thanks to their great care, we're looking forward to many more years together.

I have recommended All Creatures to my family, friends and new neighbors who are in need of a vet and have for years and hope you'll see them, too.  I don't know of any Pet Hospital around where you can get the top quality care PLUS the Super Care Givers that are on the team with Dr. Hankes at All Creatures Pet Hospital.  You'll be glad you've found one of the gems of not only Gardendale but the Greater Birmingham/Jefferson Area.

name: Kaitlyn Koehler
text: Everything and everyone was amazing!

name: Sueann Repp
text: We have been very pleased with the care that has been given to our pets.  Thank you!

name: ralph thomas
text: GREAT VETS, GREAT AND CARING EMPLYEES

name: denise Nance
text: The staff are very friendly .

name: Mary Moores
text: The owner takes really good care of your pets. Very clean and large outdoor area for the animals to run. It is shaded. I highly recommend this  place. Been taking my pets there since 2015. They are treated with tender loving care. This is also only place where cats are boarded.

name: Michael Barron
text: Our two dogs love staying here with Ms. June.  She is wonderful and takes care of each of her clients as if they were her own pets.  Our dogs are excited when we make the turn off Ross Clark Circle towards Suites & Suds.  We have used Suites & Suds numerous times for boarding and grooming. We've been pleased each and every time - with the quality of services, professionalism, and value.   I cannot recommend Suites & Suds Pet Resort enough!  FIVE STARS!

name: Debby Morhew
text: We left to California so sad we had to leave are dog behind. But she was so helpful she spent a lot of time walking me through how to use pet chatz. Got to see my dog she was doing great. She took great care of our fur baby and can not Thank her enough. Will use her when ever we have to go out of town.

name: Dennis Dabney
text: She works with my little girl  because she won't just let anyone cut her hair,,excellent very nice

name: Rebeca Gomez
text: She is always accommodating even when we have last minute plans she is flexible and friendly. Great pricing and love how she responds quickly to my inquiries!

name: Meems
text: First time we ever boarded a pet, so we were very nervous.  All our fears were eased while we called every few days to check in.  Our pup seemed very content when we picked her up.  No issues!  All the animals are well fed and cared for. The kennels are very clean and maintained.  We will definitely use again!

name: Rochelle Baxter
text:
I really enjoyed the Suite Pets.
My dear lil' pet was in desperate need of a haircut and I was very happy with the results.
I was able to book an appointment on the very same day that I called, which in my experience, was almost unheard of...
The Groomer was extremely patient, very caring, knowledgeable, detailed and precise.
The affordable cost included all of the usual grooming necessities as well as a flea bath.
I was given a tour of their very clean and orderly kept facilities to see that my pet was
made to feel comfortable while awaiting my arrival in a keeping area that was more than adequate in size.
She had also been taken outside to a fenced in area to relieve herself and given a treat.

With a cute bow and a cheerful demeanor, my sweet pet seemed to express her pleasure of the entire spa experience.
We will both be back! 🐾

name: Nick Runge
text: June has taken care of both of our dogs on multiple occasions and truely cares about your pets. Today she waited late for us to come pick up our dogs. Pricing is extremely reasonable. I highly recommend using Suite Pets any time you’re headed out of town for the weekend and need someone to watch your dogs or cats!

name: Emily Tarr
text: We Talk Dog is the best of the best! My dog seriously starts doing backflips of excitement as soon as I tell her we’re headed to WTD for daycare to “play with her friends!” The staff is so friendly and wonderful, and I am so thankful for their consistent kindness and care. They make it so easy to leave my dog for a few hours, and it’s such a weight off my mind, knowing that my dog is in the very best care. The facility is large, clean, and has so many fun things for the dogs to do! My dog gets so many compliments on how social she is, and I ALWAYS tell them—it’s 100% because of everything she’s learned at We Talk Dog! I cannot recommend this amazing doggy daycare enough. A perfect place!

name: Cynthia Kellum
text: “We Talk Dog” is the kind of pet-family-friendly places you would want to take your fur baby too. They have taken care of our five year old German Shepherd, Bruce Lee Kellum for his whole life. Bruce Lee is a family member that sleeps in our bed every night and rides in our car just about everywhere we go except on long vacations. His well done and reasonable priced grooming and cleanness is essential to my health since I have acute asthma and a lung disease called sarcoidosis. All we have to say is “ We Talk Dog” and Bruce Lee gets so happy and excited like a child does when they are ready to go to Grandma’s house. We love Bruce Lee. My husband died unexpectedly and suddenly on New Year Eve 2019 and when I  called, We Talked Dog they were so comforting to me and Bruce Lee we we came in. They gave us both a big hug and offered to help us through it.  I highly recommend them. ♥️

name: Bruce Eckert
text:
Definitely dog people !

Our golden loves to go here and always comes home tired and happy.

They all know her by name.

Squeaky clean after a bath - the best!

Highly recommend.

name: Chrissie Screven
text: The staff is always nice and accommodating. They do a wonderful job grooming my clients dogs and allow the dogs to play in daycare since they stay most of the day.

name: AJ D
text: This is the best place hands down to take your let's to get groomed.

name: Scott Gardner
text: It’s fine. But it’s a dog daycare in Irondale trying to pretend it’s in Beverly Hills. I’ve taken my dogs here a few times, and they enjoyed themselves, but the hurdles to get in are insane and not worth it.  I’ve never been able to count on this place as a reliable spot to drop my dogs off for the day as there’s always some new bar/barrier I have to clear. If you’re a working professional that needs a reliable place for your pet during the day I’d recommend looking elsewhere.

name: Kayla Charniaux
text: Grooming here is excellent and affordable. Love how they cut my standard poodle 🐩 with precision and style. Grooming is clean cut and daycare is well managed. Cute to see the dogs peep through the doggy eye holes . Would recommend for dog owners!

name: Adam Kline
text: Excellent customer service and the way they handle dogs in a social environment is outstanding. You can tell they truly care. The grooming is excellent, too.

name: Nathan Capps
text: Great place to bring your dogs! I love the staff very friendly! I would suggest bringing your dogs here:]

name: Hannah Smith
text: The absolute best place in Birmingham to board, groom, daycare, and get your dog trained. With very knowledgeable staff who absolutely LOVE dogs! Your dog will spend the majority of their time out of kennels in play groups. So when they get home they are relaxed and tired. I always know my Cora is well taken care of here.

name: Green Muse
text: Happy Dog! Fabulous people.

name: MARIA ALVAREZ
text: I took my puppy here today attempting to get her boarded for the weekend. I was told she would have a 60 min assessment to insure she was not aggressive. I called 90 min later after not hearing from them to be told I would get a call within an hour. Almost 3 hours later I got a call saying they could not accept her because of her anxiety and shyness and they only partially did the assessment. They requested I socialize her more so she loses her fear of people. She has been around about 100 people in a week… this was a complete waste of my day. I luckily have found another boarder with short notice.

resp.text:
Hi Maria,

We are so sorry that you had a negative experience with the temperament test, we always strive to meet incredibly high customer service standards and apologize if we fell short. I know that you mentioned Lunita sees lots of people all the time, but a daycare situation can be a very different environment for a dog. She was clearly overwhelmed and nervous from the beginning and even with more time to adjust it was clear that she would not thrive in a group play environment. Our temperament test is designed to not only ensure that a dog does not pose a risk to the rest of the pack but it also helps us determine if this type of daycare/boarding is the best environment for your pup. Just like people, some dogs find different situations more stressful or enjoyable than others.

When we determine that a pup might not be a good fit, we generally have a manager call to provide a thorough explanation and offer recommendations. With the additional protocols currently in place to protect our clients and staff, it sometimes it gets a little more hectic and we apologize that you did not feel assured in our assessment.

I am so glad that you found a place to board Lunita! We wish you and your pack the best, and please let us know if you would be interested in continuing this conversation.

name: Tonya Slaton
text: We Talk Dog has been a lifesaver.   Couldn't have survived my Blue Tick/Lab/Boxer mix without them.  And both of my senior dogs still have great teeth thanks to the good job the groomer does on teeth brushing.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind feedback, we have loved working with Susie! We are so glad that you and the pups are part of our pack!

name: The Dude
text: There is no dog Kacey and the staff cannot make beautiful. Just ask for Kacey, and all will be well.

name: Sylvia Booth
text: Chloe Grace, miniature poodle, got a great total grooming.  She was beautiful!  Very overall satisfaction.

name: BETH LIPPEATT
text: WTD is the BEST!  Friendly and caring staff.  My Pom loves them!

name: Phillip Phillips
text: They are the best when it comes to anything about your dog.

name: Rex McDonald
text: They were great with my nervous-nelly schnauzer. He looked great when I picked him up, and they handled him very well. Prices are reasonable, staff is great.

name: Dima Ant
text: Great service and the staff is very nice! Can be difficult to locate entrance, but after the first time it's easy.

name: Maggie Cowgill
text: We Talk Dog is an awesome place! I was a training client about a year and a half ago and now I work here as a handler. Adam is an awesome trainer and seriously made my life and my dog's life so much better! This is truly the best job I have EVER had. I can assure you that no one that comes in to the business is treated like Matthew has stated and I am sure of that. As for the poop in the floor, dogs will be dogs but we are always very prompt in cleaning up their messes and we work very hard to keep our facility clean. A temperament test is required for ALL daycare or boarding clients and that is for the safety of our handlers and our pups! We are very busy and sometimes the next available appointment for a temperament test can be a month out simply because we have a lot of people who want their pup in daycare! We love our clients and especially their pups! In the morning when our daycare/grooming/boarding clients come in we all know their names and are excited to see them! Believe me these dogs get loved on all day! We would certainly NEVER discriminate against a dog for the way it looks.  If you want to see what our clients really think please visit the We Talk Dog Facebook page!

name: Katherine Stone
text: WTD is the best! They take such good care of our dog and she’s always tired when she comes home after a day at daycare.

name: Katie Sanford
text: I love that my dogs are happy to come by. It's also nice to not be worried about your dogs while on a mini vacation because you know they're being taken care of and having fun.

name: robin myers
text:
I am so humbled that I was able to visit "We talk dog".  I have visited a lot of doggy daycares over the years. This one is by far the best.  His employees treat you animals with the top notch care.  They also are the best trained handlers in the area.  No one else in Alabama is doing what he is doing.  I would pay him double to watch after my service dog.  Jericho has never been boarded anywhere.  If you are considering boarding here please feel free to contact me for reference.  I would not recommend anywhere else.  He is a dog man and understands k9 100%
Not only that but they offer dog training, grooming, and long term boarding.   One stop shop for all your dogs needs.  Adam is one of the most skilled trainers I have worked with.  I have worked with quite a few.  No other person in the area can or is able to do what he can do.

name: Beverly M
text: I love WTD! Their daycare is the cheapest in town BUT they are also the best quality in town, which is important to me because of my limited budget. My rescue, Lilith, had some behavioral issues which have been completely eliminated since she started daycare once a week. The staff is friendly and attentive. I would recommend them to anyone!

name: Lauren Thompson
text: We love WTD! Everyone there knows my pug by name and the people there are so sweet and loving! I even get social media updates throughout the day and get to see the dogs having a blast! Great great place - would absolutely recommend. Bruce LOVES IT!!

resp.text: We LOVE Bruce! Thank you for letting us care for him!

name: TA Tipton
text:
Having a physically challenged best buddy - a small white and apricot spotted, twelve year old,  Shi-poo, it has been difficult to find someone who will groom him. He doesn't have full function from mid-spine and back. To my dismay and disappointment, more than one request to have him groomed has been denied by other businesses in the area, so I did what I could with my own "custom" scissor cut. But, "We Talk Dog" didn't give a second thought; they took him right away and their groomer did a superb job. He looks great!!! Typically, Ted has some anxiety at being handed to someone for care. Not a whimper! He knew he was in good hands.

The staff flocked around him (all of which he soaked up like a furry sponge) - even the owner makes the point of greeting Teddy whenever he goes for grooming. The groomer knows what she is doing, and has worked with dogs who have physical issues, so I have 100% confidence in this group of giving, caring people. Our next step is for Ted to have a play date there. Buckled in his cart (chariot), he can run with the best of them. Thanks, "WE TALK DOG"!!!!!!     Tim - a Huge fan

name: Katie Kimbrell
text: Very impressed! Staff went above and beyond - even sending me directly a picture of my dog playing and telling me he was happy and loved. They regularly posted pictures on social media allowing me to see that G was doing just fine while we we were gone. I highly recommend WTD.

name: GIS Specialist
text: When my Cora was little I thought I had socialized her enough. I was wrong my mixed breed puppy was scared to the point of shaking when she was around more than one dog that was not part of her home pack. She is a timid shy dog but after some hard work and awesome socialization at WTD she began to play and loved We Talk Dog. I eventually started to work there and found that the people there not only care for your dogs but have a true passion in doing so. Though I do not work there now, which a large part of me still wants to be, I have absolutely no hesitation in leaving my dog with the wonderful people here who insure that she is well fed, healthy, and plenty of time to play with her friends. I cannot express how amazing this place is so I just suggest that you go and see for yourself you will not be disappointed!!

name: jamey cash
text:
I have used We Talk Dog for years and have nothing but good things to say about the staff.  Adam is amazing and his facility is the best around.  I live over 20 miles away from his facility, but any time I need to board my dog, I take her to We Talk Dog. Even though there are five vets that offer boarding within 5 miles of my house, his facility is the only one I trust.

The thing I love most about WTD, is the fact that he has someone on site 24/7.  Your dog will never be left unattended or just “locked up” in kennel all day.  They are always playing and socializing with a great amount of supervision during the day, and at night, they have spacious kennels and someone is always staying with them.

As far as training goes, Adam helped us tremendously.  We have a German Shepherd that was starting to become fear aggressive until Adam worked with her.  He spent hours walking us through the steps to get her back on track and left us with a plan.  It was hard work, but we did everything he said.  Now, three years later, we have the most amazing dog we could have ever hoped for.  Adam is still one of our dog's favorite people in the world, and she gets so excited every time we pull in his parking lot she can barely stand it!

Overall, We Talk Dog is an amazing, clean, organized and well looked after facility, and the training is outstanding.  I think some people want a trainer to come out and "fix" their dog for them, but that can't be done.  The owner of the dog must be trained how to train the dog, and no one does this better than Adam and his staff.
I would recommend We Talk Dog's boarding and training to anyone.

name: Cassundra Shaw
text: My dog was so excited to go back after her 2 hour assessment. That it made me happy to take her. The staff was professional and nice.

name: Kelsey Brock
text: Our dog loved it there and was always well cared for by the staff.  We recently switched daycare facilities due to the over-crowding and frequent inability to register our pup to attend daycare on certain days.   Very frustrating to have to reserve a simple doggie daycare drop off days in advance to get a spot.  Especially when the purpose of doggie daycare is to meet the needs of a busy family.  Luckily WTD refunded our package.

resp.text:
Thanks so much for your feedback and for entrusting your pup with WTD. One of the things WTD is known for is putting dog safety as our number 1 priority. During peak boarding times such as Spring Break, we unfortunately have to close daycare to ensure the health and happiness of all the dogs in our care. We hate to do this but are unwilling to compromise our strict standards of care. When we know that daycare will be closed we send out an email blast, post flyers around WTD, and share it on Facebook weeks in advance. We hope that this helps people plan accordingly, and we are sorry that you did not receive those notifications. We will definitely be looking into additional ways to keep folks in the loop as we never want someone to feel frustrated with our services.

We are sorry that WTD was not the right fit in the end for you and your pup! Thanks again for the honest feedback and we wish you the best of luck!

name: Caitlin Dinken
text: The staff at We Talk Dog is fantastic! They go out of their way to make sure that your dog is happy and taken care of. My dog absolutely loves getting to play all day and comes home happy and exhausted every time!

name: Rebekah Brophy
text: These people are wonderful.  They always take great care of my doggie and they are extremely responsive and informative.  They treat their clients like family.

name: Polly Mitella Goins
text: Taking care of friend's dog.  Dog seems happy.

name: Brian W. Kittrell
text: Knowledgeable  and very caring staff.  I feel as if my dog is at home here.

name: Laura Wainwright
text: I cannot say enough positive things about WTD!!  The facility is great for the dogs and the staff is fabulous!!  One of my dogs suffers from severe car anxiety and even she wags her tail and hops right in the car when she hears we are going to "daycare"!  Thank you WTD for taking such good care of my girls!

name: Tonyia D
text: My pup LOVES WE TALK DOG and so do I!! They are a very clean and doggie loving facility!! The playground is awesome!! The pups have fans, shaded area, and pools on the playground!! The indoors is very well laid out and always very clean! The staff and the owner is AWESOME!! They also offer grooming which is also GREAT!! I have done I guess everything they have to offer with my pup!! I do doggie daycare, boarding, grooming and training!!! It's great to see the doggie's dragging their owners into the daycare wagging their tails cause they are so excited to be there!! It's is all EXCEPTIONALLY OUT OF THIS WORLD at WE TALK DOG!!! If you are looking for the perfect place for your pup look no further than WE TALK DOG!!

name: L R
text: I've been using WTD several years now for the purposes of day care and boarding of 3 dogs. I use the day care irregularly sometimes with weeks passing before I need to have my dogs attend for a day or two. Regardless of how much time has passed, the staff always recognizes me and my dogs every time - greeting us all by name upon arrival. It's like having my dogs watched by a trusted family member.  My little boxer dog, Tilley, was initially timid about going and was appropriately placed with the small dog pack group even though her sister, Gunner, was in the "big dog" group. Knowing TIlley wanted to be with Gunner, WTD carefully observed Tilley and transitioned her gradually to play with the "big dogs". And on those days when the big dogs seemed really big, WTD would place TIlley back with the little dogs. My third dog, Roman, is an 80 pound VOCAL red bone coon hound. His happy howling bay can get annoying, but all staff at WTD take delight when Roman vocalizes his joy.  I like the ease of online access to schedule boarding or day care and buying multi day packages so check out is a breeze. No fumbling with wallet or payment.

name: Matthew Sensintaffar
text: I would not take my dogs there. Unkempt, Elitist, poor business practices. We called about enrolling our rescue dog in daycare and getting some training to help integrate her into the world. Our message was taken and they never called back. so I figured I would just take her down there and have a talk with these folks. I grabbed her vet papers. I had the day off so I threw on my t-shirt and flip flops since it was a hot summer day and upon arrival we were greeted by poo on the floor of the foyer and were looked up and down by the woman standing there who promptly frowned. She talked with the peson in front of me for a bit longer while studying us with that same frown on her face and after they finished their conversation asked "May I help you?". So a little back story on this dog. She is a boston terrier who we are fostering for a local rescue. She came from a puppy mill situation and she has a scar on one eye and at the point of writing this is still pretty malnourished. She is not the prettiest dog in the world but she is sweet and everyone who knows her loves her, Except this person apparently. SO, I told her what we were interested in and the best she would offer up was a piece of paper to sign up that she never actually gave me. She then launched into the fact that we would have to schedule a temperament assessment and that the next available appointment was several weeks out. I told her we had called several weeks ago and no-one called us back. She said that she had seen my message and that their trainers were "Very busy" and that they simply could not afford the time to contact me. I explained to her the situation with this dog being a rescue and that being a foster home we were not likely to have her too very long to which she simply stuff the paper back in the manilla envelope from which it came and gave me that tilted head, high pitched, insincere, "Sorry". So we left. Precious, our rescue dog, seemed to be a little down about it so I went by our local bagel shop who makes dog treats and picked us both up a little something for the rejection. All in all though, after thinking about it, I would not take any of my dogs to this place. Between the poo on the floor, the bad attitude, and the inability to return a phone call I don't know that I would trust these folks with my family. We had hoped to get this poor little dog some extra socialization and training to help her get along with her permanent home. I guess the search continues. I may send my spouse by in work garb with one of our fluffier dogs to see how she is treated just as an experiment.

name: Sarah Ball
text: GROOMING REVIEW: As of today, this was our goldendoodle's 5th groom with We Talk Dog. We have never had any problems up to this point and all groomings have been on point. I knew when we walked in and saw that our normal groomer, Jonathan, was not in that it might be a tad different groom but I did not expect what we got. We asked for our doodle to be cut to about 1/2 inch without sacrificing his curls. Everytime Johnathon would cut him he would always take time to walk him back gently and today our doodle was roughly pulled to the back, and when we picked him up he was shaved down with no curls in sight. I called to express my frustration and try to process a remedy to the problem and the receptionist was extremely defensive, condenscing, and rude. As if we were the problem. Just FYI, Johnathon has moved to start his own pet salon in ATL so they will not be providing the same services if you have been a previous customer. We will no longer be back.

text:
Harley Bear loves Roverchase. She always starts screaming in a good way when we pull up and see the door. Ahe wants to see der fellow hairy friends. I am not getting anything for saying this I am just a happy customer
She goes 1 or 2 times a week amd the prices. Are great. Shea tired out when i pick her up. Wish they did kiddie daycare too. J/k.

name: Jim BUTTERS
text: My great Dane and I have learned a lot since coming to RoverChase. They have taught my dog and I how to have a well behaved pet. That's something you really need with a large dog.

name: Desiree Perkins
text: Took my pup here for a few months and he seemed to love it. Came home exhausted each time as if he had a blast. As far as the friendliness of the staff, that was a hit or miss, honestly. I only interacted with one lady who I think may have been the owner that was really really sweet. Anyone else would come get my puppy from the car in the mornings, not say good morning or anything, just grab him and walk inside. I don’t know a single staff member’s name because no one ever introduced themselves to me. His very first day at daycare, he came home with scratches on his face from where he’d gotten into a fight with another dog. His second time at daycare, I got a call from one of the staff members there letting me know that he’d got bitten in the head by another dog & was asked if I wanted to come pick him up. I debated on not going back after that but decided to give it the benefit of the doubt. A few weeks later, my puppy contracts Kennel Cough from there which ultimately developed into pneumonia. As any other pet parent, I was angry because every dog is supposed to be fully vaccinated in order to attend there. $250 later, thankfully, he made a full recovery. I didn’t take him back for weeks because I was paranoid. However, I moved closer to the area and decided to give it another shot. Took him back on a Friday. A few days later, I notice he isn’t feeling well & end up having to take him to the emergency vet at 2:30 am. What have you know, Kennel Cough AGAIN. He’s been sick now for almost two weeks. Needless to say, I will not be returning to this facility. Ever.

resp.text:
Hello Desiree, thank you for reaching out to us with a review.  Our COVID Care protocols have definitely made it much more difficult for our staff to interact with our clients with conversations.  We have really missed these interactions too!  We do feel strongly that our curbside dropoff/pickup services as well as our staff wearing full PPE is in the best interest of our community, our clients, and our staff - but it has definitely left us missing those close interactions and relationship building with our clients.  I'm sorry you missed that too.  We are definitely learning how to best create relationships with our clients in the climate of COVID safety.  Your feedback will be very helpful as we continue to grow and change with these new and ever changing restrictions.

I'm also sorry to hear your pup got cough while he was participating in our services.  This particular strain of cough this year has actually made several national news stories as it has shown up all over the country.  It's been a nasty strain.  We worked very closely with our veterinary advisory team to be sure we were utilizing the absolute best practices in cleanliness and disinfectant protocols throughout our facility.  We also did our best to inform all clients honestly and openly about the outbreak.  We feel very fortunate that we were able to get it under control so quickly because of our amazing veterinary advisory team.  Just like childcare, dog daycare does pose a slightly higher risk of dogs getting upper respiratory infections and sometimes GI upset in group play.  We do our very best to inform our clients of this by having it clearly stated in several places on our General Client Agreement all clients receive and sign before their first day of daycare with us.  While we sincerely wish the bordatella vaccine required by our facility was able to protect against all cough, just like the human flu vaccine, it does not.

Again, we appreciate your feedback and wish you and your dog well and that you are able to find another facility that suits your needs.  Please let us know if we can help you with any pet care needs in the future.

name: Chris Wilson
text: This is Jackson aka Jax. I was nervous initially about leaving him as a 12 week old puppy for daycare 3 days a week. I can say now it was the best move I ever made. I have been raising German Shepherds for over 25 years. However, my schedule had changed dramatically and I was driving 5 days a week, almost 8 hours a day. The thoughts of leaving him to himself home in a crate were worse than the fear for leaving him with someone else. He will be 1 year old June 21, 2018. He is by far the most well-rounded, sweetest shepherd I have had. Not a mean bone in his body. I had to take classes to learn what they taught him! I would do it again in a heartbeat. Thank you EVERYONE at Roverchase Academy for loving my boy!!

name: Emily Tompkins
text: April worked with me and my 9 month old pitbull mix to help with the pup getting over-excited and jumping up. The training time with April was great and we've seen a big improvement in the pup's behavior! I appreciated that April let us run a few minutes over to make sure all our questions were answered. Great service!

resp.text: Thank you so much!  April is amazing and we are always so happy when our clients get the opportunity to see her work her magic!

name: Christal Thompson
text: Amazing place for dogs! Great doggie daycare with lots of playtime & specialized playgroups to separate large & small dogs. Amazing trainers & kennel staff, boarding, grooming, & training classes. The owner, Abi, is highly trained & specialized in training pets, show dogs, & service dogs. The trainers, kennel manager, & groomer are all long term staff who are excellent at all they do. I really cannot say enough great things about Roverchase. 💜

name: Denise Evans
text: We brought our 1 year old German Shepherd to April at Roverchase. He  had been surrendered by former owner as "too much to handle," fostered, and then we adopted him.  He was basically a very excited overgrown puppy who was a constant handful to manage. In only one week, April taught him very important basic commands. She also helped him learn that making us happy is a rewarding experience, so she helped him globalize his education to other things.  She gave us lessons in the right way to give him commands and help reinforce good behavior. We are extremely impressed and so thrilled with our well behaved dog. Thank you, April and Roverchase!

text: They really care about keeping the dogs as happy as possible. They were so accommodating with my nervous dog Max! He seemed so much happier after staying there, as compared to our previous boarding location. With so many knowledgeable people on staff, I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend them.

text: Very nice people who clearly love animals.  A really positive environment for your pet.  It's clean and efficient with reasonable prices.

name: Jordan Davis
text: I was really excited to get my dog Mallard into training at Roverchase. That excitement was short lived however when I registered online for the Orientation class online for $50 only to find out it doesn’t exist. My wife and I drove 40 minutes for the class and were then told the class didn’t exist and no one was there to train. So they took our name and number for the owner to call us and get us a refund. The owner did end up calling a week later from an unknown number and left a voicemail. I have subsequently called six more times to try to get ahold of the owner. Most of the time I was told she was out and would call me. She never called. On one occasion I spoke to the manager and he was going to call me back. Never called me back. At this point I guess I’m using this as a $50 life lesson to never pay ahead of time (despite their policy that the price goes up if you pay there). We will have to find another trainer to get our dog certified with Hand in Paw because I will not take our dog here. They had multiple chances to remedy the situation and we were understanding of the issue, but the lack of customer service and failure to even call back or refund us is unacceptable.

name: Jeremy Knezek
text:
This review only describes the Puppy Class and I have no other experience with this establishment. However, I found the classes to be ridiculously unprofessional. They charge the going rate, $20 per 1 hour class session for 4 sessions. However, the classes never start on time, the instructor is rarely prepared with her materials, generally she is looking at her phone several times per lesson and disappearing into another room, and 2 of 4 classes ended early. The instructor clearly knows how to train a dog, however this place has a business model based on you dropping your dog off for several weeks and a thousand or more dollars later they train the dog for you. I have no doubt she is exceptionally effective in that environment, but these classes where you learn to train your dog yourself are over complicated, incoherent, and lack any kind of structure. I feel like mostly they are used to get you to admit you need to drop your dog off with them, because that is the only way the dog will get trained. I've had better experiences with a big box store training, and that isn't saying much. There are significantly better training places for the same money with a whole lot less agenda. Hint: look for a non-profit dog obedience and training club.

Response to the owner: First off, it's labelled a rolling class. You don't need to offer "a missed class at no extra charge", that's part of it being rolling. You show up for 4 classes, whether they are consecutive or not, and I checked ahead of time to make sure that was the case. Second, in 3 of the 4 classes there was no socialization time unless you count the period of time we all waited in the office while the instructor was running late. Ending the class early twice ensured no socialization time. You offer 14 days of board and train for $1100 and 28 days for $2100. Both of those cost more than the thousand dollars I put in my review. So yes, you offer both cheaper and more expensive options, personally I think I hit the middle pretty well with my review. I put in my review you charge the going rate. I don't dispute that. I also said the trainer knows how to train dogs, the trainer simply didn't do much to help people learn to train their own dogs in this one class. Finally, the Birmingham Obedience and Training club is a non-profit club, they just aren't a charity. I find the vast majority of your response to my review to have been very misleading.

resp.text:
Hello Jeremy,
I'm sorry you didn't enjoy your Puppy Kindergarten class with us.  I am the owner of Roverchase and you have not contacted us in your 4 week training so, until this review, I was unaware of your unhappiness.  I have called the other puppies in your class period and they have all been exceptionally pleased and have all signed up for additional group classes for continuing education, so I am a bit confused.  I would be more than happy to talk with you about your experience.  I do know that your dog missed a week of Puppy Kindergarten and we were very happy to accommodate your schedule and allow you to makeup your missed class at no additional charge.     Puppy Kindergarten is a socialization and basic manners class and not a true "training skills" course.  This is very clear in the description of our class on our website as well as the materials given in each class period.  As mentioned previously, I would be more than happy to speak with you about your experience, please feel free to call the front office at 205-332-0203 and ask for Abigail.  Also, as a note, our day-training program is our most popular program but it is hardly "thousands of dollars."  Most of our clients spend between $250-450 for four weeks of all day training where they drop their dog of several times a week each week.  This is hardly "thousands of dollars" and is, in fact, some of the best prices is town.  Our Puppy Kindergarten class is also priced competitively with "the big box store" but you are taking this class from one of the most highly experienced and certified canine behavioral consultants in the city.  As an additional note, our prices are less expensive then the Obedience Club in our town, which is not non-profit.  Birmingham does not have a non-profit training club.

name: Bart Masters
text:
I've had an incredible experience with Roverchase. I have found the staff to be incredibly knowledgeable and effective with training. I love their philosophy and approach. They are extremely professional but also fun.

Bringing a puppy into a home with 2 small children is no small task, so their daycare package has been a life-saver for me when I'm too worn out to wear my puppy out. They wear him out, train him, and act as advisors.

You can tell they really care about, not only the dogs, but you as a customer. It's a pleasure every time I go there, and I love supporting a local, small business that's doing great work in my own backyard.

name: Bert Davi
text: Hard to find a place to trust with your four legged family members. This is that place for us highly reccomend

name: Kevin Auer
text:
I have gone through Roverchase group training which was fantastic. Aidan did a great job and took time to work on things that I specifically was having trouble with when there was not a big class. I took my dog to daycare and the owner, Abigail, stated that he was having trouble and recommended a behaviorist that comes to Roverchase every Thursday and Saturday. The price was $400 dollars which I was happy to pay because I really wanted the best for Blue (my dog). We talked with the behaviorist for about an hour and that was the end of the session. The behaviorist did not really teach or show me anything that I did not already know. The behaviorist did not even see the behavior that I was having trouble with but yet she was quick to write out a treatment plan. The behaviorist did say that I would need to do private lessons with Abigail which is not included in the cost. So for $400 dollars I talked to a lady for an hour. This is a big scam and I am really troubled that Roverchase would be a part of it.

My appointment lasted 1 hour. We left right after 5 and the appointment started at 4. So go back and check your cameras again. Yes, I was happy to pay the $400 dollars which I stated previously. But I was under the impression that I would get useful information and more than just talking to a "Behaviorist" for an hour. Again, how can she, the behaviorist, tell me what is the cause and real problem without even seeing the behavior. I even emailed the behaviorist trying to get a refund because that was not what I was expecting. Not even wanting a full refund because I understand that she did take time out of her day to meet with me. But I think she can keep the $80 dollars deposit and refund the $320 since I do not need her "expertise" any longer. But she has not responded to my email which she specifically stated was the best/fastest way to communicate with her. And as far as reviews need to be left honestly and in good faith...I did that. You decided to lie on your response by saying that you checked the cameras and that I was there for a little under 2 hours. Your cameras times are off or you lied. I told you that I actually loved Roverchase. I even recommended people go to y'all which only one of them did but one is better than none. But I do still think that I was scammed.

resp.text:
Dear Mr. Auer,
I’m so surprised to read your review regarding your experience with Blue and Dr. Beihunko, Roverchase, and the chain of events you described.  I appreciate you giving me the opportunity on this public platform to respond.
Firstly, I’m so glad you were pleased with your group classes at Roverchase with our trainer Aidan.  He’s so talented and our clients just adore him.  I’ll be sure to pass on your praise.  Thank you.
To address your concerns regarding your experience with Dr. Biehunko, I will do my best to address them in an organized fashion.
-  I recommended Blue see Dr. Biehunko when Blue presented to daycare last week after a 5 month absence from Roverchase.  Prior to Blue’s absence, we had discussed at length Blue’s increase reactivity and dog related aggression and you indicated you did not want to address it with us at that time but wanted to work with it on your own.  We advised against it.  When you presented last week, Blue came for a day of daycare and was significantly worse in all behaviors.  I recommended a consultation with Alabama’s only Veterinary Behaviorist, Dr. Biehunko.  I thoroughly explained how Dr. Beihunko’s consultations worked, that they were $400 and for that price you received a 1.5-2hr consultation with her expertise and she would make a diagnosis, a treatment plan, and then have 6 months of medical management and follow up.  I was very clear with you that there was no doubt that Blue would need additional lessons with me and that it would be at additional cost.  You remarked that you felt this price was fair for her experience and expertise and made your appointment for later in the week
- I do rounds with Dr. Biehunko each day for our shared clients.  She had already been thoroughly briefed on Blue’s behavior at Roverchase the day he returned as well as my notes from his behavior in December when we last saw him.
- Your consultation with Dr. Biehunko was just barely under 2hrs.  I checked the time stamp on our cameras
- In your consultation with Dr. Biehunko we were all very surprised to hear that you insisted that Blue has received no training outside of his training at Roverchase.  In fact, you insisted this was true even when specifically questioned about this by Dr. Biehunko and the Roverchase trainers who sat in on the session with you.  As I’m sure you know, it’s extremely difficult for any doctor to communicate effectively and efficiently with a client when that client willfully withholds pertinent information from that doctor that impedes the treatment plan.  As you can see from the attached screen shots, not only has Blue been in training with another trainer, but it was for the very issue he was presenting for.
- Finally, since your consultation was just over 72 hours ago, and we are very clear that treatment plans can take 2-4 weeks to become effective, it’s hard to understand how you can already be so unhappy with your results.
I certainly believe that pet owners are allowed to train and handle their pets as they see fit and that there are many fits available for many different preferences.  However, I hope we can both agree that reviews need to be left honestly and in good faith and this one has some glaring issues.  I hope, in light of this, and in light of you many months of happiness with Roverchase, you will consider removing it.  We certainly wish you and Blue only the very best and much success in all of your endeavors.

Best wishes,

Abigail Witthauer
Roverchase
